original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sbyin pa gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de nyid kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sbyin pa gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de nyid kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang /
translated: That very [practice] free from the attention of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is the armor itself of the perfection of morality.üîΩThat very [practice] with patience, desire, and close investigation for the dharmas of the knowledge of all aspects is the armor itself of the perfection of patience.

original: de nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams la bzod pa dang 'dod pa dang nye bar rtog pa nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de la dang por nye bar gnas pa la ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams la bzod pa dang 'dod pa dang nye bar rtog pa nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de la dang por nye bar gnas pa la ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the initial close placement.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is in the second moment and so on.

original: rnam pa du mar nye bar rtog pa ni nye bar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar nye bar rtog pa ni nye bar rtog pa'o //
translated: Close investigation is the investigation of many aspects.

original: de nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de nyid kyi theg pa gzhan gyi sems dang ma 'dres pa'i rtse gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang / de nyid kyi theg pa gzhan gyi sems dang ma 'dres pa'i rtse gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha nyid dang /
translated: The dedication of the roots of virtue to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment by the one-pointedness of that very one that is not mixed with the thought of another vehicle is the armor of the perfection of concentration.

original: de nyid kyi sgyu mar byas pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pas sbyin par bya ba dang gtong ba po dang len pa po mi dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgyu mar byas pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pas sbyin par bya ba dang gtong ba po dang len pa po mi dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The non-observation of the object given, the giver, and the receiver by the one who abides in the perception of illusion of that very one is the armor of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni go cha'i sgrub pa las sbyin pa'i go cha ste drug tshan dang po'o /
analyzed: 'di ni go cha'i sgrub pa las sbyin pa'i go cha ste drug tshan dang po'o /
translated: This is the armor of giving from the practice of armor, the first set of six.

original: // / de nyid kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: // / de nyid kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the one who practices the perfection of morality in that same way.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the one who practices the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o /
translated: The fourth is the one who practices the perfection of effort.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lnga ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lnga ba'o //
translated: The fifth is the one who practices the perfection of meditation.

original: de nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the one who practices the perfection of wisdom in that same way.

original: de ltar na 'de dag drug tshan drug tu 'gyur yang go cha rnam pa drug tu chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / spyin pa la sogs par chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa drug bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na 'de dag drug tshan drug tu 'gyur yang go cha rnam pa drug tu chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / spyin pa la sogs par chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa drug bshad pa yin no /
translated: Thus, although there are six groups of six, the six types of armor are explained as the establishment of the six types of armor because they are similar in being armor and because they are similar in being generosity and so on.

original: // / @65b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mtshan ma med par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa ni go cha sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo chen po nyid shes par byed pa'i don can go cha chen po nyid
analyzed: // / @65b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mtshan ma med par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa ni go cha sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo chen po nyid shes par byed pa'i don can go cha chen po nyid
translated: It is the great armor that has the meaning of causing the knowledge of the great nature of the accomplishment of armor.

original: dang / de bsam gtan la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug par yang byed cing de dag gi ro myang bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: dang / de bsam gtan la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug par yang byed cing de dag gi ro myang bar yang mi byed /
translated: It is also the one who enters into the meditative concentrations and so forth, but does not taste their flavor.

original: de dag gis 'phrog par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis 'phrog par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: It is also the one who is not carried away by them.

original: de dag gi dbang gis skye ba'ang ma yin pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mthong bas gnas kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya bas go cha'i sgrub pa'i yongs su 'dzin pas thabs mkhas pa chen po nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don can thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis skye ba'ang ma yin pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mthong bas gnas kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya bas go cha'i sgrub pa'i yongs su 'dzin pas thabs mkhas pa chen po nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don can thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan
translated: It is not that they are born by the power of those, and it is not that by seeing the concentrations and so on, emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness they actualize the limit of reality.üîΩThis is the meaning of the great skill in means that is the armor practice and the great skill in means that is the armor practice is the great perfection of wisdom armor and the great spiritual friend who is the armor practice.

original: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha chen po nyid dang / go cha'i sgrub pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po nyid du shes par byed pa'i don can phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyis sangs rgyas rnams bsngags pa la sogs pas gsungs pas de ltar go cha'i sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha chen po nyid dang / go cha'i sgrub pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po nyid du shes par byed pa'i don can phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyis sangs rgyas rnams bsngags pa la sogs pas gsungs pas de ltar go cha'i sgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the praise of the buddhas of the worlds of the ten directions and so on. Thus it is the armor practice.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa bshad zin to /
translated: The armor practice has been explained.

original: // /'jug pa'i sgrub pa brjod par bya ba yin pa las de ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: // /'jug pa'i sgrub pa brjod par bya ba yin pa las de ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: This practice is twofold:

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang de la 'dzeg pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang de la 'dzeg pa'o //
translated: engaging in the Great Vehicle and ascending it.

original: de lta bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la 'jug ba dang theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par 'gyur ba yin zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde 'ang don gcig pa nyid kyis 'jug pa ni 'dzeg pa yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la 'jug ba dang theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par 'gyur ba yin zhes gsungs pa yin no // de 'ang don gcig pa nyid kyis 'jug pa ni 'dzeg pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable P≈´r·πáa, by how much is a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva said to engage in the Great Vehicle and ascend the Great Vehicle?‚ÄùüîΩSince the meaning of ‚Äúengaging‚Äù and ‚Äúascending‚Äù is the same, ascending is engaging, and engaging is ascending.

original: 'dzeg pa'ang 'jug pa yin no zhes ming gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dzeg pa'ang 'jug pa yin no zhes ming gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Since the terms are used interchangeably, there are nine aspects of engaging in the Great Vehicle.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa dang / tshad med pa'i 'jug pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'jug pa dang / tshad med pa'i 'jug pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is the engagement in the concentrations and formless absorptions, the engagement in the six perfections, the engagement in the ƒÅrya path, the engagement in the immeasurables, the engagement in the state of nonapprehending,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / @66a * //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / @66a * //
translated: the engagement in the three spheres being utterly pure, the engagement in the object,

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: the engagement in the six kinds of superknowledge, and the engagement in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThus:üîΩThe concentrations, the formless realm, generosity and so forth,üîΩthe path, love and so forth,üîΩthe state of nonapprehending,

original: des na / bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: des na / bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: the three spheres being utterly pure,üîΩthe object, the six kinds of superknowledge,üîΩthe way of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
translated: the practice of engagement in the Great Vehicle,

original: 'dzeg pa yin pa shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin pa shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
translated: should be known as the steps.

original: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug nga dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug cing ldang ba na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug nga dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni / byang chub sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug cing ldang ba na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na
translated: The entry into the concentrations and formless meditative attainments is

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the great bodhisattva's practice of the perfection of generosity. When he enters and emerges from the concentrations and formless meditative attainments through the aspects, signs, and aspects of space, he dedicates those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by means of the Great Vehicle.

original: nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa can gyi lam yongs su 'dzin pas rnam pa med pa dang rtags med pa dang mtshan ma med pa zhes byaüîΩba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa can gyi lam yongs su 'dzin pas rnam pa med pa dang rtags med pa dang mtshan ma med pa zhes byaüîΩba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aspects, signs, and aspects of space means that by upholding the path that has the aspect of the non-apprehension of all phenomena as being like space, it is said to be without aspect, sign, or mark.

original: de la rnam pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspects are

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the aspects of the first absorption, beginning with isolated from attachment, isolated from evil and unwholesome states.üîΩThe signs are

original: rtags ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the signs of the first absorption, beginning with conceptualization, investigation, and so on.

original: mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni /
translated: The special point is

original: dben pa la skyes pa'i dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa la skyes pa'i dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the special point of the first absorption, beginning with the joy and pleasure born of isolation.

original: yang na sa 'og ma dang gong ma'i dbye bas rags pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sa 'og ma dang gong ma'i dbye bas rags pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the aspects are coarseness and calmness, etc., distinguished in terms of lower and higher stages.

original: sa gang la tshor ba gang zhig yod pa de ni rtags so //
analyzed: sa gang la tshor ba gang zhig yod pa de ni rtags so //
translated: The signs are

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dben pa'i ro myang ba ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dben pa'i ro myang ba ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: the signs of the first absorption, beginning with the feeling of equanimity.üîΩThe special point isüîΩthe special point of the first absorption, beginning with the joy and pleasure born of isolation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sems cad rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jug pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas sems cad rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po
translated: The practice of the six perfections is the teaching of the Dharma by bodhisattvas in order to eliminate the defilements of sentient beings, with attention connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: nyid dang / de nyid kyi theg pa dman pa'i sems kyi go skabs mi 'byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen @66b po nyid dang / de nyid kyi sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam pa'i yid la byed pa de dag la bzod pa dang /
analyzed: nyid dang / de nyid kyi theg pa dman pa'i sems kyi go skabs mi 'byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen @66b po nyid dang / de nyid kyi sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam pa'i yid la byed pa de dag la bzod pa dang /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the perfection of morality, because it does not allow the opportunity for the thought of the Lesser Vehicle to arise.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the perfection of patience, because it is patient,üîΩand because it is the mental attention of those who think, ‚ÄúI will teach the Dharma in order to eliminate the reactive emotions of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi brtson 'grus mi gtong ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la dmigs su med pa'i rnam par snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi brtson 'grus mi gtong ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la dmigs su med pa'i rnam par snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang /
translated: The meditative attainment of that very meditative stabilization and formless absorptions without reference point is the Great Vehicle of the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa ni /
translated: The analytical discrimination of the branches of that very first meditative stabilization and so on in terms of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, peace, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the Great Vehicle of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The entry to the ƒÅrya path

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gsum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gsum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Mahayana of the great bodhisattvas is the cultivation of all aspects of the thirty-seven factors for enlightenment and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa ni rnam par sgom pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa ni rnam par sgom pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: All aspects refers to the cultivation of the thirty-seven factors for enlightenment subsumed by the three knowledges.

original: tshad med pa bzhi la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi la 'jug pa ni /
translated: Engaging in the four immeasurables:

original: yang tshad med pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / theg pa dman pa'i sems dang ma 'dres pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: yang tshad med pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / theg pa dman pa'i sems dang ma 'dres pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of all aspects that engages in the four immeasurables is the Mahayana of the perfection of patience, the non-mixing of the mind of the lower vehicle is the Mahayana of the perfection of effort,

original: bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba ni shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi @67a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba ni shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi @67a * //
translated: The four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / sems can rnams la zag pa zad pa stobs par byed pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid po nyid dang / tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang /üîΩtshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / sems can rnams la zag pa zad pa stobs par byed pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid po nyid dang / tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim pa'i bye brag 'di ni tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim pa'i bye brag 'di ni tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four immeasurables are the perfection of meditation, the Great Vehicle.

original: de nyid la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The

original: yang tshad med pa dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang tshad med pa dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The immeasurables are four in number.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te /
translated: loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are called the immeasurable of loving kindness, etc.

original: de dag re re zhing rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag re re zhing rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Each of them has three types:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //üîΩde la sems can la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o // de la sems can la dmigs pa ni /
translated: those that take sentient beings as their object, those that take phenomena as their object, and those that take no object.

original: rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Those that take sentient beings as their object are established by four causes:

original: nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: the cause of establishing them, the cause of their antidote to the opposing side, the cause of their purification, and the cause of their retention of their result.

original: nye bar sgrub pas ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pas ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How are they established by the cause of establishing them?

original: bde ba gsum nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba gsum nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they establish the three kinds of happiness.

original: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba nye bar sgrub par nye bar gnas pas so //
analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba nye bar sgrub par nye bar gnas pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa mind endowed with loving-kindness‚Äù means that it is present in a form that is capable of accomplishing both benefit and happiness.

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvast‚Äù means that it is capable of accomplishing happiness in the desire realm.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù means that it is present in the form of the first and second meditative absorptions, which are accompanied by joy.

original: de gnyis la ni dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis la ni dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because joy is present in those two meditative states.

original: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnon-dual‚Äù means that it is present in the form of the third meditative absorption, which is free of joy.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang dga' ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang dga' ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that meditative absorption is free of both suffering and joy.

original: mi gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa yin no //
translated: It is non-dual.

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pa'i phyir na chu bo chen po bzhi'i chu 'dus pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pa'i phyir na chu bo chen po bzhi'i chu 'dus pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù means that it is immeasurable in terms of its result, like the combined waters of the four great rivers.

original: de nyid tshad med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid tshad med par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that it is immeasurable in this sense.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the bliss, etc. as described.

original: de ltar na @67b zhig nye bar sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na @67b zhig nye bar sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the establishment of the proximate bases.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po las ji ltar zhe na 'khor med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po las ji ltar zhe na 'khor med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it the counteragent to the adverse elements? He says: it is without a retinue;

original: mi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gnod byed pa'i gnod byed kyi gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gnod byed pa'i gnod byed kyi gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: because it is the counteragent to the harm caused by the establishment of the undesirable and the non-establishment of the desirable.

original: rnam par dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it purified?

original: 'gran zla med pas sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pas sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is without obscuration because it is without rivals;

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dag zhi bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dag zhi bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the pacification of the obscurations of sleep, torpor, excitedness and regret, respectively, and because it is well-equipoised.

original: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it the possessor of the result?

original: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is without injury;

original: gzugs dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnod pa med pa nyid ci rigs par yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnod pa med pa nyid ci rigs par yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is the result of the form realm and the desire realm, which is either the result of natural outcome or the result of conscious effort, which is not harmful.üîΩThus, the object of meditation on loving-kindness is sentient beings, and it is presented in four ways.üîΩThe object of meditation on compassion is sentient beings, and it is presented in four ways.üîΩThe object of meditation on empathetic joy is sentient beings, and it is presented in four ways.

original: de ltar re zhig sems can la dmigs ba rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sems can la dmigs ba rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: The object of meditation on equanimity is sentient beings, and it is presented in four ways.üîΩThe object of meditation on the object of meditation on the four noble truths is the four noble truths.üîΩThe object of meditation on the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment is the thirty-seven factors that are aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe object of meditation on the emptiness of the internal is the internal.üîΩThe object of meditation on the emptiness of the external is the external.üîΩThe object of meditation on the emptiness of the internal and external is the internal and external.üîΩThe object of meditation on emptiness is emptiness.üîΩThe object of meditation on the great is the great.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni thams cad du rjes su song ba zhes bya ba gcig gis yin te /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni thams cad du rjes su song ba zhes bya ba gcig gis yin te /
translated: The object of meditation on the ultimate is the ultimate.üîΩThe object of meditation on the conditioned is the conditioned.üîΩThe object of meditation on the unconditioned is the unconditioned.üîΩThe object of meditation on the infinite is the infinite.üîΩThe object of meditation on the all-pervading is the all-pervading.üîΩThe object of meditation on the signless is the signless.üîΩThe object of meditation on the wishless is the wishless.üîΩThe object of meditation on the absence of production is the absence of production.

original: thams cad rjes su song ba nyid kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i chos ji snyed pa ste /üîΩgang dag la sems can du gdags par byed pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su song ba nyid kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i chos ji snyed pa ste / gang dag la sems can du gdags par byed pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of meditation on the absence of cessation is the absence of cessation.üîΩThe object of meditation on the absence of defilement is the absence of defilement.

original: shin tu bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni shin tu goms par byas ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni shin tu goms par byas ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of meditation on the absence of purification is the absence of purification.üîΩThe object of meditation on the insubstantiality of the individual is the insubstantiality of the individual.üîΩThe object of meditation on the insubstantiality of phenomena is the insubstantiality of phenomena.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: The object of meditation on the insubstantiality of both is the insubstantiality of both.üîΩThe object of meditation on the absence of intrinsic nature is the absence of intrinsic nature.üîΩThe object of meditation on the absence of attributes is the absence of attributes.üîΩThe object of meditation on the absence of expectancy is the absence of

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa gtsor gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa gtsor gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpervading the realm of space‚Äù means that the objective support is the characteristic of the world that is dominated by the selflessness of dharmas.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' yongs su chad pa med pa nyid kyang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' yongs su chad pa med pa nyid kyang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúreaching to the ends of the sky‚Äù means that the objective support is not limited to a particular place.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the objective support is limitless.

original: yang byams pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sems des ci zhig byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten khyab par byas shing nye bar bsgrubs nas rnam par gnas pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang byams pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sems des ci zhig byed ce na / de'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten khyab par byas shing nye bar bsgrubs nas rnam par gnas pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: What does the mind of loving-kindness, etc., do?üîΩTherefore, it is said, ‚Äúpervading and filling the entire world with a thought of loving-kindness, etc., and remaining in it.‚Äù

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa'i bsam pa'i lhag par mos pas khyab par byang chub par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa'i bsam pa'i lhag par mos pas khyab par byang chub par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should pervade the entire world with a thought of loving-kindness, etc., and remain in it.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mang po'i don la yin par shes par @68a * //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mang po'i don la yin par shes par @68a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúentire‚Äù means ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: byas te / sems can la sogs pa'i don la mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas te / sems can la sogs pa'i don la mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit of sentient beings and so on is limitless.

original: ring po ni padm'a wa ti zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ring po ni padm'a wa ti zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Long is like Padmavati.

original: nye bar bsgrubs nas rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni blo de dang nye bar yang dag spong nas de'i nye bar 'tshe ba gtan nas spong bzhes bya ba'i don nye bar bsgyur ba dang / khams rnams kyi don ni 'di nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs nas rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni blo de dang nye bar yang dag spong nas de'i nye bar 'tshe ba gtan nas spong bzhes bya ba'i don nye bar bsgyur ba dang / khams rnams kyi don ni 'di nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having accomplished, it abides is the meaning of the term, because having accomplished that awareness, one completely abandons the harm of that.

original: snying rje la sogs pa'ang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa'ang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Compassion and so on should be explained in the same way.

original: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement that possesses nonapprehension is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni nang la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi bar du shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pas te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni nang la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi bar du shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pas te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The great vehicle of the bodhisattva, the great being, is the knowledge of the inner and so on up to emptiness, but not by way of apprehending them.

original: chos thams cad la sems rnam par g-yeng ba med par mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / stong ba ma yin pa dang / mtshon ma dang / smon pa bzlog zla dang bcas pa rnams la shes pa mi 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la sems rnam par g-yeng ba med par mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / stong ba ma yin pa dang / mtshon ma dang / smon pa bzlog zla dang bcas pa rnams la shes pa mi 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge that does not engage with permanence, happiness, self, peace, emptiness, signs, or wishes, as well as their opposites.üîΩIt is the knowledge that does not observe the three times, the three realms, the mundane, the contaminated, or conditioned phenomena, as well as their opposites.

original: dus gsum po rnams dang / khams gsum pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos bzlog zla dang bcas pa rnams la mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dus gsum po rnams dang / khams gsum pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos bzlog zla dang bcas pa rnams la mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po yin pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the Great Vehicle that is endowed with the knowledge that does not observe the three spheres.

original: de la zhugs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge that is engaged with that.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement that is pure of the three spheres is as follows.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas kyang des spyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas kyang des spyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they abide in the perfection of generosity, but they do not observe generosity.

original: len pa po 'ang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no /üîΩched du bya ba'i 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: len pa po 'ang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa ni /
translated: The statement the appropriator is also not observed and so on is made in order to destroy the meditation on the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pas bsgom pa gzhig pa'i don du stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du sgom pa dang /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pas bsgom pa gzhig pa'i don du stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du sgom pa dang /
translated: The engagement of the object of intention is stated in order to destroy the meditation on the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom by means of a mind not conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects, in order to meditate on the factors of enlightenment and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha,

original: de dag ming tsam du shes par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la zhugs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ming tsam du shes par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de la zhugs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and in order to know that they are mere names, that it is the Great Vehicle, and that one has entered it.

original: bsgom pa gzhig pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i @68b don gzhig pa'i ched du yin gyi byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i don du ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa gzhig pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i @68b don gzhig pa'i ched du yin gyi byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i don du ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: In order to destroy the meditation means in order to destroy the object of meditation, not in order to meditate on the factors of enlightenment and so on.

original: sgom pa'i don yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgom pa'i don yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of meditation?

original: dngos po med pa'i don ni sgom pa'i don te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i don ni sgom pa'i don te /
translated: The object of meditation is the object of non-entityness.

original: gang gi phyir sgom pa med pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgom pa med pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no such thing as non-meditation.

original: de lta yin kyang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin kyang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Even so, the factors of enlightenment and so on are also.

original: mngon par shes pa drug la 'jug ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug la 'jug ba ni /
translated: The entry into the six superknowledges is as follows:

original: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: up to the seat of enlightenment, he brings beings to maturity by perfecting the superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From world system to world system, he goes from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te theg pa de dang nam yang mi 'bral ba'i lus yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te theg pa de dang nam yang mi 'bral ba'i lus yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and he takes on a body that never departs from that vehicle, standing on the stage of nonduality.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The entry into the knowledge of all aspects is as follows:

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang sngon chad ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas gang yin pa rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de'i ming smos pa mdzad cing de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags ba sgrogs shing
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang sngon chad ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas gang yin pa rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de'i ming smos pa mdzad cing de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags ba sgrogs shing
translated: And the buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions proclaim and speak their praises, saying, ‚ÄúIn all the worlds, this one will attain omniscience and turn the wheel of the Dharma.‚ÄùüîΩAnd they speak of them in the Mahayana.

original: dbyangs brjod pa mdzad pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩ'jug pa'i sgrub ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: dbyangs brjod pa mdzad pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no // 'jug pa'i sgrub ba bshad zin to /

original: // / tshogs kyi sgrub pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / tshogs kyi sgrub pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The practice of the accumulations will now be explained.

original: de ni snying rje chen po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi dbye bas rnam pa bcu bdun du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni snying rje chen po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi dbye bas rnam pa bcu bdun du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said that this has seventeen types, divided according to the accumulations of great compassion and so on.

original: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzugs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzugs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
translated: wisdom and merit,üîΩthe path, the forms, the ten levels,üîΩand the accumulations of antidotes

original: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: are to be understood as the stages.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is so.

original: de la tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The seventeen accumulations of antidotes are as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: snying rje chen po'i @69a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i @69a * //
translated: the accumulation of great compassion,üîΩthe accumulation of generosity,üîΩthe accumulation of discipline,üîΩthe accumulation of patience,üîΩthe accumulation of diligence,

original: tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang / bzod pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / shes rab kyi tshogs dang / zhi gnas kyi tshogs dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs dang /
analyzed: tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang / bzod pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang / shes rab kyi tshogs dang / zhi gnas kyi tshogs dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs dang /
translated: the accumulation of concentration,üîΩthe accumulation of wisdom,üîΩthe accumulation of calm abiding,üîΩthe accumulation of insight,

original: zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi tshogs dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / lam gyi tshogs dang / gzungs kyi tshogs dang / sa'i tshogs dang / gnyen po'i tshogs so //

translated: the accumulation of the path,üîΩthe accumulation of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´,üîΩthe accumulation of the levels,üîΩand the accumulation of antidotes.

original: de la snying rje chen po'i tshogs ni /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po'i tshogs ni /
translated: Regarding that, the accumulation of great compassion is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: Blessed One, the one who has donned the great armor,üîΩthe one who has donned the great armor‚Äîto what extent is it said that a great bodhisattva has donned the great armor?‚Äù

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba la sgra de 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba la sgra de 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: Here, the reason for using the term ‚Äúaccumulation‚Äù is presented from the perspective of accomplishing the accumulations.

original: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangga'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams rang gi lus kyi 'od kyis snang bar byas nas sdug bsngal de dang de zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangga'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams rang gi lus kyi 'od kyis snang bar byas nas sdug bsngal de dang de zhi bar byas te /
translated: And in each of the ten directions, the light of his body illuminates the sentient beings in the hells, the animal realms, and the worlds of the Lord of Death, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and it pacifies their respective sufferings.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs ba la phyag 'tshal ba thob nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs ba la phyag 'tshal ba thob nas /
translated: Having attained the state of paying homage to the Buddha and so forth,

original: rkyen des de rnams ngan song de rnams las langs par gyur nas byang chub pa'i bar du sangs rgyas mnyes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i skye ba yang dag par 'dzin pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rkyen des de rnams ngan song de rnams las langs par gyur nas byang chub pa'i bar du sangs rgyas mnyes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i skye ba yang dag par 'dzin pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: by that condition, those sentient beings rise up from the lower realms and until they attain enlightenment, they take up births that are in accord with pleasing the Buddha.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam pa can ni thugs rje yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam pa can ni thugs rje yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because compassion has the aspect of being free from suffering.

original: sbyin pa'i tshogs ni zas la sogs pa'i yo byad de dang de 'dod pa'i sems can de snyed nyid la zas la sogs pa'i yo byad de dang de byin nas chos bstan pas byang chub kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mi 'bral bar byedüîΩpa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩtshul khrims kyi tshogs ni sems can de snyed kho na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang bsam gtan la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshogs ni zas la sogs pa'i yo byad de dang de 'dod pa'i sems can de snyed nyid la zas la sogs pa'i yo byad de dang de byin nas chos bstan pas byang chub kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mi 'bral bar byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no // tshul khrims kyi tshogs ni sems can de snyed kho na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang bsam gtan la sogs pa nas /
translated: The accumulation of generosity is the giving of food and so on to just those sentient beings who desire those things and teaching them the Dharma, by which they are not separated from the six perfections up to enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar la rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar la rab tu 'god de /
translated: The accumulation of ethical discipline is establishing just those sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions, the meditative concentrations and so on up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha and teaching them the Dharma, by which they are not separated from that up to complete enlightenment.üîΩThe accumulation of patience is teaching the Dharma to those sentient beings who are engaged in the activities of mƒÅras and who are frightened by the sufferings of samsara, by which they are not separated from that up to complete enlightenment.

original: sems can de dag kyang rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar du chos bstan pa de dang mi 'bral ba nyid kyis gang gsungs @69b pa yin no //üîΩbzod pa'i tshogs ni /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar du chos bstan pa de dang mi 'bral ba nyid kyis gang gsungs @69b pa yin no //üîΩbzod pa'i tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of effort is teaching the Dharma to those sentient beings who are lazy and who do not have the intention to practice virtue, by which they are not separated from that up to complete enlightenment.

original: gal te sems can thams cad kyis bdag la rdo dang / dbyug pa dang / bong ba dang / khu tshar dang / lag cas brdeg cing mtshon gyis 'debs kyang de la bdag gis 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed dar mi bya'o snyam zhing rang gi bzod pa la rab tu 'god pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad kyis bdag la rdo dang / dbyug pa dang / bong ba dang / khu tshar dang / lag cas brdeg cing mtshon gyis 'debs kyang de la bdag gis 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed dar mi bya'o snyam zhing rang gi bzod pa la rab tu 'god pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Even if all sentient beings were to strike me with clods, sticks, and swords, I would not become angry even for a moment.

original: brtson 'grub kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grub kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of effort is

original: sems can de tsam pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus la len du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god do zhes bya ba yang dag par nges par sbyor ba dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang /
analyzed: sems can de tsam pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus la len du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god do zhes bya ba yang dag par nges par sbyor ba dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang /
translated: the effort to engage in physical and mental effort by generating the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects for the sake of just those sentient beings.

original: ma tshang ba med pa'i don brjod pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa'i don brjod pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is what is taught by the expressions of the perfect application, perfect placement, and perfect meaning.

original: bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of meditation isüîΩthe meditation that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sems can de snyed kho na rang nyid la gnas nas chos 'ga' yang rnam par g-yeng ba dang rnam par g-yeng ba med par ma mthong bar rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar du de nyid la 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god pa dag gis gang gsungs pa
analyzed: sems can de snyed kho na rang nyid la gnas nas chos 'ga' yang rnam par g-yeng ba dang rnam par g-yeng ba med par ma mthong bar rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar du de nyid la 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god pa dag gis gang gsungs pa
translated: He causes those very sentient beings to be established in himself, and he causes them to take up, enter into, and be established in that very state until they are fully enlightened, without seeing any dharma that is distracted or not distracted.

original: yin no // shes rab kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: yin no // shes rab kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is

original: ji ltar rang nyid chos gang la'ang tshu rol dang pha rol mi dmigs pa de bzhin du de rnams kyang de la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid chos gang la'ang tshu rol dang pha rol mi dmigs pa de bzhin du de rnams kyang de la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: just as he himself does not observe a near shore or a far shore in any dharma, so he causes those sentient beings to take up, enter into, and be established in that very state.

original: de la tshu rol ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshu rol ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The near shore is sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: 'di tsam du byis pa rnams nyams dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam du byis pa rnams nyams dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is delightful for fools to that extent.

original: pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The far shore is nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: rang gi don lhur len pa rnams sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du nyams dga' ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi don lhur len pa rnams sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du nyams dga' ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because it is delightful for those who are intent on their own aim to practice the perfection of effort.

original: zhi ngas kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: zhi ngas kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of peace and insight is as follows:üîΩJust as one is established in the perfections, one causes that many sentient beings to take up and enter into the six perfections, the factors of enlightenment, the fruit of stream enterer and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha,

original: yang bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang /
translated: and one establishes them in buddhahood.üîΩThe accumulation of merit is to focus on the unquantified realm of sentient beings and to establish them in the ten virtues.üîΩThe accumulation of peace and insight is to focus on the quantified realm of sentient beings and to establish them in the perfections.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la yang dag par len du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god pa sems can gyi khams 'di tsam zhes yongs su ma chad pa la dmigs pa rnams dang / de'i tshe bde ba nye bar sgrub pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /üîΩ@70a * // ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod ba can spro ba dang ldan /
