translated: The accumulation of peace and insight is to focus on the unquantified realm of sentient beings and to establish them in the perfections.

original: pa rtse gcig tu gtong bas ni gcig tu nges pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir na gcig tu nges pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gtan du ba'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa rtse gcig tu gtong bas ni gcig tu nges pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir na gcig tu nges pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gtan du ba'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since one obtains a result that is definitely one by means of one pointed concentration, one obtains the bliss that is definitely one by means of the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, which is the bliss that is lasting.

original: lhag mthong gi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
translated: The accumulations for insight are stated:

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mtshan bu mkhas pa zhig gis zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis pas sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi rkyen can ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yin no zhes rang gi ngo bo yod par dogs pa 'gog par byed de de ni
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mtshan bu mkhas pa zhig gis zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis pas sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi rkyen can ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yin no zhes rang gi ngo bo yod par dogs pa 'gog par byed de de ni
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúa magician or a magician‚Äôs apprentice who is skilled‚Äù refute the doubt that the nature of the illusion exists in its own entity as something that is not dependent on other conditions.

original: snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is merely an appearance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the reality of phenomena is like the reality of an illusion.

original: rtog ge'i yongs su g-yo bas sun phyung ba'i 'jig rten pa thams cad ni sang ba tsam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog ge'i yongs su g-yo bas sun phyung ba'i 'jig rten pa thams cad ni sang ba tsam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all worldly people who are refuted by the movements of sophistry realize that they are merely empty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,üîΩBlessed One, according to how I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na sgyur ma'i chos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na sgyur ma'i chos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: if the reality of an illusion is taken to be empty of its own characteristics,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen pos ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen pos ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas /
translated: it should be understood that a great bodhisattva, for the sake of emptiness of its own characteristics, dons the armor of donning no armor.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi don zhes pa gsal bar bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi don zhes pa gsal bar bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: From the point of beginning to clarify the meaning of the elder Subh≈´ti,

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: why is it so?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang /
translated: The armor of the Great Vehicle is the understanding that the aggregates of form and so on, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the aspects of enlightenment, and so on up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the bodhisattvas,üîΩand the armors of the Great Vehicle are empty of the aggregates of form and so on up to and including the armor of the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i go cha rnams gzugs la sogs pa nas theg pa chen po'i go cha'i bar rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs kyis med pa'i go chag bgos pa nyid du rjes su shes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i go cha rnams gzugs la sogs pa nas theg pa chen po'i go cha'i bar rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs kyis med pa'i go chag bgos pa nyid du rjes su shes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byed pa po nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang go cha'i ched du @70b bya ba sems can ma byas rnam par ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i yul 'gog pa dang / phung po la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byed pa po nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang go cha'i ched du @70b bya ba sems can ma byas rnam par ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i yul 'gog pa dang / phung po la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: Because the agent is not observed. The object of the agent is stopped with the words ‚Äúsentient beings who are not made, not unmade, not activated.‚Äù

original: bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rnams dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan la sogs pa nas de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang / byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rnams dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan la sogs pa nas de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang / byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir byed pa dang /
translated: Since the self, sentient beings, and so on, as well as dreams, echoes, and so on, up to and including suchness and unerring suchness, enlightenment, and omniscience are utterly unobservable, they are the agent.üîΩ

original: rnam bar byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa 'gog par byed pa'i rten du 'gyur ba'i byed pa po rang dbang can gcig 'gog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la mi byed /
analyzed: rnam bar byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa 'gog par byed pa'i rten du 'gyur ba'i byed pa po rang dbang can gcig 'gog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no // de la mi byed /
translated: Because the self, sentient beings, and so on, and dreams, echoes, and so on, up to and including suchness and unmistaken suchness, and also awakening and omniscience are utterly unobservable, the meaning of what was taught is to stop the one who is the independent agent that creates, produces, and fully creates.üîΩThere is no creation.

original: rnam par mi byed /
analyzed: rnam par mi byed /
translated: There is no production.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba'i tshig gsum ni rim pa bzhin du go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnams su ma byung ba las byung ba dang de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba'i tshig gsum ni rim pa bzhin du go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnams su ma byung ba las byung ba dang de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three phrases ‚Äúnot instigated‚Äù are to be known as referring to the armor, the engagement, and the practice of the stores, respectively, in the sense of their arising from what has not arisen, their special development, and their approach to the attainment of the result.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi'o zhes de dag tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi'o zhes de dag tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said in those passages, ‚ÄúThe Lord, the Bodhisattva should be known as the one who takes up the armor of non-armor.‚Äù

original: zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi tshogs ni //
analyzed: zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi tshogs ni //
translated: The practice of the path of union is

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mi byed rnam par mi byed /üîΩmngon par 'du mi byed de /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mi byed rnam par mi byed / mngon par 'du mi byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not do, do not perform, do not instigate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not apprehended at all.‚Äù

original: zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning of the passage, ‚ÄúAccording to my understanding of the meaning of this statement,‚Äù

original: med pa dang / dpen pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du ma byas dang / ma skyes pa nyi de shen tu mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa can rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: med pa dang / dpen pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du ma byas dang / ma skyes pa nyi de shen tu mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa can rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa nas /
translated: The emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of isolation, the emptiness of non-production, the emptiness of non-ceasing, the emptiness of non-affliction, the emptiness of purification, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of other things, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-observation, the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of isolation, the emptiness of non-production, the emptiness of peace, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of marks, the emptiness of wishes, the emptiness of non-manifestation, and the emptiness of non-arising.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma bcings ma grol ba nyid bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo bkag pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la yongs su 'dzin pa zhes rab dang snying rje dag gis go rims bzhin du @71a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma bcings ma grol ba nyid bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo bkag pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la yongs su 'dzin pa zhes rab dang snying rje dag gis go rims bzhin du @71a * //
translated: The emptiness of the aggregates, the emptiness of the constituents, the emptiness of the sense-spheres, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the elements, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the ears and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the nose and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the tongue and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the body and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of phenomena and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth, the emptiness of the sense-

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma bcings ma grol bar shes par bya ba na 'di ni gnas nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma bcings ma grol bar shes par bya ba na 'di ni gnas nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: When it is said that the bodhisattvas should be understood as neither bound nor liberated, this is said to be their very nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rjes ni srid pa ji srid du sems can la phan 'dogs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rjes ni srid pa ji srid du sems can la phan 'dogs la /
translated: By means of their compassion, the bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings for as long as samsara lasts.

original: shes rab kyis ni der gnas su zin kyang 'khor bar chags par mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni der gnas su zin kyang 'khor bar chags par mi byed do //
translated: And by means of their wisdom, even though they remain in samsara, they do not become attached to it.

original: blo yis der ni gnas pa yang //
analyzed: blo yis der ni gnas pa yang //
translated: Even though they remain there by their intellect,

original: brkam pa rjes su 'brel ma yin //
analyzed: brkam pa rjes su 'brel ma yin //
translated: they are not attached to it.

original: dran pa yis ni bcings pa'i sems //
analyzed: dran pa yis ni bcings pa'i sems //
translated: The mind bound by mindfulness

original: phyir rol du ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir rol du ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: does not go out to the external.üîΩCorrectly engaging in discernment,

original: so sor rtog la yang dag reg / sa ni gnas su 'dren par byed //
analyzed: so sor rtog la yang dag reg / sa ni gnas su 'dren par byed //
translated: they are led to the stages.üîΩSome, based on the mind of birth,

original: skyes pa'i sems la brten pa dang// 'ga' zhig mya ngan 'da' bar 'dod //üîΩ'jig rten legs pa la brten pa //
analyzed: skyes pa'i sems la brten pa dang// 'ga' zhig mya ngan 'da' bar 'dod // 'jig rten legs pa la brten pa //
translated: wish for nirvana.üîΩSome, based on worldly goodness,

original: 'ga' zhig 'khor bar 'khor bar 'dod //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'khor bar 'khor bar 'dod //
translated: wish to revolve in samsara.

original: ces so // shes rab snying rje'i sbyor ba dang // de dag phan tshun tha mi dad pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'das pa dang / sbyor ba shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; rtogs pa po'i dbang du mdzad nas spyor ba gang gis ji ltar gang nas gang du gang zhig nges par 'byung zhes bya ba'i dri ba lnga gang zhes bya bar nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: ces so // shes rab snying rje'i sbyor ba dang // de dag phan tshun tha mi dad pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'das pa dang / sbyor ba shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; rtogs pa po'i dbang du mdzad nas spyor ba gang gis ji ltar gang nas gang du gang zhig nges par 'byung zhes bya ba'i dri ba lnga gang zhes bya bar nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the question, ‚ÄúBy what application, how, where, from where, and what is one liberated?‚Äù he engages by way of indicating ‚Äúwhat‚Äù in the following.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni gang lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what is the Mahayana of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva?

original: ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
translated: By what extent does one enter the Mahayana?

original: gang nas gang byung ba lags /
analyzed: gang nas gang byung ba lags /
translated: From where does it arise?

original: gang du gnas par gyur pa lags /
analyzed: gang du gnas par gyur pa lags /
translated: Where does it come to rest?

original: theg pa de ni gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa de ni gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the vehicle that will arise?‚Äù

original: de la dri ba dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la dri ba dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: With regard to that, beginning with the first question,

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so so la bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing gzhan dag la yang dag par len
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so so la bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing gzhan dag la yang dag par len
translated: The accumulation of skill in means is the perfections, which the bodhisattvas, the great beings, who are endowed with the gnosis of omniscience, practice individually by way of not objectifying a self and which they also cause others to take up.

original: du 'jug pa theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: du 'jug pa theg pa chen po yin pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it is taught by the Great Vehicle.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam pa nyi shu'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam pa nyi shu'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The accumulation of gnosis should be understood as having the characteristics of the twenty aspects of the gnosis of emptiness.

original: de la stong pa nyid rnam pa nyid shu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid rnam pa nyid shu ni 'di yin te /
translated: The twenty aspects of emptiness are as follows.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do zhes gang @71b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do zhes gang @71b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the internal is that the internal phenomena, such as the eyes, are by nature not permanent and not annihilated.

original: de la ku ta ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ku ta ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: Here, kuta means accumulation.

original: de la yod pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir aa ku ta stha ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir aa ku ta stha ste /
translated: Since the nature of existence is not perceived in that, it is akutastha,

original: tshogs par gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs par gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: not remaining in a collection.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de ci zhig 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de ci zhig 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: What is such as that could be destroyed?

original: des na 'jig pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no destruction.

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid de nyid ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin no //üîΩphyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid de nyid ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin no // phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The very nature of the Dharma, which is without origination and without cessation, is its nature.üîΩThe external, such as form, has that kind of nature, therefore it is external emptiness.

original: phyi nang gi chos skye mched rnams de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos skye mched rnams de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The internal and external dharmas, the sense-spheres, have that kind of nature, therefore it is internal and external emptiness.

original: de la nang gi skye mched ni dbang po drug gi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi skye mched ni dbang po drug gi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the internal sense-spheres are those subsumed by the nature of the six sense-faculties.

original: phyi ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ni yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The external are those subsumed by the nature of the objects.

original: phyin nang gi dbang po'i rten gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin nang gi dbang po'i rten gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The internal and external are those subsumed by the nature of the support of the sense-faculties.

original: de ni sems kyis zin pa'i phyir nang yin la /
analyzed: de ni sems kyis zin pa'i phyir nang yin la /
translated: It is internal because it is grasped by the mind.

original: dbang pos ma bsdus pa'i phyir na phyi rol yang yin no //
analyzed: dbang pos ma bsdus pa'i phyir na phyi rol yang yin no //
translated: It is external because it is not included in the sense-fields.

original: chos kyi skye mched la ni rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gsum char yang srid pa des na 'di'i nang la sogs pa ni ji ltar srid pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched la ni rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gsum char yang srid pa des na 'di'i nang la sogs pa ni ji ltar srid pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: All three of these conceptualizations are possible in the sense-field of mental objects. Therefore, the internal, etc., should be understood as they are possible.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of all dharmas by way of the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa ni 'dir chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin la /üîΩdes kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa ni 'dir chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin la / des kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: The knowledge that all dharmas are empty is the emptiness of all dharmas here.

original: der 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is the emptiness of emptiness, because it is in order to abandon the conceptualization that grasps that.

original: phyogs bcu pa ni phyogs kyis stong pa nyid kyis na chen po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu pa ni phyogs kyis stong pa nyid kyis na chen po stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the directions by way of the emptiness of the directions.

original: de rnams ni dbyibs shing tu che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni dbyibs shing tu che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the great because of their extremely great shape.

original: don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pas na don dam pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pas na don dam pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The ultimate, nirvana, is empty of the nature of the meaning of nirvana, and thus it is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de ni bral ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bral ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is just a separation.

original: 'dus byas dang khams gsum po ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis 'dus byas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang khams gsum po ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis 'dus byas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The compounded and the three realms are the emptiness of the compounded, by the emptiness of the desire realm and so on.

original: de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis na gnyen por nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis na gnyen por nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of the unaccomplished alone, they are capable of being antidotes.

original: 'dus ma byas skye ba med ba dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa'i don ni de nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa ste /üîΩskye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gdags @72a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas skye ba med ba dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa'i don ni de nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa ste / skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gdags @72a * //
translated: The uncompounded, which has the meaning of being unborn, unceasing, and unchanging from a state of rest, is the emptiness of the uncompounded because it is empty of itself.

original: ba'i rgyu mtshan bzlog zla skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i rgyu mtshan bzlog zla skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasons for designating the unborn and so on are reversed, the opposites of the unborn and so on do not exist.

original: mtha' ni mthas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' las 'das pa nyid kyis na mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' ni mthas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' las 'das pa nyid kyis na mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since the end is empty of the end, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes is due to the transcendence of extremes.

original: mtha' ni cha ste /
analyzed: mtha' ni cha ste /
translated: The end is a part.

original: de la de dag char rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por rnam par gzhag pa de ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dag gis dbus na cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la de dag char rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por rnam par gzhag pa de ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dag gis dbus na cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Since there is nothing whatsoever in the middle that is free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, the cause for the determination of the entity of a sign in the division of those parts is empty of the end.

original: thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams ni des stong pa nyid yin pas thog ma dang tham med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams ni des stong pa nyid yin pas thog ma dang tham med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: Since the beginning, middle, and end are empty of themselves, there is the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless.

original: thog ma la sogs pa ni chos nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis gtan du pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma la sogs pa ni chos nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis gtan du pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the beginning and so on are the ultimate, they are permanent.

original: dor ba dang spangs ba btang ba'i mtshan nyid can dor ba las bzlog pa ni dor ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: dor ba dang spangs ba btang ba'i mtshan nyid can dor ba las bzlog pa ni dor ba med pa yin la /
translated: What is to be discarded is characterized by being abandoned and relinquished. The opposite of what is to be discarded is what is not to be discarded.

original: de ni des stong pa'i phyir dor ba med pa stong pa ste /
analyzed: de ni des stong pa'i phyir dor ba med pa stong pa ste /
translated: Since that is empty of itself, there is the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: dor pa'i bya ba rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis na dor ba med pa gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dor pa'i bya ba rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis na dor ba med pa gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the action of discarding is not intrinsic, it is untenable as the reason for the designation of nondiscarding.

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma byas pas ni rang bzhin yin la de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma byas pas ni rang bzhin yin la de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa ste /
translated: Since it is not created by any noble being, it is intrinsic, and since it is empty of that, it is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par 'gyur ba dang rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i gnod pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par 'gyur ba dang rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i gnod pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not harmed by the transformation or nontransformation of the conditioned, it is free of faults.

original: chos ni chos kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos ni chos kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: Since phenomena are empty of phenomena, it is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi tshogs thams cad ni phan tshun ltos pa can nyid yin pas na rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi tshogs thams cad ni phan tshun ltos pa can nyid yin pas na rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all phenomena, whether conditioned or unconditioned, are mutually dependent, they do not exist by way of their intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa ni des stong pa nyid yin pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa ni des stong pa nyid yin pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics is that the defining characteristics of form, etc., are empty of themselves,

original: mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i spyi dang khyad par ni btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'das pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams la phan tshun bzlog par mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i spyi dang khyad par ni btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams la phan tshun bzlog par mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: because the universals and particulars that are posited as characteristics are mere labels.

original: dus gsum gyi ngo bo ni btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi ngo bo ni btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is that past, etc., phenomena are not apprehended in the three times, because the nature of the three times is a mere label.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /üîΩrten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas sbyor ba ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas sbyor ba ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is that phenomena produced by practice do not have an inherent nature,

original: tshogs pa tsam @72b kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam @72b kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are dependently arisen. The practice is empty of that, because the nature of a mere collection is the essential nature of a non-entity.

original: nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid de /
translated: Since the entity characterized by appropriation is empty of that, it is the emptiness of entities.

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap.‚Äù

original: spungs pa'i don ni med pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos por 'gyur bar mi 'os pas so //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni med pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos por 'gyur bar mi 'os pas so //
translated: Since the meaning of ‚Äúheap‚Äù is non-existence, it is not suitable to be an entity characterized by appropriation.

original: dngos po med pa 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa ni des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: Since the non-existent unconditioned, such as space, is empty of that, it is the emptiness of non-entities.

original: dngos po'i chos sgrib par byed pa la sogs pa la de btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos sgrib par byed pa la sogs pa la de btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is imputed to the phenomena of entities that obscure and so on.

original: rang bzhin stong pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the emptiness of nature,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi shes pa dang mthong bsam byas pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi shes pa dang mthong bsam byas pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: since it is the object of the knowledge and vision of the noble ones, it is the emptiness of its own entity.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba gsal bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because knowledge and vision clarify the meaning of reality just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the Tathagatas arise, this reality of phenomena remains.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa zhes bya bas byed pa po gzhan gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa zhes bya bas byed pa po gzhan gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
translated: Since it is empty of another agent, it is the emptiness of another entity.

original: stong pa nyid la brten pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa ni 'phong ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la brten pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa ni 'phong ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya bas so //
translated: The person who relies on emptiness is only a fool.

original: phyogs 'dis ni skabs go rims ma tshang ba rnams kyi skabs kyi don la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni skabs go rims ma tshang ba rnams kyi skabs kyi don la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: By this section, one should also explain the meaning of the context of the remaining ones in the order in which they occur.

original: de dag ni gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig kho na rjod par byed pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig kho na rjod par byed pa yin gyi //
translated: They say that these only express emptiness by way of negation.üîΩThey say that there is no order of realization at all in these.

original: 'di dag la mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na ni skabs kyi don kho na brjod par bya ba yin gyi //
analyzed: 'di dag la mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na ni skabs kyi don kho na brjod par bya ba yin gyi //
translated: In that case, one should only explain the meaning of the context.

original: gtso bo bstan bcos kyi don ni ma yin par 'gyur ba des na stong pa nyid kyi skabs rnams spong ba dang 'gro bar bya ba'i go rims dang bral ba'i phyir ched du bya ba nyams pa'i ngo bor ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo bstan bcos kyi don ni ma yin par 'gyur ba des na stong pa nyid kyi skabs rnams spong ba dang 'gro bar bya ba'i go rims dang bral ba'i phyir ched du bya ba nyams pa'i ngo bor ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the occasion of emptiness is devoid of the order of abandoning and going, it is shown to be the essence of the failure of the purpose.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa de ci gzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa de ci gzhi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the object of nondiscriminating knowledge?

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: gal te gang zhig dmigs par bya ba de ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig dmigs par bya ba de ni med pa yin te /
translated: If that which is to be perceived does not exist,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: stong pa nyid 'di'ang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs par bya ba yin pas med pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di'ang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs par bya ba yin pas med pa yin no //
translated: Since this emptiness is the object of nondiscriminating knowledge, it does not exist.

original: des na chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena would exist.

original: des na 'dir cung zad dpyad par bya'o //üîΩdmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir 'di ni rnam @73a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir cung zad dpyad par bya'o // dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir 'di ni rnam @73a * //
translated: Therefore, this should be investigated a little.

original: par mi rtog pa'i ye shes tsam yin te /
analyzed: par mi rtog pa'i ye shes tsam yin te /
translated: Since it is devoid of all objects, it is merely nondiscriminating knowledge.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say: Emptiness does not exist as anything.

original: kha cig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha gnyis la gnas pa nyid kyis na cha gcig la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩzhes 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha gnyis la gnas pa nyid kyis na cha gcig la dmigs pa ni ma yin no // zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some say: It is not observed in one part, since it is based in the two parts of object and subject.üîΩSome say: It is observed in all phenomena, since it is the object of the wisdom of meditative equipoise.

original: la lan re de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩ'di nyid ni rigs te /
analyzed: la lan re de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid la dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro // 'di nyid ni rigs te /
translated: Some say: It is observed in the emptiness of all phenomena by nature.

original: gang zhig chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs pa der ni 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs pa der ni 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is correct, since it is observed in the emptiness of all phenomena by nature.

original: dper na rmi lam du shes pa rta la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam du shes pa rta la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the consciousness in a dream that observes horses and so on that are empty of nature.

original: snga ma'i phyogs dag la ni ye shes dngos po med pa'i spyod yul can du 'gyur zhing stong pa nyid kyang 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i phyogs dag la ni ye shes dngos po med pa'i spyod yul can du 'gyur zhing stong pa nyid kyang 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the former positions, wisdom would have a nonexistent object field and emptiness would be a conditioned phenomenon.

original: phyogs gsum pa la nyes pa brjod zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa la nyes pa brjod zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't it said that the third position is faulty?

original: nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault,

original: gang gi phyir gsod pa po bsad na lhas byin slar 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsod pa po bsad na lhas byin slar 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because if the killer is killed, then Devadatta would not return.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brjod par bya ba mang du yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brjod par bya ba mang du yang yod mod kyi /
translated: There are many topics to be expressed by the divisions of mirror-like wisdom and so on,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni phyogs tsam yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni phyogs tsam yin no //
translated: but this presentation of the accumulation of wisdom is just a fraction.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of merit is as follows.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, moreover, in this Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas, it is as follows:üîΩThe samƒÅdhi called Heroic Progress, up to the samƒÅdhi called Space-like Freedom and Non-attachment,

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba nas nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba dang / de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na ;
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba nas nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba dang / de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na ;
translated: Among them, what is the samƒÅdhi called Heroic Progress?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the samƒÅdhi by which one experiences the domain of all samƒÅdhis.

original: 'di ni dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar ting nge 'dzin brgya rtsa gcig bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar ting nge 'dzin brgya rtsa gcig bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught by the demonstration of one hundred and one samadhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mos pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i rnam pa gsum rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i rten yin pas na bsod nams mang po skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mos pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i rnam pa gsum rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i rten yin pas na bsod nams mang po skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samadhi is the cause of the generation of much merit because it is the basis for the three aspects of mental orientation, such as aspiration, which are brought to the highest degree.

original: lam gyi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
translated: The accumulations of the path are taught:üîΩSubhuti, furthermore, the Mahayana of the bodhisattva is as follows:üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness.üîΩThe four right efforts.üîΩThe four legs of manifestation.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five faculties.üîΩThe five powers.üîΩThe seven aspects of enlightenment.üîΩThe noble eightfold path.üîΩThe three gateways to liberation.üîΩThe eight deliverances.üîΩThe nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe ten universal bases.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe four fearlessnesses.üîΩThe four individual correct knowledges.üîΩThe eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha.üîΩThe thirty-seven dharmas on the side of enlightenment are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba nas @73b brtsams te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba nas @73b brtsams te /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the result of the path.

original: bslab pa las 'da' ba'i g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gnas pa dpa' dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam rnams dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / kun du lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba'i bya ba rnams la shes bzhin du spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bslab pa las 'da' ba'i g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gnas pa dpa' dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam rnams dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / kun du lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba'i bya ba rnams la shes bzhin du spyod pa dang /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness and so forth are the accumulations of the path.üîΩThe ten powers of a Tathagata and so forth are the

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la rdza mkhan gyi dpes ring pa dang thung bar rab tu shes pa dang / ril po'i 'du shes kyi gnyen por ba lang gsod pa'i dpes khams rnams la so sor rtog pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por zhing pa'i sbyang gi dpes mi gtsang ba nyid du nang la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la rdza mkhan gyi dpes ring pa dang thung bar rab tu shes pa dang / ril po'i 'du shes kyi gnyen por ba lang gsod pa'i dpes khams rnams la so sor rtog pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por zhing pa'i sbyang gi dpes mi gtsang ba nyid du nang la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: One should investigate the internal as impure, by the example of the butcher's shop, as an antidote to the misconception of purity.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol dang phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / de lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba dngos po dang de'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol dang phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / de lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba dngos po dang de'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, one should establish mindfulness by observing the body in the external, internal-external, and internal body, and one should not conceptualize the body or its concepts.

original: dur khrod du zhes bya ba ni ro bor ba'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: dur khrod du zhes bya ba ni ro bor ba'i gnas su'o //
translated: In the charnel ground means in the place where corpses are thrown.

original: lus 'di nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba 'di nyid pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba 'di nyid pa'o //
translated: This very body means this very birth.

original: tshul de dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul de dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in the same way refers to the following.

original: shi ba'i ro dang ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i ro dang ngo //
translated: The body is like a dead body.

original: ji ltar nye bar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar sbyor zhe na /
translated: How is it applied?

original: lus 'di 'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus 'di 'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This body also has that nature and that essence.

original: khu ba dang khrag gi gnas skabs nas gnas skabs de dang de shi ba'i lus sbyar nas de mi rtag pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa nyid du nges par byed pas tshig gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag gi gnas skabs nas gnas skabs de dang de shi ba'i lus sbyar nas de mi rtag pa'i chos nyid rtogs pa nyid du nges par byed pas tshig gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second phrase is to be understood as follows: From the stage of semen and blood, it is applied to the stage of a dead body. It is impermanent by nature.

original: gang yang med la sogs pa mthar thug par byas pa de 'ang gtan du ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid 'di las ma 'da' ba'o zhes tshig gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang med la sogs pa mthar thug par byas pa de 'ang gtan du ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid 'di las ma 'da' ba'o zhes tshig gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third phrase is to be understood as follows: It is not permanent, nor is it annihilated. It does not pass beyond this impermanent nature.

original: rtun pa ni gdung bas na rtun ba ste gdung ba dang kun du gdung ba dang mi mthun par gyur pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rtun pa ni gdung bas na rtun ba ste gdung ba dang kun du gdung ba dang mi mthun par gyur pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The word weariness means the suffering that is produced by the torment and affliction of the body.

original: rtun pa'i sbyor ba de 'di la yod pas na rtun pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtun pa'i sbyor ba de 'di la yod pas na rtun pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word endurance means the possession of the practice of endurance.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shin tu rig pas so //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shin tu rig pas so //
translated: The phrase one is fully aware means that one is fully aware of the object of meditation.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs bam brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs bam brjed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one is mindful means that one does not forget the object of meditation.

original: rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog nas so //
analyzed: rnam par bsal nas zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog nas so //
translated: The phrase one is attentive means that one turns away from the distractions of the desire realm.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it that one turns away from?

original: 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba dag go //
translated: It is the mental states of attachment and displeasure that occur in relation to the objects of the desire realm.

original: de lang dang nga'i zhes bya bar mngon du phyogs nas lus la sogs pa ni chags sems so //üîΩmi 'dod pa rig pa dang mtshungs @74a * //
analyzed: de lang dang nga'i zhes bya bar mngon du phyogs nas lus la sogs pa ni chags sems so // mi 'dod pa rig pa dang mtshungs @74a * //
translated: The phrase one is attentive means that one turns away from attachment to the body, etc., and from the mental state of attachment that occurs in relation to the objects of the desire realm.

original: par ldan pa'i sems zhum pa nyid ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: par ldan pa'i sems zhum pa nyid ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The phrase one is attentive means that one turns away from the mental state of displeasure that occurs in relation to objects that are not desired.üîΩIn the same way, the application of mindfulness to the body is the antidote for the error of permanence.üîΩThe application of mindfulness to the mind is the antidote for the error of pleasure.üîΩThe application of mindfulness to mental qualities is the antidote for the error of purity.

original: de bzhin du bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por chos dran pa nye bar 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por chos dran pa nye bar 'jog pa yin te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to entities is the antidote for the error of self.

original: dran pa med pa dang yin la byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa mi dran pa rnams 'di dag gis nye bar 'jog par byed pas na dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa med pa dang yin la byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa mi dran pa rnams 'di dag gis nye bar 'jog par byed pas na dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: They are called foundations of mindfulness because they cause the establishment of mindfulness of the ultimate, which is characterized by the absence of both memory and the absence of mental construction.

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang phyir 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis yang dag cing phyin ci ma log bar 'di dag spong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang phyir 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis yang dag cing phyin ci ma log bar 'di dag spong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called right efforts because they are the correct and unerring abandonment of the non-arising and the abandonment of the arising of evil, nonvirtuous dharmas, and the non-arising and the arising of virtuous dharmas.

original: de la 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: One generates will in regard to that.

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One makes effort, one exerts his effort,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: one exerts his mind, one strives.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / de mi spong ba dang tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig gcig dang gnyis dang gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / de mi spong ba dang tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig gcig dang gnyis dang gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase he is fully settled refers to proper mental attention, to not abandoning that, and to proper discernment, and should be understood as one, two, and two [factors], respectively.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are will, effort, mind, and investigation, which are accompanied by the formative force of abandoning meditative concentration.

original: 'di dag ni yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'grub pa'i rkang ba ste yan lag yin pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'grub pa'i rkang ba ste yan lag yin pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: They are called bases of supernatural power because they are the limbs, the feet, for accomplishing various kinds of excellences.

original: de la 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid da //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid da //
translated: Among them, will is the desire to act.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Meditative concentration is one-pointedness of mind.

original: des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pas na de'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pas na de'i 'du byed do //
translated: The formative force is the formative force for the abandonment of afflictions by means of that [will and meditative concentration].

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: It is of eight kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: will, effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, introspection, volition, and equanimity.

original: de dang ldan pa ni de dang lhan cig ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni de dang lhan cig ldan pa'o //
translated: To be endowed with these is to be endowed with them.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste yan lag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste yan lag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bases of psychic power, which is to say, the limbs.

original: sgom par byed ces bya ba ni sgom pa goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgom par byed ces bya ba ni sgom pa goms par byed pa ste /
translated: One cultivates them means one cultivates them, one makes them habitual.

original: sbyor ba rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: One makes the application extensive.

original: de la sbyor ba las su rung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las su rung ba nyid dam /
translated: Therein, the application is the serviceability of the mind,

original: sbyor ba brtan par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba brtan par gyur pa'am /
translated: the stability of the application,

original: mi @74b dge ba'i tshogs dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: mi @74b dge ba'i tshogs dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: and the absence of admixture with the accumulation of nonvirtue.

original: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi ltar na sgom pa'ang rnam ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi ltar na sgom pa'ang rnam ba bzhi ste /
translated: According to the Abhidharma, cultivation is also of four types:

original: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnam pa gsum dang / bcos bu ma yin pa bral ba'i 'bras bu can don rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnam pa gsum dang / bcos bu ma yin pa bral ba'i 'bras bu can don rdzogs pa'o //
translated: small, middling, great, and unfabricated, which has the fruit of separation and perfect realization.

original: de nyid ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu can te /
analyzed: de nyid ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu can te /
translated: That is the result of abiding in comfort in this life.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Thus, there are four types.

original: rnam par sgom pa ni sgom pas te lus yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par sgom pa ni sgom pas te lus yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: Cultivation is the purification of the body.

original: sgom pa ni tshul khrims nges par sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni tshul khrims nges par sbyong ba'o //
translated: Cultivation is the purification of morality.

original: sgom pa ni sems kyi gnod pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni sems kyi gnod pa sel ba'o //
translated: Cultivation is the removal of mental afflictions.

original: sgom pa ni shes rab brten par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgom pa ni shes rab brten par byed pa yin no //
translated: Cultivation is the support of wisdom.

original: bden pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Abiding in the truth is the first meditation,

original: de ni 'dod pa la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the separation from desire, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Abiding in freedom from desire is the second meditation,

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the separation from the desire of discursive thought, etc.

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Abiding in cessation is the third meditation,üîΩbecause it is the cessation of the suffering and pleasure of the first two meditations and the third meditation, respectively.

original: dga' ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni der 'gog pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni der 'gog pa yin pas so //
translated: The cessation of the fourth meditation is the detachment from the fourth meditation.

original: rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the abandonment is the possession of the four meditations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: ji ltar srid pa ma spangs pa'i shes pa gsal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dor ba ni rnam par sbong ba yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa ma spangs pa'i shes pa gsal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dor ba ni rnam par sbong ba yin pas so //
translated: The abandonment is the detachment from the fourth meditation, preceded by the clear knowledge of the existence that is not abandoned.

original: gzhan yang bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa ni dben pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa ni dben pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the destruction of the latent states is seclusion.

original: kun nas ldang pa dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //üîΩkun du sbyor ba yang dag par bcad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang pa dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o // kun du sbyor ba yang dag par bcad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The absence of the mental afflictions is detachment.üîΩThe cutting off of the fetters is cessation.

original: nye bar len pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ni rnam par song ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ni rnam par song ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of all the appropriating aggregates is the transcendence of the summit.

original: yang chos mngon pa ba rnams na re dben pas ni khams las dben pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa ba rnams na re dben pas ni khams las dben pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the ƒÄbhidhƒÅrmikas say: By seclusion, one is secluded from the realms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: By detachment, one is detached from the mental afflictions.

original: 'gog pas ni las 'gog pa'o//
analyzed: 'gog pas ni las 'gog pa'o//
translated: By cessation, one stops karma.

original: rnam par spong bas ni dngos po rnams spong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par spong bas ni dngos po rnams spong ba ste /
translated: By means of abandonment, one abandons things.

original: tshig thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid brjod pa yin no zhes 'chad do //üîΩgzhan yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po gang yin pa mthong ba'i lam rnam pa bzhi po de la rim pa bzhin dpen pa @75a * //
analyzed: tshig thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid brjod pa yin no zhes 'chad do // gzhan yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po gang yin pa mthong ba'i lam rnam pa bzhi po de la rim pa bzhin dpen pa @75a * //
translated: All the words express nirvana.

original: la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi yan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi yan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should know that the four words, ‚Äúdwelling in seclusion,‚Äù etc., are the four paths of insight, which are the antidotes to the four kinds of discriminations of grasped and grasper.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni dben pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni dben pa ste /
translated: The first of these is the antidote to the first discrimination of grasped.

original: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang pas dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang pas dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is seclusion because it is the abandonment of the side of defilement from the side of purification.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: The second is the antidote to the second discrimination of grasped.

original: des dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is freedom from desire because it is the freedom from desire of the aspiration for the virtuous dharmas.üîΩThe third is the antidote to the first discrimination of grasper.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the first type of conceptualization that grasps is the truth of cessation,

original: des bdag rang dbang can la sogs par 'dzin pa ma lus par 'gog pa'i phyir te spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des bdag rang dbang can la sogs par 'dzin pa ma lus par 'gog pa'i phyir te spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it completely stops or eliminates the grasping of the self as independent and so on.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par spong ba ste /
translated: The antidote to the second type of conceptualization that grasps is the truth of the path,

original: des phung po la sogs pa bdag tu btags pa'i rgyu mtshan sna tshogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid yongs su shes pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des phung po la sogs pa bdag tu btags pa'i rgyu mtshan sna tshogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid yongs su shes pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it completely eliminates the understanding of the various reasons for the imputation of self to the aggregates and so on.

original: dmigs pa dang rten stobs bskyed pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rten stobs bskyed pa ni gnas so //
translated: The basis is the generation of the power of the object and the support.

original: rnam par spong ba ni 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong ba ni 'dor ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the elimination of the conceptualization that grasps.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba ni mthar thug cing mur thug pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba ni mthar thug cing mur thug pa'o //
translated: Transformation is the final and ultimate elimination.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po rnams so ;
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po rnams so ;
translated: Faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the faculties in the sense that they control.

original: / de dag nyid ni mi thub pa'i don gyis na stobs rnams so //üîΩdran pa dang chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni mthong ba'i lam gyi yan lag gi don gyis na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: / de dag nyid ni mi thub pa'i don gyis na stobs rnams so // dran pa dang chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni mthong ba'i lam gyi yan lag gi don gyis na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa rnams so //
translated: They are powers because they are incapable of being overcome.üîΩThe factors of enlightenment are mindfulness, the discrimination of phenomena, diligence, joy, pliancy, samƒÅdhi, and equanimity. They are factors of enlightenment because they are branches of the path of seeing.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i don gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i don gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams so //
translated: The eightfold noble path is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samƒÅdhi. They are the noble path because they are the means of arriving at the city of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsdu ba'i don gyis ni rnam bar thar pa'i sgo rnams so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsdu ba'i don gyis ni rnam bar thar pa'i sgo rnams so //
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are the doors of liberation, in the sense of including the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad ba dang / mi skye ba dang / chos @75b dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / yongs su 'dris pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa'i shes pa ni shes bya ba ma lus pa khyab pa'i don gyis na shes pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad ba dang / mi skye ba dang / chos @75b dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / yongs su 'dris pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa'i shes pa ni shes bya ba ma lus pa khyab pa'i don gyis na shes pa rnams yin no //
translated: The knowledges are the knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation, path, of extinction, of non-production, of the Dharma, of subsequent , of conventional , of the knowledge of the accomplishment of what was to be done, and of the knowledge conforming to the letter. They are the knowledges, in the sense of pervading the entire knowable.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / kun shes pa dang / kun shes pa srung ba'i dbang po rnams ni mthong ba dang sgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam bsdus pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / kun shes pa dang / kun shes pa srung ba'i dbang po rnams ni mthong ba dang sgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam bsdus pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The faculties of the conviction that ‚ÄúI shall come to know the unknown,‚Äù of perfect knowledge, and of the conviction that ‚Äúone has known,‚Äù are the faculties of the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path beyond training, respectively.

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni yan lag las 'da' bar byed pa'i don gyis so//
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni yan lag las 'da' bar byed pa'i don gyis so//
translated: The concentrations of investigation and analysis, of no investigation and only analysis, and of no investigation and no analysis are in the sense of transcending the branches.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha dang / skyo ba dang / 'chi ba dang / lus kyi rnam pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa rnams ni ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha dang / skyo ba dang / 'chi ba dang / lus kyi rnam pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa rnams ni ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten dang /
translated: The mindfulness of the Buddha, of the Dharma, of the Sa·πÖgha, of morality, of renunciation, of the deity, of inhalation and exhalation, of death, of the body, and of the aspects of the body are in the sense of the basis,

original: gzhi dang / dbang po dang / yid mi /
analyzed: gzhi dang / dbang po dang / yid mi /
translated: the support, the faculty, the mental faculty,

original: rton pa dang / nang gi bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa ma brjed pa'i don gyis so //

analyzed: de la rten ni dkon mchog gsum mo //

original: gzhi ni tshul khrims dang / gtong ba gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhi ni tshul khrims dang / gtong ba gnyis so //

original: dbang po ni lha rnams so //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni yan lag dang dmigs pa la 'da' ba'i don gyis so //

analyzed: rnam par thar ba brgyad do rnams ni gnyis dang gcig dang bzhi dang gcig gi go rims bzhin du sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i don dang / sprul pa la rkun nas non mongs pa'i gnyen po'i don dang / thar pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i don dang / zhi bar gnas pa'i don gyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par thar pa brgyad bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eight liberations are for the purpose of the antidote to the obscurations of emanation, the antidote to the affliction of the enjoyment of emanation, the state of abiding in conformity with liberation, andüîΩthe state of abiding in peace.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du rung ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du rung ba'i don gyis te /

translated: because it is the attainment of that through the meditative attainment of cessation.üîΩThe power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ldang ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu po rnams ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa dang chos nyid thob pa'i don gyis so //

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po rnams ni ma shes pa nyid la ma zhum pa'i don gyis so ;

analyzed: / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa yul thams cad la ye shes thogs pa med pa'i don gyis so //

translated: The collection of form is

analyzed: sa'i tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po rnams so sor bdag nyid kyis yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of stages is the ten bodhisattva stages, which become tenfold by the division of self-purification.üîΩFor what reason?

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po sa bcu pa la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis brnyes pa'i stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su ma rdzogs pa la dgongs pa yin no //

original: sa bcu pa yang /
analyzed: sa bcu pa yang /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba 'di ni sa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig bla dags so // zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni bse ru lta bu dang / tshogs na spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas rnams so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni ji skad du bshad pa rnam pa dgu po nyid do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la spyod pa'i tshe /
