analyzed: sa 'di rnams yongs su sbyang bar byed pa'i chos bsam pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni mdo nyid la yod pas ma smras so //
translated: The nature of the dharmas that purify these stages, such as will, etc., as they are taught, is taught in the sutra itself, so I will not write about it.

original: de ltar byas na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na /

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: sa'i tshogs bshad zin to /

analyzed: // / gnyen po'i tshogs brjod par bya ba yin pas na /

analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag la // gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
translated: On the paths of seeing and cultivation,üîΩin order to pacify

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: the concepts of grasped and grasper,

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: there are eight kinds of antidotes.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa brgyad ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa brgyad ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are eight kinds of conceptualization:

analyzed: re zhig mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: dngos po tsam gyi rnam pa la brten pa dang ; gnyen po'i rnam pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad du btags pa la brten pa dang / btags pa de'i rgyu mtshan ma la brten pas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam gyi rnam pa la brten pa dang ; gnyen po'i rnam pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad du btags pa la brten pa dang / btags pa de'i rgyu mtshan ma la brten pas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of conceptualization of the apprehender: one based on the imputation of all ƒÅryas and one based on the objective referent of that imputation.

original: rnam par rtog pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa 'di brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa 'di brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eight kinds of conceptualization in the three realms.

original: de bas na dris pa gsum pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bas na dris pa gsum pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with regard to the third question,üîΩSubhuti, you have asked, ‚ÄúWhere will that vehicle come from?‚Äù It will come from the three realms.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of not apprehending.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of nonduality.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni de dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni de dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ;
translated: It will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of attributes.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of striving.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of conceptualization.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of mental placement.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of mental engagement.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of mind.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of birth.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of arising.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of existence.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of nonexistence.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the conditioned.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na bder gnas par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na bder gnas par 'gyur ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the unconditioned.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the past.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the future.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the present.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the three times.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the compounded.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the uncompounded.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the compounded and the uncompounded.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It will come from the three realms in the manner of the absence of the compounded and the uncompounded.üîΩIt will come from the three realms in the manner of

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of the antidote to the first of the conceptualizations of the apprehended of the path of seeing,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams dang / nam mkha' dang / spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings rnams dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dag dang / phung po dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams dang / nam mkha' dang / spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings rnams dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dag dang / phung po dang /
translated: the dharmadhƒÅtu, suchness, and the perfect limit, space, abandonment, the expanse of separation from attachment, nonarising, and noncessation, the aggregates,üîΩthe constituents, the sense spheres, and so on are refuted because it is untenable that they are the definite emergence from those.üîΩThe assertion that phenomena that are without characteristics are the definite emergence is refuted.

original: khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams la nges par 'byung ba 'dod ba bkag ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams la nges par 'byung ba 'dod ba bkag ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe aggregates of form and so on are empty of those.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la khams gsum nas nges par 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa bkag pa dang / rmi lam @80a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la khams gsum nas nges par 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa bkag pa dang / rmi lam @80a * //
translated: The emptiness of those is refuted as the definite emergence from the three realms and the basis of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩDreams, mirages, illusions, echoes, optical illusions, reflections, and emanations are as before.

original: dang ; smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams snga ma bzhin yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dang ; smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams snga ma bzhin yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?üîΩThe nature of those is refuted as the definite emergence from the three realms and the basis of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin la khams gsum nas 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin la khams gsum nas 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni de rnams kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the essence of those is empty of those.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With the aim of countering the second conception of the object of the path of seeing,üîΩthe perfections are as before.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni snga ma bzhin yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni snga ma bzhin yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?üîΩThe nature of those is empty of that.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa yin pa dang / stong ba nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa yin pa dang / stong ba nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: All emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the powers, up to and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?üîΩThe nature of those is as before.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of those is empty of that.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With the aim of countering the first conception of grasping on the path of seeing,

original: dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The arhats, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas are as before. And why?

original: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because they are empty of them. And why?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because their emptiness is as before. And why?

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because their intrinsic reality is emptiness. And similarly, the fruits of stream enterer and so on, the pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening, and the knowledge of all aspects are empty of their intrinsic reality.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the antidote to the second type of conceptualization of apprehending on the path of seeing,

original: ming dang / mchan ma dang / brda dang / tha snyad kyis gdags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang / mchan ma dang / brda dang / tha snyad kyis gdags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe designations by name, sign, symbol, and convention are as before. Why is it so?

original: de rnams @80b ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams @80b ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because they are empty of those.‚Äù And, ‚ÄúWhy is it so?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because their emptiness is as before.‚Äù And, ‚ÄúWhy is it so?

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because their intrinsic reality is empty of that.‚Äù And similarly, ‚ÄúBecause their intrinsic reality is empty of non-arising, non-ceasing, non-affliction, non-purification, and non-conditioning.‚Äù

original: de la ming gi gdags pa ni 'du shes dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming gi gdags pa ni 'du shes dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The designation of names is such as ‚Äúperception,‚Äù ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù and so on.

original: mtshan ma'i gdags pa ni gzugs su rung ba'i dngos po ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gdags pa ni gzugs su rung ba'i dngos po ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The designation of signs is such as ‚Äúform is the entity that is suitable as form,‚Äù and so on.

original: brda'i gdags pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / skye ba'i dbye bas sems can rnams kyi sgra ji lta ba bzhin brdar grags pa'o //
analyzed: brda'i gdags pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / skye ba'i dbye bas sems can rnams kyi sgra ji lta ba bzhin brdar grags pa'o //
translated: The designation of terms is the conventional usage of terms for sentient beings according to the divisions of realms, reincarnating beings, birth processes, and birthplaces.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di thams cad kyang tha snyad kyis gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di thams cad kyang tha snyad kyis gdags pa yin te /
translated: All three of these are designations by way of conventions.

original: de lta bu ni 'dir tha snyad tsam yin pas don dam par stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'dir tha snyad tsam yin pas don dam par stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this context, these are mere conventions, they are empty of an ultimate.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In order to remedy the first of the apprehensions of the apprehended on the path of meditation,

original: dris pa bzhi pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: dris pa bzhi pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: in terms of the fourth question,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du theg pa de gang du gnas pa 'gyur /üîΩzhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du theg pa de gang du gnas pa 'gyur /üîΩzhes zer ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, you asked, ‚ÄòWhere will that vehicle stay?‚Äô

original: theg pa de gang du gang par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: theg pa de gang du gang par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: There is no place where that vehicle is or is not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are non-abiding.

original: rab 'byor 'on kyang theg pa de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'on kyang theg pa de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti: It is thus that the vehicle abides, i.e. in the manner in which it does not abide.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa me dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po la yang gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bkag pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa me dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po la yang gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bkag pa dang /
translated: And so for the Dharma-element, the unconditioned element, the unthink¬≠ able element, the element of no-birth, no-stopping, no-defilement, no-purification, and no-production.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because they are empty of those dharmas.üîΩAnd why?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because their emptiness is not stopped, nor is it produced.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir @81a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir @81a * //
translated: Because the nature of those is emptiness.

original: ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said by the word ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: de la 'di'i rten gnas yod pa ma yin pas na gnas pa med pa ste chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de la 'di'i rten gnas yod pa ma yin pas na gnas pa med pa ste chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: There, since the support and basis of this are not existent, there is no basis, which is the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: de la gnas pa dang ldan pa med pas na mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa dang ldan pa med pas na mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since there is no possession of a basis there, it is the basis by way of the mode of non-abiding.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas dris pa lnga pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas dris pa lnga pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With the aim of the antidote to the second conception of an object of the path of cultivation, he speaks of the fifth question.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyad kyis 'de skad du theg ba des su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni theg pa des su 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyad kyis 'de skad du theg ba des su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni theg pa des su 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Subh≈´ti, you asked, ‚ÄúBy means of that vehicle, who will go forth?‚Äù No one at all will go forth by means of that vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang / gang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos nge dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang / gang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos nge dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because in this way all those dharmas‚Äîthat vehicle, that which would go forth, that by which one would go forth, and that from which one would go forth‚Äîdo not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de ltar chos thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa la chos gang zhig chos gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa la chos gang zhig chos gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, in the nonexistence and nonapprehension of all dharmas, what dharma would go forth by what dharma?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la yang phyis bya ba'i mtshan ma med pa nyid shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la yang phyis bya ba'i mtshan ma med pa nyid shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: Because a self, a sentient being, a life-force, and so on are extremely pure and not apprehended. The mention of ‚Äúextremely pure‚Äù here is for the purpose of knowing the later signlessness that is to be done on the path of meditation.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba dang / gang zhig dmigs su med bas thams cad mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba dang / gang zhig dmigs su med bas thams cad mi dmigs she na /
translated: And if one asks, ‚ÄúWhy is everything non-apprehended because of the non-apprehension of that?‚Äù

original: rang rang gi ngo bo dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: It is because of the non-apprehension of their own natures.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar thams cad der dmigs su med pas mi dmigs ba nyed ces bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar thams cad der dmigs su med pas mi dmigs ba nyed ces bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, because the dharma-dhƒÅtu is non-apprehensible, up to because all the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are non-apprehensible, they are called ‚Äúnon-apprehended.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa sogs pa nas /
translated: With the aim of countering the first conception of grasping that occurs on the path of cultivation, it is said:

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / @81b gang zhig dmigs su med pas mi dmigs sha na /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs zhes bya ba dang / @81b gang zhig dmigs su med pas mi dmigs sha na /
translated: up to ‚Äúa perfect complete buddha is not apprehended‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is not apprehended is not apprehended because it is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: rang rang gi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: The intrinsic reality of each is not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, because a stream enterer is not apprehended, up to

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar thams cad dmigs su med pas mi dmigs so zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar thams cad dmigs su med pas mi dmigs so zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because a perfect complete buddha is not apprehended, all are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo ni shes pa'i dbang gis yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo ni shes pa'i dbang gis yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: The intrinsic reality of the object of knowledge is determined by the power of cognition.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyud kyang ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa'i shes pa dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa des na de rnams mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyud kyang ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa'i shes pa dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa des na de rnams mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Also, a continuum that is the intrinsic reality of a buddha and so on is the object of a cognition that is just as it is. Therefore those are not apprehended.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be said that they do not exist because of non-apprehension itself.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With the aim of countering the second kind of grasping at the path of cultivation,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba dang / rigs dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba dang / rigs dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: the ten grounds of the Joyful One, etc., the white discernment, the family, the eighth, the seeing, the thinning, the detachment,

original: byas pa rtogs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang ; 'bras bur gyur pa dang / 'bras bu dang lam du gyur ba 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rab tu gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa rnams mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang ; 'bras bur gyur pa dang / 'bras bu dang lam du gyur ba 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rab tu gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa rnams mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the realization of the done, the pratyekabuddha path, the one that is the fruit, and the one that is the path and the fruit, all the ƒÅrya persons, are said to be the non-apprehension itself that is the reason for the designation.

original: snying rje la sogs pa chos 'di dag ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i don gyis na tshogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa chos 'di dag ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i don gyis na tshogs zhes brjod do //
translated: These dharmas such as compassion are called ‚Äúcollection‚Äù because of the meaning of their nature, which is to accomplish perfect enlightenment.

original: chogs kyi sgrub pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: chogs kyi sgrub pa bshad zin to /
translated: The accomplishment of the collection has been explained.

original: // / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bshad par bya ste /üîΩde'ang ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: // / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bshad par bya ste / de'ang ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The accomplishment of definite emergence should be explained.üîΩMoreover, it is of eight kinds, beginning with the definite emergence of the object to be accomplished,

original: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i bar du rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i bar du rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: up to the definite emergence of the path.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe definite emergence of the object to be accomplished,üîΩthe definite emergence of equality,üîΩthe definite emergence of the benefit of sentient beings,üîΩthe definite emergence of effortless activity,

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' 'das nges par 'byung ba dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid du dang // nges 'byung lam gyi yul can te //
analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' 'das nges par 'byung ba dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid du dang // nges 'byung lam gyi yul can te //
translated: the definite emergence of the transcendence of extremes,üîΩthe definite emergence of the attainment of characteristics,üîΩthe definite emergence of the knowledge of all aspects,üîΩand the definite emergence of the path as the object.

original: @82a * // rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: @82a * // rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: This is of the nature of eight kinds,

original: nges 'byung sgrub pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: nges 'byung sgrub pa yin zhes bya //
translated: called ‚Äúthe accomplishment of definite emergence.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said.

original: de la ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of definite release that are its objects:

original: mchog nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir mchog nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di ltar de dang de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mchog nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o // gang gi phyir mchog nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni / gang gi phyir 'di ltar de dang de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: definite release as supremacy, definite release as abandonment, and definite release as realization.üîΩThe great vehicle is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù in terms of definite release as supremacy,üîΩbecause it is the supreme definite release.

original: sems can de ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags so zhes bya bas go cha'i sgrub pa'i chen po nyid dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya bas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: sems can de ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags so zhes bya bas go cha'i sgrub pa'i chen po nyid dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya bas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i chen po nyid dang /
translated: The great vehicle is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù in terms of definite release as abandonment,üîΩbecause it abandons all the mental afflictions of oneself and others.

original: ci'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa zhes brjod ces bya bas tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i chen po nyid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa zhes brjod ces bya bas tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i chen po nyid de /
translated: The great vehicle is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù in terms of definite release as realization,üîΩbecause it realizes the selflessness of both persons and phenomena.

original: 'di'i chen po nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dang 'di yin pa de bas na 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa las brtsams par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i chen po nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dang 'di yin pa de bas na 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa las brtsams par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Since this is the three kinds of greatness of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, it is appropriate to begin the establishment of its definitive emergence.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa dang /
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti has taught the establishment of definitive emergence, saying, ‚ÄúBlessed One, the MahƒÅyƒÅna, the MahƒÅyƒÅna, surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and emerges.‚Äù

original: bstan pa de la /
analyzed: bstan pa de la /
translated: In that teaching,

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / stong ba nyid thams cad dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / stong ba nyid thams cad dang /
translated: the Blessed One has said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, this is the MahƒÅyƒÅna of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas,‚Äù and has taught the six perfections, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the samƒÅdhi gateways, all the emptinesses,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas /
translated: the factors of awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rnams ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin nges par 'byin pa'i theg pa chen po yin par zhal gyis bzhes nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rnams ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin nges par 'byin pa'i theg pa chen po yin par zhal gyis bzhes nas brtsams te /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the vehicle that definitely leads to the state of the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúThat Great Vehicle surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and goes forth.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, if the desire realm were suchness,

original: ma nor ba de bzhin /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin /
translated: unmistaken suchness,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin /
translated: not otherwise,

original: phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na bden pa dang / yang dag pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin dang / rtag pa dang / brtan @82b pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi dngos po zhig yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na bden pa dang / yang dag pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin dang / rtag pa dang / brtan @82b pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi dngos po zhig yin te /
translated: unerring, the truth, reality, the way things are, permanent, stable, eternal, and not subject to change,

original: dngos po med pa ma yin na ni theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin na ni theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were not a non-entity, this Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de la dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po dang gnyis ka'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po dang gnyis ka'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the object of apprehension, the apprehender, and both,

original: tshig dang po dang bzhi pa dang bdun pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: tshig dang po dang bzhi pa dang bdun pa rnams yin la /
translated: the first, fourth, and seventh words are used.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa'i nges par bstan pa ni tshig gnyis gnyis yin zhing /
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa'i nges par bstan pa ni tshig gnyis gnyis yin zhing /
translated: The first and second are taught with two words each,

original: de nas yang gsum po de rnams nyid kyi dbang du byas nas tshig gsum yin no //
analyzed: de nas yang gsum po de rnams nyid kyi dbang du byas nas tshig gsum yin no //
translated: and then again with reference to those three, there are three words.

original: de ltar dmigs pa la sogs pa de rnams nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba las mi 'byur ba'i chos nyid la ni tshig bcu gcig pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa la sogs pa de rnams nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba las mi 'byur ba'i chos nyid la ni tshig bcu gcig pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, with reference to those very object of apprehension, etc., the eleven words should be understood with reference to the reality of non-emergence from the equality of those very object of apprehension, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rab 'byor 'dod pa'i khams rnams par btags pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtogs pa'i ma rig pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab 'byor 'dod pa'i khams rnams par btags pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtogs pa'i ma rig pas so //
translated: Because, Subh≈´ti, the designation of the desire realm is due to the ignorance of unreal imagination.

original: rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rkyen du gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rkyen du gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis so //
translated: The establishment is due to the formative forces that are its conditions.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin pa de bas na theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin pa de bas na theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: The teaching is due to the power of craving, grasping, and becoming. Therefore, this Great Vehicle, having surpassed the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, will go forth.

original: / don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: / don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten na grags pa tsam gyi don ji lta ba nyid yang dag par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten na grags pa tsam gyi don ji lta ba nyid yang dag par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: The Great Vehicle has the result of the correct realization of the meaning just as it is, which is merely renowned in the world.

original: del mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: del mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because attachment to that is bondage.

original: gzhan du na theg pa chen po gnyen por sgom pa don med par 'gyur ro zhas bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na theg pa chen po gnyen por sgom pa don med par 'gyur ro zhas bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be pointless to cultivate the MahƒÅyƒÅna antidotes.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag dang / phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag dang / phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Similarly, the realms of form and formlessness, the aggregates, etc., the realm of phenomena, the perfect limit, the perfections, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par gsungs pa ni theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par gsungs pa ni theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha, are said to be negated as entities and nonentities, and are the MahƒÅyƒÅna going forth.

original: phyi ma dag tu 'ang khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma dag tu 'ang khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: They should be accepted in the latter [MahƒÅyƒÅna].

original: spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the going forth of abandonment, it is said:

original: rigs kyi sa'i chos dang / brgyad pa'i sa'i chos nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams @83a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'i chos dang / brgyad pa'i sa'i chos nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams @83a * //
translated: The qualities of the stage of lineage, the qualities of the stage of the eighth, up to the qualities of a buddha,

original: kyi bar dang / rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po yin te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin sbyar bas yin no //
analyzed: kyi bar dang / rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po yin te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin sbyar bas yin no //
translated: and from the person of the stage of lineage up to the perfect Buddha, and the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is a thing, as before.

original: rtog pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement from the perspective of the definite emergence of imagination is:

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the generation of the first mindüîΩup to sitting at the site of enlightenment, however many minds arise, they are like a cloud,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems bskyed pa ji snyed cig 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag snag ma bzhin pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes snga ma bzhin pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems bskyed pa ji snyed cig 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag snag ma bzhin pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes snga ma bzhin pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang /
translated: like a vajra, and so on, as before, and they abandon all afflictions that are connected to latent states.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The attainment of the knowledge of all aspects is the Great Vehicle itself, which is the definite emergence of the Great Vehicle, and the thirty-two marks of a great being are as above.üîΩThe splendor and glory of the Buddha outshines the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, and he is beautiful.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjod dang dpal gyi zil gyis mnan te mdzes pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjod dang dpal gyi zil gyis mnan te mdzes pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The light of the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened Buddha is as above,üîΩand the Buddha fills with his own light as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River.

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag rang gi sku'i 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs par mdzad pa dang / gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'ang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag rang gi sku'i 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs par mdzad pa dang / gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'ang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: His speech endowed with sixty aspects is as above,

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs bcu re re zhing tshad med cing grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsung gis go bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs bcu re re zhing tshad med cing grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsung gis go bar mdzad pas so //
translated: and the Buddha makes his voice understood in each of the ten directions in immeasurable and innumerable world systems.

original: de la gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsungs yin no //
analyzed: de la gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsungs yin no //
translated: The speech of the Buddha is endowed with sixty melodious qualities.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are these sixty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can gyi khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gnyen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gnyen po'o //
translated: It is remedial, because it reveals the roots of virtue to the realms of sentient beings.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la bde ba la reg pa'i phyir 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la bde ba la reg pa'i phyir 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is crushing, because it causes one to experience bliss in this very life.

original: don bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: don bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is pleasing, because it has good meaning.

original: yi ge bzhan ba'i phyir yid du 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge bzhan ba'i phyir yid du 'thad pa'o //
translated: It is acceptable, because it has good phrasing.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla med pa'i rjes las thob pa yin pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla med pa'i rjes las thob pa yin pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure, because it is attained subsequent to the unsurpassed supramundane path.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless, because it is free from all the latent impulses of the afflictions.

original: tshig dang yi ge rab tu grangs pa'i phyir rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rab tu grangs pa'i phyir rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear, because it is well-phrased and well-written.

original: mu stegs can blo ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan @83b pa'i phyir snyan zhing 'jebs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can blo ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan @83b pa'i phyir snyan zhing 'jebs pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it has the power of the good qualities of the strength that conquers the views of all the bad logicians, the tirthikas.

original: sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na nyan par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na nyan par 'os pa'o //
translated: It is worthy of being heard because it is endowed with the deliverance of practice.

original: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir tshugs pa'o //
translated: It is invincible because it cannot be overcome by any opponent.

original: thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir snyan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir snyan pa'o //
translated: It is agreeable because it delights everyone.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dul ba'o //
translated: It is gentle because it is the antidote to desire and so forth.

original: bslab pa bcas pa'i thams cas pa'i thams bde ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa bcas pa'i thams cas pa'i thams bde ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa'o //
translated: It is not harsh because it is easy to follow the precepts that it teaches.

original: de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mi brlang ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mi brlang ba'o //
translated: It is not offensive because it teaches the means of deliverance when one transgresses those precepts.

original: theg pa gsum char gyi 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir rab tu dul ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char gyi 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir rab tu dul ba'o //
translated: It is well disciplined because it teaches the discipline of all three vehicles.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing to the ear because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus tshim par byed pa'o //üîΩlhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba bskyed par mdzad pa'i phyir sems tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus tshim par byed pa'o // lhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba bskyed par mdzad pa'i phyir sems tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: It satisfies the body in order to generate concentration.üîΩIt satisfies the mind in order to generate the joy of insight.

original: the tshom gcod par mdzad pa'i phyir snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom gcod par mdzad pa'i phyir snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It gladdens the heart in order to cut off doubt.

original: log pa dang ma nges pa sel ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: log pa dang ma nges pa sel ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: It generates joy and ease in order to eliminate error and uncertainty.

original: sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is free from remorse because of the absence of regret with regard to practice.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun shes par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be fully understood because it is the basis of the perfection of knowledge derived from hearing.

original: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa phung sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par rigs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa phung sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par rigs par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be discerned because it is the basis of the perfection of knowledge derived from reflection.

original: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi mnga' bar chos ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi mnga' bar chos ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear because the Master teaches the Dharma without the stinginess that conceals from disciples.

original: rang gi don rjes su thob par rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob par rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is delightful because it delights those who have attained their own goal.

original: rang gi don ma thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par dga' bar bya ba'o //üîΩbsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don ma thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par dga' bar bya ba'o // bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o //
translated: It is to be rejoiced in because it causes those who have not attained their own goal to rejoice.üîΩIt is to be understood because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rnams yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rnams yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is to be known because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable because it is not contrary to valid cognition.

original: gdul bya rnams la ji ltar rig par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la ji ltar rig par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is connected because it teaches in accordance with the understanding of those to be trained.

original: don med par mi gsung ba'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: don med par mi gsung ba'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: It is without the fault of repetition because it does not speak meaninglessly.

original: mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cas skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir seng ge'i sgra'i shugs so //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cas skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir seng ge'i sgra'i shugs so //
translated: It is the roar of the lion because it terrifies all the hosts of extremists.

original: gsung rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir glang po che'i sgra skad do //
analyzed: gsung rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir glang po che'i sgra skad do //
translated: It is the voice of the elephant because it is majestic.

original: zab pa nyid kyi phyir 'brug gi sgra @84a * //
analyzed: zab pa nyid kyi phyir 'brug gi sgra @84a * //
translated: Because of its profundity, it is the sound of thunder.

original: dbyangs so // gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir klu'i dbang po'i sgra'o //üîΩsgra dbyangs shin tu snyan pa'i phyir dri za'i glu dbyangs so //
analyzed: dbyangs so // gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir klu'i dbang po'i sgra'o // sgra dbyangs shin tu snyan pa'i phyir dri za'i glu dbyangs so //
translated: Because it is worthy of being grasped, it is the sound of the lord of the nƒÅgas.üîΩBecause of its very sweet sound, it is the sound of the gandharvas.

original: rno ba dang 'jebs pa'i phyir ka la bing ka'i sgra dbyangs so //
analyzed: rno ba dang 'jebs pa'i phyir ka la bing ka'i sgra dbyangs so //
translated: Because of its sharpness and sweetness, it is the sound of the kalavi·πÖka bird.

original: thag ring du grags pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa'o//
analyzed: thag ring du grags pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa'o//
translated: Because it resounds far, it is the sound of BrahmƒÅ.

original: grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar shes pa'i phyir shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa'o //üîΩde la sgra smos pa ni don ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra yin par go bar bya ba'i don to //üîΩdbyangs smos pa ni de dang de'i brda go bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar shes pa'i phyir shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa'o // de la sgra smos pa ni don ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra yin par go bar bya ba'i don to // dbyangs smos pa ni de dang de'i brda go bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is known as the forerunner of all accomplishments, it is the sound of the ki·πÉnara.üîΩHere, the mention of sound is for the purpose of understanding the sound that characterizes the teaching of the meaning.üîΩThe mention of voice is for the purpose of understanding the conventional symbols of this and that.

original: grags pa smos pa ni sgra de dang de'i brda rjes su sgrogs par byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: grags pa smos pa ni sgra de dang de'i brda rjes su sgrogs par byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The mention of fame is for the purpose of proclaiming the conventional symbols of this and that sound.

original: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar dbyangs ltar snyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar dbyangs ltar snyan pa'o //
translated: It is like the voice of the lord of the gods, because it is not to be surpassed.

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o //üîΩbstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ma khengs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o // bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ma khengs pa'o //
translated: It is like the sound of a drum, because it precedes the victory over all demons and adversaries.üîΩIt is not arrogant, because it is not defiled by praise.

original: smad pas zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
analyzed: smad pas zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
translated: It is not contemptuous, because it is not depressed by blame.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with all sounds, because it is applied to the characteristics of all aspects in all treatises on phonemes.

original: bsnyel te gsungs ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir tshig zur chags pa med do //
analyzed: bsnyel te gsungs ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir tshig zur chags pa med do //
translated: It is not incoherent, because it does not speak incoherently.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba la dus thams cad du bye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba la dus thams cad du bye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not incomplete, because it is applied to the activities of those to be trained at all times.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brtan pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brtan pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o //
translated: It is not faint, because it is not dependent on gain and honor.

original: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi zhan pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi zhan pa'o //
translated: It is not weak, because it is free from fear.

original: skyob med pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: skyob med pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is delightful, because it is without protection.

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is endowed with skill in all the branches of knowledge.

original: sems can rnams kyi don de dag thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don de dag thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir tha ma med pa'o //
translated: It is endless, because it accomplishes all those aims of beings.

original: rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: It is continuous, because it is uninterrupted.

original: rnam pa snga tshogs su nya bar gnas pa'i phyir brjid pa'o //üîΩgsungs gcig la sgra'i rnam pa du mar gnas pa'i phyir sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa snga tshogs su nya bar gnas pa'i phyir brjid pa'o // gsungs gcig la sgra'i rnam pa du mar gnas pa'i phyir sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is majestic, because it is based on the former states of meditative concentration.üîΩIt is the fulfillment of all sounds, because it is based on the many aspects of sound in a single sound.

original: gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig par byed bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig par byed bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the satisfaction of all faculties, because it is based on the cognition of many meanings in a single sound.

original: ji ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du mdzad pa'i phyir ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du mdzad pa'i phyir ma smad pa'o //
translated: It is irreproachable, because it does what it promises.

original: thob @84b pa'i dus su rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thob @84b pa'i dus su rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is unchanging, because it is applied at the time of attainment.

original: rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ma brtabs pa'o //
analyzed: rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ma brtabs pa'o //
translated: It is not agitated because it is not spoken in a hurried manner.

original: 'khor thag ring ba dang nye bar mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir 'khor kun tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor thag ring ba dang nye bar mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir 'khor kun tu grags pa'o //
translated: It is renowned in all circles because it is heard equally by those in the distant and near circles.

original: 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su sgyur pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o zhes 'phags pa thogs med gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su sgyur pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o zhes 'phags pa thogs med gsung ngo //
translated: It is endowed with the highest of all aspects because all mundane matters are turned into the Dharma of examples.

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa gsungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa gsungs pa'i phyir na /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma has twelve aspects, with three repetitions and four truths.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sngar ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sngar ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas so //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma has not been turned by the TathƒÅgata before.

original: de la lan gsum du bzlas pa ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //üîΩyongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la lan gsum du bzlas pa ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The three repetitions are the noble truth of suffering,üîΩit should be fully known,

original: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: it has been fully known.

original: 'di rnams re re la mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams re re la mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: Each of these has the twelve aspects: eye, knowledge, understanding, and awareness have arisen.

original: de ltar bden pa so sor gsum dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pas na lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa so sor gsum dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pas na lan gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is a similarity of three and twelve with respect to each truth, it is said that the wheel has twelve aspects, with three repetitions.

original: de la mig ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis bsdus pa'o //üîΩshes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis bsdus pa'o // shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: In this regard, eye is included in the eye of the Buddha.üîΩKnowledge is included in nonconceptual intuition.

original: rig pa ni mi slob pa'i rig pas bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa ni mi slob pa'i rig pas bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: Understanding is included in the unlearned understanding.

original: blo ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: blo ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: Awareness is included in omniscience.

original: sems can gang gi don du de bskor ba ni de rnams dngos po dang dngos po med pa dgag pa rjes su shes pa las sems can rnams dus gsum du phung po lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can gang gi don du de bskor ba ni de rnams dngos po dang dngos po med pa dgag pa rjes su shes pa las sems can rnams dus gsum du phung po lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The sentient beings for whose sake it is turned are those who, having understood the negation of both existence and nonexistence, attain the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates in the three times.

original: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ni gang zhig lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ni gang zhig lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is a thing?

original: dngos po med pa ni gang zhig lags /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni gang zhig lags /
translated: What is a non-thing?

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, duality is a thing.

original: gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Non-duality is a non-thing.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With reference to the escape of sameness, it is said:

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said that this vehicle is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' dper byas pas ni de khyab pa nyid kyis @85a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' dper byas pas ni de khyab pa nyid kyis @85a * //
translated: By taking space as an example, it is said that

original: phyogs su btags pa'i rgyu mtshan mu mtshams kyi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs su btags pa'i rgyu mtshan mu mtshams kyi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: it is free from the basis of imputation as a direction, due to being pervaded by it.

original: theg ba chen po la phyogs su 'dod pa bkag pa dang / de gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ring bo dang thung du la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs dang dus gsum bkag pa dang /
analyzed: theg ba chen po la phyogs su 'dod pa bkag pa dang / de gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ring bo dang thung du la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs dang dus gsum bkag pa dang /
translated: The Mahayana is refuted as being a separate direction, and since it is not physical, it is refuted as having the shape of long or short, and as having the form of colors such as blue or yellow, and as existing in the three times.

original: de la mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'grib pa dang 'phel ba bkag pa dang / de rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'grib pa dang 'phel ba bkag pa dang / de rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it does not have a different characteristic, it is refuted as increasing or decreasing, and since it is the characteristic of natural purity,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bdag dang ; skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa dang bral ba dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bdag dang ; skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa dang bral ba dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pa ste /
translated: it is refuted as being afflicted or purified, arising or ceasing, abiding or not abiding, or changing from abiding.

original: de la med pa las byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la med pa las byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is the origination of what did not exist.

original: byung nas med pa ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: byung nas med pa ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the nonexistence of what existed.

original: rgyun 'dra ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun 'dra ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the continuity of similarity.

original: mi 'dra ba ni gnas pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni gnas pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Not abiding is dissimilarity.

original: rgyun gzhan du gyur ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun gzhan du gyur ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformation of the continuum is the transformation of the basis.

original: de'i ngo bo dang kun nas bslang ba dang / mtshungs par lnga bam yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa bkag pa dang / de dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir mthong ba dang /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang kun nas bslang ba dang / mtshungs par lnga bam yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa bkag pa dang / de dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir mthong ba dang /
translated: It is the cessation of virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral states, because it is not of the nature of those, nor is it motivated by them, nor is it concomitant with them.üîΩIt is the cessation of seeing, hearing, the end of the range of thought, and the end of the range of cognition, because it is beyond the range of the senses.

original: thos pa dang / dran ba dang / rig pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams dang / shes par bya ba dang / kun shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba rnams bkag pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang / dran ba dang / rig pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams dang / shes par bya ba dang / kun shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba rnams bkag pa ste /
translated: It is the cessation of the knowable, the completely knowable, and the fully knowable,

original: de la shes par bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
translated: because the completely knowable is the knowledge of all things.

original: de ni shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be transcended by knowledge and vision.

original: kun shes par bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun shes par bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid de /
translated: The fully knowable is the knowledge of the path,

original: de ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi bar du kun shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi bar du kun shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be fully known up to the state of Buddhahood.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: The object of thorough knowledge is omniscience.

original: de ni thams cad nas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni thams cad nas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is to be known in all ways because

original: theg pa chen po la tshar gcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la tshar gcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no refutation in the Mahayana.

original: de 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rnam par rtogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rnam par rtogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from the conceptualization of engagement and disengagement,üîΩthe thorough knowledge, abandonment, realization, and cultivation are refuted,

original: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spangs bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba rnams bkag pa dang / de la rgyu 'bras kyi 'brel @85b pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spangs bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba rnams bkag pa dang / de la rgyu 'bras kyi 'brel @85b pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: and because the connection between cause and effect is contradicted,üîΩthe ripening and its characteristics are refuted.

original: rnam par smin pa dang de'i chos can dag bkag pa dang / de khams gsum pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang de'i chos can dag bkag pa dang / de khams gsum pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not associated with the three realms,üîΩthe conceptualization of the realms of desire and so on is refuted.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams su rtog pa yin pa nyid bkag pa dang / de rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams su rtog pa yin pa nyid bkag pa dang / de rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not characterized by consciousness,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du theg pa chen po la /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du theg pa chen po la /
translated: the Mahayana is like space.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment

original: sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar bkag pa dang / de bzhin du rten gyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa'i sa nas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar bkag pa dang / de bzhin du rten gyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir / dkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa'i sa nas /
translated: The ten levels of bodhicitta are negated because they are not the characteristics of the support.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'i bar rnams bkag pa dang / de brten pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'i bar rnams bkag pa dang / de brten pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The levels from that of seeing the white appearance up to the level of the realization of the state of an arhat are negated because they are not the characteristics of the supported.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / nyan thos dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams bkag pa dang / de bzlog zla'i rnam par rtog pa med pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / nyan thos dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams bkag pa dang / de bzlog zla'i rnam par rtog pa med pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The results of stream enterer and so forth, the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, pratyekabuddha, and buddha, are negated because they are not the characteristics of the support.

original: theg pa chen po la bzlog zla dang bcas pa'i gzugs can dang / bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / ldan pa rnams dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba rnams dang / mi stong pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la bzlog zla dang bcas pa'i gzugs can dang / bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / ldan pa rnams dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba rnams dang / mi stong pa dang /
translated: The MahƒÅyƒÅna, which has a counterpart, is negated because it is form, can be shown, is obstructive, is possessed, is permanent, is blissful, is a self, is peaceful, and is not empty.

original: mtshan ma yod pa dang / smon pa yod pa rnams dang / bzlog zla dang bcas pa'i dben pa dang / snang ba dag dang dang / de la dngos po dang / khyad par du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa dang / smon pa yod pa rnams dang / bzlog zla dang bcas pa'i dben pa dang / snang ba dag dang dang / de la dngos po dang / khyad par du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
