translated: because of the absence of conceptual differentiation in regard to the sign, the existence of the sign, the existence of prayer, the isolation that is the counteragent, the object, the entity and the particular, respectively.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin thob pa dang / nye bar dmigs pa dag dang / de la rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir brjod pa dang / rab tu brjod pa dag bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin thob pa dang / nye bar dmigs pa dag dang / de la rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir brjod pa dang / rab tu brjod pa dag bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The attainment and the apprehension of the object are demonstrated by the negation of expression and full expression, respectively, because of the absence of natural conceptual differentiation in regard to them.

original: de la brjod pa ni rang nyid khong du chud pa'i rgyu shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni rang nyid khong du chud pa'i rgyu shes pa ste /
translated: Of these, expression is the knowledge that is the cause of one's own understanding,

original: 'dis rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the expression of that.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i rgyu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i rgyu'i tshig ste /
translated: Full expression is the word that is the cause of the understanding of others,

original: gzhan la brjod pa ni rab tu brjod pa yin pas so //üîΩsems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la brjod pa ni rab tu brjod pa yin pas so //üîΩsems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: because the expression of that to others is full expression.üîΩThe S≈´tra has been spoken by the Exalted One, the S≈´tra-Dharmas have been spoken by the Exalted One, the Vinaya-Dharmas have been spoken by the Exalted One, having considered, having considered, the Exalted One has spoken.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du dper na /üîΩnam mkha' sems can gzhal du ma mchis grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyi go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de 'ang sems can gzhal du ma mchis @86a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du dper na / nam mkha' sems can gzhal du ma mchis grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyi go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de 'ang sems can gzhal du ma mchis @86a * //
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúFor example,üîΩjust as space provides room for infinite, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings,

original: grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyi go skabs 'byed pa lags te /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyi go skabs 'byed pa lags te /
translated: so too this Great Vehicle provides room for infinite, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings.üîΩTherefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.‚ÄùüîΩThis is because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle do not exist.

original: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes smras pa de ni zhes bya bas sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po med pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po ni sems can gzhal du med pa dang grangs med pa dang tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin pa dang /
analyzed: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes smras pa de ni zhes bya bas sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po med pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po ni sems can gzhal du med pa dang grangs med pa dang tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin pa dang /
translated: The Great Vehicle provides room for infinite, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are not apprehended.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa med pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa'i lam ni sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa med pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa'i lam ni sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that the path subsumed by the aspect of non-apprehension is the cause of the definite emergence of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: lam yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa bcus bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: lam yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa bcus bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The path is also subsumed by the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: gang gi phyir sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po med pas gzhal du med pas na theg pa chen po la sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyi go skabs yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po med pas gzhal du med pas na theg pa chen po la sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyi go skabs yod pa yin te /
translated: Since sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are immeasurable, the Great Vehicle has the opportunity for sentient beings as previously explained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can la sogs pa ni dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa ni dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because sentient beings and so on are non-apprehensible.üîΩBecause the first stage and so on are not the objects of the path of seeing that has conceptual thoughts.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong ba'i lam gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / yang sems can dang nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po med pas grangs med pas na de nyid la sngar brjod pa'i sems can gyi go skabs 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong ba'i lam gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / yang sems can dang nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po med pas grangs med pas na de nyid la sngar brjod pa'i sems can gyi go skabs 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, since sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are innumerable, the Great Vehicle has the opportunity for sentient beings as previously explained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams ni dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de rnams ni dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are unobservable.üîΩIn the second, when the small of the small path abandons the great of the great conceptions, sentient beings and so on are unobservable.

original: gnyis par lam chung du'i chung dus rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spangs pa na sems can la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / yang sems can gyi khams dang chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po rnams med pas na tshad med pas de nyid la sngar brjod pa'i sems can rnams kyi go skabs yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis par lam chung du'i chung dus rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spangs pa na sems can la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / yang sems can gyi khams dang chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po rnams med pas na tshad med pas de nyid la sngar brjod pa'i sems can rnams kyi go skabs yod pa yin te /
translated: Again, since the realms of sentient beings, the expanse of reality, space and the Great Vehicle do not exist, they are immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are all unobservable.

original: gsum pa la rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chung du'i 'bring ni de rnams spong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chung du'i 'bring ni de rnams spong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the third, the medium of the small path is the antidote to the medium of the great conceptions because it abandons them.

original: yang sems can dang de bzhin nyid dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang 'dus ma byas kyi gzhal @86b du med pa dang grangs med pa dang tshad ma mchis pa rnams med pa rnams kyi chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la snga ma bzhin
analyzed: yang sems can dang de bzhin nyid dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang 'dus ma byas kyi gzhal @86b du med pa dang grangs med pa dang tshad ma mchis pa rnams med pa rnams kyi chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la snga ma bzhin
translated: Again, all phenomena are nonexistent because of the nonexistence of sentient beings, suchness, space, the Great Vehicle, the immeasurable, the countless, and the infinite that are unconditioned.

original: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as before.

original: bzhi pa la rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung du'i gnyen po la ma chung ngu'i chen pos de rnams mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa la rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung du'i gnyen po la ma chung ngu'i chen pos de rnams mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the fourth, because of the antidote to the small of the great discriminations, the small of the great do not see those.

original: yang bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa rnams med pa nyid kyis chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la zhes bya ba thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa rnams med pa nyid kyis chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la zhes bya ba thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: Again, all phenomena are nonexistent because of the nonexistence of self, sentient being, life, and so on, the perfect end, space, the Great Vehicle, the immeasurable, the countless, and the infinite.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as before.

original: lnga pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chung ngus de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chung ngus de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the fifth, due to the small middle path antidote to the great of the middling conceptualizations, those are not observed.

original: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa rnams dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa rnams dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the self and so on, the inconceivable expanse, the aggregates of form and so on, space, the MahƒÅyƒÅna, the immeasurable, the countless, and the limitless do not exist.

original: grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa rnams med pa nyid kyis de nyid la zhes thams cad sbyar te /
analyzed: grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa rnams med pa nyid kyis de nyid la zhes thams cad sbyar te /
translated: This is applied to everything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as before.üîΩOn the sixth, due to the medium of the medium path antidote to the medium of the middling conceptualizations, those are not observed.

original: drug pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring po'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam 'bring po'i 'bring gis de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang /
analyzed: drug pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring po'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam 'bring po'i 'bring gis de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang /
translated: Moreover, the self and so on, the eyes and so on, space, the MahƒÅyƒÅna, the immeasurable, the countless, and the limitless do not exist.

original: theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis de la zhes thams cad sbyar te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis de la zhes thams cad sbyar te /
translated: the Great Vehicle, the immeasurable, the countless, the infinite, and the non-existence of all phenomena, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as explained above.üîΩOn the seventh, the path of medium greatness is the antidote to the small of the medium of conceptuality, because those are non-existent objects.

original: bdun pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung ngu'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen pos de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang ; sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bdun pa la rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung ngu'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen pos de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang ; sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, it is because of the non-existence of self and so on, the perfections such as generosity,

original: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid la zhes thams cad la sbyar te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid la zhes thams cad la sbyar te /
translated: space, the Great Vehicle, the immeasurable, the countless, the infinite, and all phenomena, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as explained above.

original: brgyad pa @87a * //
analyzed: brgyad pa @87a * //
translated: On the eighth,

original: la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chung ngus de rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chung ngus de rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bdag la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang /
translated: Moreover, because of the nonexistence of self and so on, of all emptinesses, of the factors of enlightenment, up to and including the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha,

original: rigs la sogs pa'i sa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i sa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: of the stages of lineage and so on, of stream enterer and so on, of the vehicles of ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, of the tathƒÅgata, and of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la zhes thams cad snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / chos thams cad med pas na de nyid la zhes thams cad snga ma bzhin te /
translated: because of the nonexistence of space, of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, and of all phenomena, it is just that, as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: It is as before.

original: dgu pa la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chen po'i 'bring gis de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa chen po la sngar brjod pa'i sems can gyi go skabs yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgu pa la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chen po'i 'bring gis de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa chen po la sngar brjod pa'i sems can gyi go skabs yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, just as nirvana and space exist, the great vehicle exists, as previously stated, for sentient beings.

original: sa bcu pa la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chen po ni nam mkha' bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba tsam du gnas bar bya ba yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chen po ni nam mkha' bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba tsam du gnas bar bya ba yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: On the tenth, the great of the great path, which is the antidote to the small of the small conception, is to be maintained as merely free of the obscurations of omniscience, like space.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni mdo gzhan las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni mdo gzhan las kyang gsungs te /
translated: This kind of aspect is also stated in other s≈´tras.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros ji lta ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa de lta de ltar sems can tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros ji lta ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa de lta de ltar sems can tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed do zhes so //
translated: ≈öƒÅntamati, the closer you get to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the more you bring to maturity sentient beings who are immeasurable, countless, and limitless.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to spontaneous deliverance,

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la 'gro ba'am /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúThat Great Vehicle does not apprehend coming,

original: 'ong ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'ong ba mi dmigs /
translated: does not apprehend going,üîΩand does not apprehend staying.‚ÄùüîΩThat is so.üîΩYou accept that it is spontaneous deliverance that does not come, go, or stay.

original: gnas pa mi dmigs so zhes smras pa de ni zhes bya bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang gnas pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba zhal gyis bzhes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa mi dmigs so zhes smras pa de ni zhes bya bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang gnas pa med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba zhal gyis bzhes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all phenomena are motionless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / mig la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / chos @87b kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / mig la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / chos @87b kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
translated: The nature, suchness, and characteristics of the aggregates such as form, the six sense bases such as the eyes, the six elements such as earth, the dharmadhatu, suchness, the perfect limit, the inconceivable realm, the perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: the factors of enlightenment, the powers and so forth up to the unshared qualities of a buddha, perfect complete enlightenment, and the unconditioned,

original: mtshan nyid rnams la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang gnas pa bkag pa lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba shes par byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang gnas pa bkag pa lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba shes par byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: are known through the meaning of the negation of coming, going, and abiding, which is spontaneous effortless renunciation.

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the transcendence of extremes, it is said:

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúThe Great Vehicle is not observed in the past,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: it is not observed in the future,

original: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: and it is not observed in the present.

original: theg pa de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid lags te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid lags te /
translated: That vehicle is the sameness of the three times.

original: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.‚ÄùüîΩYou said that, and you accept that the sameness of the three times is the definitive emergence that transcends extremes.

original: zhes bya bas gang smras pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gang smras pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe three times, the sameness of those, the Great Vehicle, and bodhisattvas are empty of their own entities.

original: dus gsum po rnams dang / de'i mnyam pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid la'ang gcig nas bcu'i bar gyi grangs bkag pas theg pa chen po la mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum po rnams dang / de'i mnyam pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid la'ang gcig nas bcu'i bar gyi grangs bkag pas theg pa chen po la mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang /
translated: Since the enumeration of one to ten is negated even in emptiness, the Great Vehicle is the same as and not the same as the three times.

original: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug med pa dang / ming dang ming med pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang gti mug med pa dang / ming dang ming med pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang /
translated: attachment, nonattachment, anger, nonanger, delusion, nondelusion, name, nonname, virtue, nonvirtue, contaminated, uncontaminated,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: blameworthy, blameless, afflictive, unafflictive, mundane, supramundane, thoroughly afflicted, thoroughly pure,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba dang / de dag las bzlog pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / de las yang dag par 'das pa'ang @88a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhi ba dang / de dag las bzlog pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / de las yang dag par 'das pa'ang @88a * //
translated: sa·πÉsƒÅra, nirvƒÅ·πáa, permanent, blissful, self, peaceful, the opposite of those, the desire realm and so on, and transcending those

original: mi dmigs pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: are not observed. And why?

original: 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pas stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pas stong pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Past form and so on are empty of past form and so on.üîΩWhy is this?üîΩBecause emptiness is not perceived in emptiness, it is impossible to perceive past form and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir na 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa mi srid pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir na 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa mi srid pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa nas /
translated: Because the three times are the same, the past and so on and the perfections are not perceived.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi bar mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi bar mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na 'das pa la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na 'das pa la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible to perceive the past and so on and the perfections in the sameness of sameness.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nas /
translated: The applications of mindfulness and so on

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIn the same way, from the ordinary person up to the Tathagata, one should not apprehend a prior limit, etc.

original: de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?üîΩBecause sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: Subhuti, this is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, called the equality of the three times.

original: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Abiding in it, the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and goes forth to the knowledge of all modes.

original: thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the going forth characterized by attainment,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur to //
translated: Blessed One, past, future, and present bodhisattva great beings, having trained in this Great Vehicle, have attained, will attain, and are attaining omniscience.üîΩThus, it is the teaching of the Great Vehicle that establishes the certainty of attainment, saying, Those who have attained, will attain, and are attaining omniscience have done so, will do so, and are doing so by training in this Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba nye bar 'god pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid dang rjes su mthun par theg pa chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba thob pas khyab pa shes par byed pa'i don can nyid dang /
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba nye bar 'god pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid dang rjes su mthun par theg pa chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba thob pas khyab pa shes par byed pa'i don can nyid dang /
translated: It is the teaching of the Great Vehicle that reveals the pervasion of attainment, saying, All noble beings have attained, will attain, and are attaining the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is the teaching of the Great Vehicle that reveals the attainment of completeness, saying, All phenomena are included and subsumed in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab @88b kyi pha rol tu phyin par chos thams cad 'dus shing gzhol pa'i thabs bstan pa zhes bya ba thob pa ma tshang ba med pa shes par byed pa'i don can dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab @88b kyi pha rol tu phyin par chos thams cad 'dus shing gzhol pa'i thabs bstan pa zhes bya ba thob pa ma tshang ba med pa shes par byed pa'i don can dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: theg pa chen por pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen por pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In the Great Vehicle, all these phenomena, from the perfections and so on, the aggregates of form and so forth, the factors of awakening, up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha, and what is called the expanse of nirvana, are not conjoined and are not disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: They are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: are unobstructing,üîΩand are of one mark‚Äîthat is, the mark of having no mark.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid de zhes bya ba rtogs pa thob pa'i ngas par 'byung ba'i rnam grangs ji skad du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid de zhes bya ba rtogs pa thob pa'i ngas par 'byung ba'i rnam grangs ji skad du bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the way of explanation of the enumeration of the emergence of the realization that I, the Buddha, have attained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa theg pa chen po'i nang du 'du bar dgongs pas thob pa gtan du ba nyid shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa theg pa chen po'i nang du 'du bar dgongs pas thob pa gtan du ba nyid shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúobtain‚Äù is to be understood as the attainment of the ultimate, since the Great Vehicle is taught in accordance with the perfection of wisdom, and since the practice of the perfection of wisdom is included in the Great Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtheg pa chen po dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / theg pa chen po dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the Great Vehicle and the perfection of wisdom, up to and including all dharmas, are not two and cannot be made two.

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa thob pa'i rnam grangs kyis theg pa chen po rjes su mthun pas bstan pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa thob pa'i rnam grangs kyis theg pa chen po rjes su mthun pas bstan pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Great Vehicle is taught in accordance with the enumeration of the attainment of that.

original: de la thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba ni don rnam pa gsum dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba ni don rnam pa gsum dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the attainment of the going forth should be understood to have the characteristic of the negation of the three kinds of objects.

original: rnam pa gsum dgag pa'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dgag pa'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: The negation of the three kinds is as follows.

original: thob par bya ba dgag pa dang / thob pa po dgag pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'brel pa dgag pa ste /üîΩtshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' chen po sngon gyi mthar dmigs su med pa yin zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: thob par bya ba dgag pa dang / thob pa po dgag pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'brel pa dgag pa ste / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' chen po sngon gyi mthar dmigs su med pa yin zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: the refutation of the object of attainment, the refutation of the attainer, and the refutation of the relation between the two.üîΩVenerable Subhuti, why is it that you say, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva mahasattva is not apprehended at the prior limit,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva is infinite because form is infinite,‚Äù

original: ci yi phyir na gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med ces bya ba dang / de skad du ci'i phyir na de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @89a * //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med ces bya ba dang / de skad du ci'i phyir na de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @89a * //
translated: and ‚ÄúIt is not the case that form is the bodhisattva,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIn that case, since I do not see any bodhisattva at all, anywhere, in any respect, what bodhisattva should I instruct and demonstrate in what perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas so zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gang zhig mngon par ma grub pa'i gzugs de gang yin /
analyzed: pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas so zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gang zhig mngon par ma grub pa'i gzugs de gang yin /
translated: And, Why is it that the form which is not established is that?üîΩ And, That which is not established is not form.

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pas mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi 'am zhes smra /
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba dang / mngon par ma grub pas mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi 'am zhes smra /
translated: And, Should the perfection of wisdom which is not established instruct and teach the one who is not established?

original: de skad du mngon par ma grub pa las gud na'ang byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba dmigs su ma mchis so zhes smra /
analyzed: de skad du mngon par ma grub pa las gud na'ang byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba dmigs su ma mchis so zhes smra /
translated: And, Apart from the not established, the bodhisattva is not apprehended.üîΩ And, Why is it that one says, 'If it is taught in this way'?

original: ci'i phyir na 'di skad ces gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'di skad ces gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de la dris pa dang po nges par bstan pa las brtsams te thob par bya ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dris pa dang po nges par bstan pa las brtsams te thob par bya ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In response to the first question, the text begins by teaching the refutation of attainment from the perspective of the negation of attainment.

original: sems can med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / rang bzhin med pas sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus rnams su byang chub sems dpar khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa dus gsum pa'i thob par bya ba'i don med par shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / rang bzhin med pas sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus rnams su byang chub sems dpar khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa dus gsum pa'i thob par bya ba'i don med par shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
translated: It states that since sentient beings do not exist, are empty, are void, and are essenceless, the attainment of the bodhisattva is negated in the past, future, and present. This is to be understood as meaning that there is no object of attainment in the three times.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the aggregates and so on, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, up to and including the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, do not exist, are empty, are void, and are essenceless.

original: rang bzhin med pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa rnams su byang chub sems dpa' khas len pa'i thob pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa rnams su byang chub sems dpa' khas len pa'i thob pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and the absence of intrinsic reality, and the refutation of the acceptance of the obtainment of the bodhisattva in the past and so on, and the reason for that,

original: med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam grangs gzhan du khas mi len pa ste /
analyzed: med pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam grangs gzhan du khas mi len pa ste /
translated: namely, the nonapprehension of the past and so on in the absence of intrinsic reality and so on, and the nonacceptance of the perfections and so on as synonyms for the absence of intrinsic reality and so on.

original: ji skad du mdo las /üîΩstong pa nyid gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las / stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin /
translated: A sutra declares:üîΩEmptiness is not one thing and the perfection of generosity another.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And so too:

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams la yang brjod par bya ba dang / gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags @89b pa'i gang zag rnams med pa nyid la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams la yang brjod par bya ba dang / gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags @89b pa'i gang zag rnams med pa nyid la sogs pa dang /
translated: the doors of concentration and retention, the expanse of reality, suchness, and the very limit of reality, and also the nonexistence of the noble persons of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on,üîΩand the refutation of the attainment of the bodhisattva from the prior limit and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blang ba'i thob ba bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blang ba'i thob ba bkag pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa nyid nas brtsams te /
analyzed: med pa nyid nas brtsams te /
translated: From nonexistence up to

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar du de dag thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar du de dag thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: buddha, all of these are nondual and not divided into two.

original: thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: With regard to the refutation of the one who attains, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause form is infinite‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The non-apprehension of the aggregates such as form, etc., up to the unshared qualities of a Buddha, in the prior limit, etc.,üîΩand the reason for that: ‚Äúbecause of emptiness.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba dang / gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba dang / gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúForm is not a Bodhisattva, and is not apprehended,‚Äù and so on,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and the reason for that:üîΩ‚Äúbecause of emptiness of form, etc., up to the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad ma dmigs na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad ma dmigs na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen a great Bodhisattva does not apprehend anything at all, in any way, anywhere,‚Äù and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is shown by the aggregates, etc. up to the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, and by the fact that a Buddha is not apprehended as a Buddha.

original: de la thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid thams cad du'o thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa bsdus pa dang so so'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'o//
analyzed: de la thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid thams cad du'o thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa bsdus pa dang so so'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'o//
translated: Therein, ‚Äúeverywhere‚Äù means in the characteristics of all things, such as the aggregates. ‚Äú All‚Äù means the bodhisattva who is included in the aggregates, etc. and who has the individual nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par khyad par rnams su'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par khyad par rnams su'o //
translated: ‚Äú In every way‚Äù means in the various aspects, such as the emptiness of internal things, etc.

original: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa bsdus pa dang so so so so'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa bsdus pa dang so so so so'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú All‚Äù again means the individual characteristics of the various aspects.

original: thams cad nyid 'di ni gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad nyid 'di ni gnyis te /
translated: This ‚Äúall‚Äù is twofold:

original: dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: all things and all aspects.

original: thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i 'brel pa dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang thob pa po'i 'brel pa dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The following is stated from the perspective of refuting the relation between that which is to be attained and the attainer.üîΩIt is stated beginning from:

original: gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is called ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô is a name that is suddenly imputed.

original: chos thams cad ming tsam yin ba nyid kyis na med cing mi dmigs pa yin @90a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam yin ba nyid kyis na med cing mi dmigs pa yin @90a * //
translated: Since all phenomena are mere names, they are non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag cing tha snyad tsam du khas blangs pa dang / shin tu mngon par ma grub pa dag gis te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag cing tha snyad tsam du khas blangs pa dang / shin tu mngon par ma grub pa dag gis te /
translated: Thus, the establishment of the self is refuted, and it is accepted as mere conventionality, and by those who are utterly non-established.

original: de la glo bur gyi don ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i don la btags pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la glo bur gyi don ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i don la btags pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äòsudden‚Äô is the meaning of imputation to that which is not its nature, the meaning of superimposition.

original: bdag bdag ces brjod kyang bdag gtan du mngon par ma grub pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ces gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag bdag ces brjod kyang bdag gtan du mngon par ma grub pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ces gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Although it is said ‚Äòself‚Äô and ‚ÄòI,‚Äô the self is utterly non-established. In the same way, it is said that all phenomena are also like that.

original: yang chos thams cad sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pas dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad mi rtag pa nyid gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du de dag nyid kyi dge ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa rnams gang dang yang bral bsam yin bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: yang chos thams cad sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pas dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad mi rtag pa nyid gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du de dag nyid kyi dge ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa rnams gang dang yang bral bsam yin bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar dang /
translated: Again, all phenomena are the nature of nonthings because they are negated as the essence arisen from preparation, they are not nonthings because they are not free from impermanence and similarly they are not free from virtue, nonvirtue and so on up to they are not free from the nature of nonthings.üîΩAgain, all phenomena are not permanence and not annihilation.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad ther zug tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid ma yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad ther zug tu gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid ma yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa dang / gzhan yang chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag pa dang / ci'i phyir na mngon par 'du byed pa dmigs su med pa nyid dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa dang / gzhan yang chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag pa dang / ci'i phyir na mngon par 'du byed pa dmigs su med pa nyid dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pa dang /
translated: The nature of that is that. Furthermore, because all phenomena are unconditioned, the establishment of the unestablished is refuted, and why? Because the conditioning of the unconditioned is not observed, and because all phenomena are empty by nature, arising, ceasing, and abiding are refuted as being other.

original: mngon par ma grub pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par ma grub pa dag gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang / chos rnams thams cad dang mngon par ma grub pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par ma grub pa dag gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang / chos rnams thams cad dang mngon par ma grub pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang /
translated: The unestablished and the perfection of wisdom are not two and cannot be made two, and all phenomena and the unestablished are not two and cannot be made two.

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa dang rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba la sogs par mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / chos de dag la 'di ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa dang rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba la sogs par mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / chos de dag la 'di ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When thoroughly investigating those phenomena,

original: gzugs khas mi len zhing mi 'dzin la gnas par mi bgyid de /
analyzed: gzugs khas mi len zhing mi 'dzin la gnas par mi bgyid de /
translated: he does not accept, does not grasp, and does not abide in form.

original: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya bas chos su khas mi len pa la sogs pa bkag pas te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya bas chos su khas mi len pa la sogs pa bkag pas te /
translated: He does not conceive of it and does not impute it.

original: de la gzugs la mi dmigs te khas len pa dang / de thob pa bdag gir byed pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i ye shes bskyed ba dang / de rjes nyid du srid pas mngon du byed pa dang / de nye bar rtog pas @90b brtags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la gzugs la mi dmigs te khas len pa dang / de thob pa bdag gir byed pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i ye shes bskyed ba dang / de rjes nyid du srid pas mngon du byed pa dang / de nye bar rtog pas @90b brtags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In that regard, he does not observe form and does not accept it, he does not obtain it and does not make it his own, he does not generate the wisdom that observes it, he does not manifest it through existence immediately after, and he does not investigate it.

original: gzugs khas len pa la sogs pa'i tshig lnga go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs khas len pa la sogs pa'i tshig lnga go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the five phrases such as ‚Äúaccepting form‚Äù are to be applied in order to those five.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause all phenomena are unarisen and all phenomena are essenceless, they are not apprehended.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis na dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis na dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause phenomena and their emptiness, etc. are not two nor divided, and similarly, whatever is the decrease of phenomena is not a phenomenon.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause phenomena and their decrease are not two nor divided.

original: chos rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa de 'ang chos ma lags so //
analyzed: chos rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa de 'ang chos ma lags so //
translated: And whatever is the decrease of the perfection of giving is not the perfection of giving.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of giving and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of wisdom and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the knowledge of all aspects and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of form is not form.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause form and its decrease are not two nor divided.

original: chos rnams dang 'grib pa ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes gang gsungs pas thob par bya ba dang thob pa po gnyis bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams dang 'grib pa ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes gang gsungs pas thob par bya ba dang thob pa po gnyis bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And whatever is the decrease of the perfection of giving is not the perfection of giving.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of giving and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of wisdom and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the knowledge of all aspects and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of form is not form.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause form and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the perfection of giving is not the perfection of giving.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of giving and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the perfection of wisdom and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause the knowledge of all aspects and its decrease are not two nor divided.üîΩAnd whatever is the decrease of form is not form.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause form and its decrease are not two nor divided

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement from the perspective of definite emergence in omniscience is:

original: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: By that enlightenment, one knows the aspects of all phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi rnam pa shes pa de la mngon par chags pas 'jug pa bkag pa dang / chos rnams kyi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma gang gis chos rnams 'dzin pas so zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi rnam pa shes pa de la mngon par chags pas 'jug pa bkag pa dang / chos rnams kyi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma gang gis chos rnams 'dzin pas so zhes bya ba dang /
translated: From there, it refutes engaging through attachment to the knowledge of the aspects of the aggregates and so on, from form and so forth up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, and it says, ‚ÄúBy the aspects, signs and marks of phenomena, one apprehends phenomena.‚ÄùüîΩIt says, ‚ÄúBecause it goes far to all phenomena, it is called the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'di chos thams cad la ring du song ba des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mthar thug bar de rnams las song zhing rnam par bsrings pas te /
analyzed: 'di chos thams cad la ring du song ba des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mthar thug bar de rnams las song zhing rnam par bsrings pas te /
translated: It goes far to the limit of natural luminosity and extends to those.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout being attached to them‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúwithout being attached to them.‚Äù

original: kun dga' bo des na 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo des na 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod de /
translated: ƒÄnanda, therefore this is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems bskyed pa'i mthar thug par rang gi don de la dga' bas kun dga' bas te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i mthar thug par rang gi don de la dga' bas kun dga' bas te /
translated: It is the delight of one‚Äôs own goal through the delight of generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de las song zhing 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de las song zhing 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving gone beyond that.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the cause of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos thams cad kyi bar du re re zhing rtag ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos thams cad kyi bar du re re zhing rtag ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Each of the forms, etc., up to all dharmas, is called ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù etc.,

original: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes @91a * //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes @91a * //
translated: and ‚Äúisolated‚Äù and ‚Äúnot isolated.‚Äù

original: bya bar mi rtog pa'i chos yongs su rtog pa'i rnam pa bsdus par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la skye ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid la de'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: bya bar mi rtog pa'i chos yongs su rtog pa'i rnam pa bsdus par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la skye ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid la de'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i bar dang /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena from non-arising up to the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects that refutes their entityness,üîΩthe decrease of all phenomena, the knowledge of all aspects, and non-duality,

original: 'grib pa gang yin pa dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gnyis su med pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'grib pa gang yin pa dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gnyis su med pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: all those phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined,

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded,üîΩthus they are of a single identity that is without identity.üîΩThe realization that all phenomena are non-arising,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / chos rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa nye bar bzung nas gnyis su med par bgrangs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / chos rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa nye bar bzung nas gnyis su med par bgrangs pa dang /
translated: the enumeration of non-duality based on the non-differentiation of phenomena,

original: chos thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la nye bar rtog pa yin pa dang / de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa'i 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag med pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la nye bar rtog pa yin pa dang / de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa'i 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag med pa dang /
translated: If that were so, then the distinctions of the five destinies of the Bodhisattva would not exist,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa lnga thob pa dang / de'i lam bsgom pa med pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa'ang mi 'thad pas de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa lnga thob pa dang / de'i lam bsgom pa med pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa'ang mi 'thad pas de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: and it would not be tenable that he attains the five, such as the Stream Enterer, and that he cultivates the path of that, and that he practices austerities. Therefore, the Tathagata‚Äôs complete and perfect enlightenment in unsurpassed, complete, perfect enlightenment,üîΩand the turning of the wheel of the Dharma would not exist.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'ang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'ang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni chos ma skyes pa la thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yod par bya ba mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni chos ma skyes pa la thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yod par bya ba mi 'dod do //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Sariputra, I do not assert that there is attainment and clear realization of a non-produced dharma.‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: One does not assert that the stream enterer exists in the unarisen.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /üîΩchos thams cad la khas len pa 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa dang / chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag gis thob par bya /üîΩskyes pa dang ma skyes pa 'thob pa dris pa dang / de gnyi ga'i dngos po mi 'dod par bstan ba dang ; chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag gis thob par 'dod pa dris pa dang / de gnyi ga'i dngos po 'dod pa dris pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / chos thams cad la khas len pa 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa dang / chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag gis thob par bya / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa 'thob pa dris pa dang / de gnyi ga'i dngos po mi 'dod par bstan ba dang ; chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag gis thob par 'dod pa dris pa dang / de gnyi ga'i dngos po 'dod pa dris pa dang /
translated: One does not assert that the fruit of stream enterer exists.üîΩThe explanation of the unsuitability of accepting all phenomena, the question of whether the unarisen and arisen obtain the unarisen and arisen,üîΩthe explanation of the unsuitability of asserting both of those, the question of whether the unarisen and arisen obtain the unarisen and arisen, the question of whether both of those are asserted,

original: thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med pa nyid du dris pa dang / de gnyis ka yod par khas blangs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa brjod pa'i rigs pa bzhin du de gnyi ga 'jig rten gyi tha snyad @91b du khas blangs pa dang /
analyzed: thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med pa nyid du dris pa dang / de gnyis ka yod par khas blangs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa brjod pa'i rigs pa bzhin du de gnyi ga 'jig rten gyi tha snyad @91b du khas blangs pa dang /
translated: the question of whether there is no obtainment and no clear realization, the assertion that both of those exist, the assertion that both of those exist in terms of worldly convention like the reasoning of the clear realization,

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma skyes pa skyes pa bkag pa dang / skye ba med pa brjod par mi spobs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma skyes pa skyes pa bkag pa dang / skye ba med pa brjod par mi spobs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the arising of the non-arisen is refuted, nor is it the case that one is not eloquent about non-arising.üîΩWhy is that?üîΩBecause non-arising, eloquence, expression, and non-arising are not characterized by the logic of the expression of realization.

original: skye ba med pa dang / slobs ba dang / brjod pa dang / mi skye ba rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa brjod pa'i rigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / slobs ba dang / brjod pa dang / mi skye ba rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa brjod pa'i rigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause all phenomena are non-arising.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de la spobs pa ni rjod byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de la spobs pa ni rjod byed do //
translated: In that case, eloquence is the means of expression,

original: rjod pa ni brjod par bya ba yin pas na brjod pa ste don no //
analyzed: rjod pa ni brjod par bya ba yin pas na brjod pa ste don no //
translated: and expression is what is to be expressed, so it is expression, meaning.

original: de lta yin dang 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag dang / thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / skye ba ni tha snyad du yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag dang / thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / skye ba ni tha snyad du yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the distinctions of the five destinies, attainment, realization, and birth are conventional.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa ni las dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa skye bar dris pa dang /
analyzed: don dam pa ni las dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa skye bar dris pa dang /
translated: The question is asked whether an unarisen phenomenon arises or an arisen phenomenon arises.

original: de gnyi ga skye bar 'dod pa bkag pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga skye bar 'dod pa bkag pa ste /
translated: The assertion that both arise is refuted.üîΩThe question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat are those unarisen phenomena that you do not assert arise?‚Äù

original: de yod du chug kyang zhes bya bar bsams pa dang / ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa de dag gang yin zhes dris pa dang / gzugs nas brtsams te chos thams cad kyi bar ma skyes pa'i chos rnams skye bar mi 'dod pa'i rnam grangs kyis brjod pa dang spobs pa skye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de yod du chug kyang zhes bya bar bsams pa dang / ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa de dag gang yin zhes dris pa dang / gzugs nas brtsams te chos thams cad kyi bar ma skyes pa'i chos rnams skye bar mi 'dod pa'i rnam grangs kyis brjod pa dang spobs pa skye ba med pa dang /
translated: The answer is given in terms of the unarisen phenomena from form to all phenomena, the unarisen eloquence and the unarisen phenomena that are the unarisen phenomena of form and so on.

original: dris pa thams cad kyi lan gyi nges par 'byung bas na mi gnas pa nyid nye bar bzung nas gnas brtan rab 'byor mchog tu bzhag pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ston pa po'i 'os su shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
analyzed: dris pa thams cad kyi lan gyi nges par 'byung bas na mi gnas pa nyid nye bar bzung nas gnas brtan rab 'byor mchog tu bzhag pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ston pa po'i 'os su shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
translated: Since it is the definitive emergence of the answer to all questions, it is understood to be the meaning of the non-abiding, and it is understood to be the meaning of the elder Subh≈´ti being posited as the supreme teacher of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nas chos thams cad kyi bar rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nas chos thams cad kyi bar rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aggregates such as form and all phenomena are empty of their own nature,

original: nang la sogs pa la brten par mi dmigs pa nyid ston pa po mi gnas par rtogs par byed pa'i don can gyis te /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa la brten par mi dmigs pa nyid ston pa po mi gnas par rtogs par byed pa'i don can gyis te /
translated: it is the meaning of the teacher realizing non-abiding, which is the non-apprehension of the internal and so on.

original: 'di'i mdo ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The s≈´tra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, form is empty of its own nature.

original: de ni nang nas yang mi gnas phyi rol na'ang mi gnas gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nang nas yang mi gnas phyi rol na'ang mi gnas gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It does not abide internally, it does not abide externally, and it is not apprehended as either.

original: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The s≈´tra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of generosity, Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,üîΩexists both as mundane and as supramundane.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod ces bya bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar 'god pa na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod ces bya bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar 'god pa na /
translated: When the path that causes the attainment of the knowledge of all modes is set forth,

original: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po @92a * //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po @92a * //
translated: the object given, the giver,üîΩand the receiver are apprehended. Because it does not move out, does not rise out, does not go beyond the mundane, therefore it is just a mundane perfection.

original: dang ; len pa por dmigs pas 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phag mi 'da' ba de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pas ni /
analyzed: dang ; len pa por dmigs pas 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phag mi 'da' ba de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pas ni /
translated: But the generosity that is purified of the three spheres, and is dedicated to full enlightenment,

original: 'jig rten las sgrol bar byed pa dang / g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bar byed pa de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las sgrol bar byed pa dang / g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bar byed pa de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because it transcends the mundane, it is the perfection of transcendent generosity, and the same should be said for the perfection of transcendent wisdom.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges par rnyed pas na 'jig rten las g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges par rnyed pas na 'jig rten las g-yo ba'o //
translated: Here, it is transcendent because it is attained by the supramundane path.

original: de thob pa'i thabs nye bar tshol bas na 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i thabs nye bar tshol bas na 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is noble because it seeks the means to attain that.

original: de'i bar chad kyi chos yongs su spong bas na 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bar chad kyi chos yongs su spong bas na 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is beyond because it abandons the qualities that obstruct that.

original: yang na g-yo ba ni sems bskyed pa'i dus so //
analyzed: yang na g-yo ba ni sems bskyed pa'i dus so //
translated: Alternatively, it is transcendent because it is the time of generating the mind,

original: 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dus so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dus so //
