translated: it is noble because it is the time of the factors conducive to insight,

original: 'da' ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i dus su su'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'da' ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i dus su su'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
translated: and it is beyond because it is the time of the knowledge of the teaching on suffering. This is another formulation.

original: 'di las bzlog pas na mi g-yo mi 'phag mi 'da' ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pas na mi g-yo mi 'phag mi 'da' ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as not transcendent, not noble, and not beyond.

original: gang zhig 'jig rten mngon par gsal bar gyur pa yin pa'am /üîΩgang zhig mngon par 'grub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten mngon par gsal bar gyur pa yin pa'am / gang zhig mngon par 'grub par byed pa'am /
translated: those who are established in the world,üîΩthose who are equal to the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten gyis te 'jig rten par mnyam pa'am /üîΩgang zhig 'jig rten gyi phyir mngon bar 'byin pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten gyis te 'jig rten par mnyam pa'am / gang zhig 'jig rten gyi phyir mngon bar 'byin pa'am /
translated: those who are emanated for the world,

original: gang 'jig rten las nges par mi 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten las nges par mi 'byung ba'am /
translated: those who do not transcend the world,

original: gang 'jig rten gyi yin pa'am /üîΩgang 'jig rten du skyed par byed pa de dag ni 'jig rten ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ces bya ba dang / gang dag gi 'jig rten sgrol pa yin pa'am /üîΩgang gis 'jig rten las sgrol ba'am /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi yin pa'am / gang 'jig rten du skyed par byed pa de dag ni 'jig rten ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ces bya ba dang / gang dag gi 'jig rten sgrol pa yin pa'am / gang gis 'jig rten las sgrol ba'am /
translated: those who are of the world,üîΩthose who are born in the world,üîΩthose who are liberated from the world,üîΩthose who liberate the world,

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten la rgal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten la rgal bar byed pa'am /
translated: those who liberate the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'am /üîΩgang zhig 'jig rten las nges par 'byin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'am / gang zhig 'jig rten las nges par 'byin par byed pa'am /
translated: those who are not for the benefit of the world,üîΩthose who transcend the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten gyi sgrol byed yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten gyi sgrol byed yin pa'am /
translated: those who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,üîΩthose who are the liberators of the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten na sgrol byed yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ces bya ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi lam yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten na sgrol byed yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ces bya ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi lam yin pa nyid dang /
translated: Those that are liberators in the world are called transcendent perfections that transcend the world.üîΩBecause they are the cause for the realization of all ƒÅrya beings such as those of the past, they are the path to enlightenment.üîΩBecause they are the cause for the generation of the perfection of wisdom, which causes the ƒÅryas to be born from the transcendent path, they are the path to enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las nges par skyes pa @92b nyid du shes par byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed byed yin pa nyid dang / sems mi zhum pa dang mi skrag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las nges par skyes pa @92b nyid du shes par byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed byed yin pa nyid dang / sems mi zhum pa dang mi skrag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba nyid dang /
translated: Because they are inseparable from mental attention through not being discouraged or frightened and so on, they are the path to enlightenment.

original: de lta yin na ha cang thal ches par brjod pa dang / de ni yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ha cang thal ches par brjod pa dang / de ni yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, it is said that there is an extreme consequence and that is the correct expression.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid dang / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la de bzhin du sbyar ba nas /
analyzed: sems can med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid dang / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la de bzhin du sbyar ba nas /
translated: and the absence of sentient beings, the absence of intrinsic nature, emptiness, isolation, and the absence of complete buddhahood, and similarly, all phenomena from form and so on up to omniscience, and so on.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chen po gnas pa 'di dang yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes kho bo smra'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chen po gnas pa 'di dang yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes kho bo smra'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yin te /
translated: Thus, I say that the great bodhisattva is not separated from this state and this mental attention.

original: de ltar nges par 'byung ba brgyad po 'di dag gi nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byung ba brgyad po 'di dag gi nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these eight emancipations should be known as the practice of emancipation.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi go rims kyi tshul 'di ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi go rims kyi tshul 'di ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: The order of these practices of armor and so on is reasonable.

original: go bgos pa ni 'jug go //
analyzed: go bgos pa ni 'jug go //
translated: One who has donned the armor engages.

original: zhugs pa ni dpung gi tshogs sog go //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni dpung gi tshogs sog go //
translated: One who has engaged in the battle of the bodhisattva gathers the army.

original: dpung gi tshogs bsags pa ni ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba thob pas nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs bsags pa ni ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba thob pas nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of the army is the going forth, because it is the attainment of victory over what has not been conquered.

original: de ltar byas na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na /
translated: Thus,üîΩthe generation of the thought, the instruction,üîΩthe four limbs of definite discernment,

original: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yin ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yin ni rten gyur pa //
translated: and the practice are the basis.üîΩThe nature of the dharma-dhƒÅtu,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
translated: the object, the purpose,üîΩthe armor, the engagement, the activity,

original: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
analyzed: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
translated: and the accumulation with going forth

original: thub pa rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: thub pa rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: are the omniscience of the Sage.

original: ces gsungs pa de ni 'dir rjes su 'das pa'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa de ni 'dir rjes su 'das pa'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen as the related meaning that is being followed here.

original: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams kyi go rims kyi tshul 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don 'di rnams kyi go rims kyi tshul 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the rational order of these topics, the generation of the thought and so forth.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i don du gnyer ba ni gdams ngag tshol ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag la gnas pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba'i phyir dang / de nas sgrub pa'i chos gang la brten pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i don du gnyer ba ni gdams ngag tshol ba'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag la gnas pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba'i phyir dang / de nas sgrub pa'i chos gang la brten pa dang /
translated: The one who strives for the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment is the one who seeks the precepts, and the one who is established in the unerring precepts is the one who generates the factors conducive to insight.

original: gang la dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba gang yin pa dang / sgrub pa nyid gang yin pa ste rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba gang yin pa dang / sgrub pa nyid gang yin pa ste rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Then, there are four topics in the practice: the basis on which one relies, the object on which one focuses, the purpose, and the practice itself.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rab 'byor gyi le'u ste dang po'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rab 'byor gyi le'u ste dang po'o //
translated: This concludes the first chapter, the chapter on the knowledge of all things, in the treatise ‚ÄúOrnament of Clear Realization, A Commentary on the ‚ÄòOrnament of Mahayana Sutras.‚Äô‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The knowledge of all things has been explained.

original: // / @93a * //  da ni lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: // / @93a * //  da ni lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Now, the knowledge of the path is to be explained.üîΩIn this regard, first,

original: de la re zhig / lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to make the gods suitable vessels,

original: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //

original: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The word should is a remainder.

original: de la lha rnams mog mog por mdzad pa nyid ni lha'i ris thams cad kyi 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad pa gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la lha rnams mog mog por mdzad pa nyid ni lha'i ris thams cad kyi 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad pa gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therein, the obscuration of the gods is the statement that the light of all the god realms is obscured by the natural light of the Tathagata.

original: lha rnams kyi 'jig rten skyong ba nyid la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa thob par mngon par rlom pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi 'jig rten skyong ba nyid la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa thob par mngon par rlom pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
translated: It is for the purpose of dispelling the conceit of the gods that they are world protectors, etc., and have attained the dhyanas, etc.

analyzed: de bsal ba'ang de rnams rung bar bya ba'i don du yin te /
translated: And that dispelling is for the purpose of making them suitable,

original: ji skad du de rnams nyid las /
analyzed: ji skad du de rnams nyid las /
translated: as it is said in those very scriptures:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya //
translated: How should a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva abide in the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan pa nyan pa'i don du smras pa yin no //
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti said this in order to listen to the explanation of the perfection of wisdom in the context of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva.

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi 'od ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Here, natural light is the one arisen from karmic ripening.

original: yul so sor nges pa ni /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa ni /
translated: The restriction to a specific domain is

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as stated:

original: byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang / bstan pa'i skal pa med pa nyid kyis na lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang / bstan pa'i skal pa med pa nyid kyis na lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: For one who has not generated the mind of enlightenment, there is no opportunity to abide in the perfection of wisdom and to teach it. Therefore, the knowledge of the path belongs only to the bodhisattvas,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: not to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: zhes yul so sor nges pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: zhes yul so sor nges pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: This is stated in terms of the restriction to a specific domain.

original: / khyab pa ni lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: / khyab pa ni lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The pervasiveness is in terms of the knowledge of the path.

original: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs gcig pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa'i don dang / go rims dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi khyad par gyi don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nas brtsams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs gcig pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa'i don dang / go rims dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi khyad par gyi don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not partial, beginning with the generation of the thought, and it is taught with the meaning of pervasion and the meaning of the distinction of the person who possesses the order.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'on kyang gal te de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la rjes su yi rang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di sngar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du khyad par 'thad pa yin te
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la rjes su yi rang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di sngar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du khyad par 'thad pa yin te
translated: then this, ‚ÄúIf they also generate the thought of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I rejoice in that,‚Äù and so on, is tenable as a distinction from the perspective of one who is already free from attachment.

analyzed: / 'dis ni theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag @93b ba'i dgongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: This is the intended meaning of the presentation of the three vehicles.

analyzed: mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //

original: rang bzhin ni ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams 'bras bu dang lam gyi rtogs pa so sor nges pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams 'bras bu dang lam gyi rtogs pa so sor nges pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The nature is that the knowledge of the bodhisattva path is not like the paths of sravakas and so on, which are individually certain to realize the result and the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa spong ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rang gi ngo bo khyad par du 'phags pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa spong ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rang gi ngo bo khyad par du 'phags pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that its nature is superior in that it is the abandonment of all aspects of affliction.

original: byed pa ni ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu ni spangs pas rab tu phye ba dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i de rtogs ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa ni ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu ni spangs pas rab tu phye ba dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i de rtogs ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The function is that the result of the paths of sravakas and so on is distinguished by abandonment and the realization of the perfect end, but the bodhisattva does not realize that.

original: 'on kyang 'di'i lam shes pa nyid ni sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i lam shes pa nyid ni sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: However, it is said that the knowledge of the bodhisattva path is distinguished by the maturation of sentient beings and so on. This is the superior meaning of the result of its function.

original: mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the obscurations to the four bases of supernormal powers is finished.

original: // / da ni nyan thos kyi lam brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni nyan thos kyi lam brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the ≈õrƒÅvaka path,

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
translated: the method of knowledge of the pathüîΩis stated:üîΩThe ≈õrƒÅvaka should know this path

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //üîΩnyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: through the non-observation of aspects of the four noble truths.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / bu ga nam mkha' zhes byar brjod //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ; gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / bu ga nam mkha' zhes byar brjod //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe six elements, such as form and so on, and the links of dependent origination are brought to mind as possessing the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa 'dod pa dang ma 'dres pa'i don gyis mi rtag pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa 'dod pa dang ma 'dres pa'i don gyis mi rtag pa nyid dang /
translated: The meaning of not being mixed with the desire for the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rngu nyid dang / sdig pa nyid dang / pha rol nyid dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang / g-yo pa nyid dang /üîΩrab tu 'jig pa nyid dang / 'go nad nyid dang / 'tshe ba nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rngu nyid dang / sdig pa nyid dang / pha rol nyid dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang / g-yo pa nyid dang / rab tu 'jig pa nyid dang / 'go nad nyid dang / 'tshe ba nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the aspects of the truths of suffering and origination are: suffering, origination, universal cause, condition,üîΩproduction, dependence, arising,üîΩdisease, abscess, dart, calamity,üîΩsickness, tumor, affliction,üîΩenemy, impermanence,üîΩsuffering, emptiness,üîΩselflessness,üîΩcalamity,üîΩdisaster,üîΩchange,üîΩdisintegration,üîΩdisease,üîΩand affliction.üîΩ

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid nas zhi ba nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni sdug bsngal gyi bden @94a * //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid nas zhi ba nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni sdug bsngal gyi bden @94a * //
translated: The aspects of the truths of suffering and origination are the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, calm, disease, abscess, thorn, calamity, disaster, alien, disintegrating,

original: pa'i rnam pa'o //üîΩnad nyid ces bya ba nas sdig pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa'o // nad nyid ces bya ba nas sdig pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: illness, and plague.üîΩThe aspects of the truths of suffering and origination are the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: pha rol nyid dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la yang byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol nyid dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la yang byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspects of the truth of origination are the aspects of cause, origination, strong production, and condition.üîΩThe aspects of the truth of cessation are the aspects of cessation, pacification, excellence, and definite emergence.üîΩThe aspects of the truth of the path are the aspects of path, suitability, accomplishment, and definite release.

original: g-yo ba nyid dang rab tu 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba nyid dang rab tu 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúImpermanence‚Äù and ‚Äúdisappearance‚Äù are the aspects of detachment from each of those.

original: 'jig pa nyid dang 'go nad nyid dang 'tshe ba nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid dang 'go nad nyid dang 'tshe ba nyid ces bya ba ni de dag nyid so so la 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction,‚Äù ‚Äúchange,‚Äù and ‚Äúharming‚Äù are the aspects of cessation of each of those.

original: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lung ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lung ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the noble disciples are established in disgust, detachment, and cessation, as stated in the scriptures.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù means having the nature of arising and passing away.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams rjes su mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams rjes su mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering‚Äù means being unfavorable to things that have outflows.

original: de lta yin dang 'phags pa'i lam ni mi rtag pa yin yang zag pa med pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'di sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'phags pa'i lam ni mi rtag pa yin yang zag pa med pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'di sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then although the noble path is impermanent, it would not follow that it is suffering, because it is not disagreeable to the noble ones due to its being uncontaminated.

original: bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the absence of self‚Äù means that it is empty of self and other.

original: zhi ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnad nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro // nad nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is peace‚Äù means that it is not a self by its very nature.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is a disease‚Äù means that it is the root cause of suffering, like a seed that is the cause of a fruit.

original: 'bras nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is a boil‚Äù means that it is the origin of suffering.

original: zug rdu nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdig pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal brgyud pa rab tu byung ba nyid kyis shin tu 'joms pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zug rdu nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdig pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal brgyud pa rab tu byung ba nyid kyis shin tu 'joms pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is a thorn‚Äù means that it is the condition of suffering.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is a calamity‚Äù means that it is the cause of the continuity of suffering.

original: pha rol nyid ces bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: pha rol nyid ces bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù means the opponent.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la gnod par byed pa yod na 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la gnod par byed pa yod na 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe subject of destruction‚Äù means that when there is something that harms it, it is the subject of destruction.

original: yid byung ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid byung ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also the object of disgust, that is, the meaning.

original: g-yo ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMotion‚Äù means that it does not remain in its own nature.

original: rab tu 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúComplete destruction‚Äù means that it is naturally destroyed without depending on a cause.

original: @94b 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @94b 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is also the object of detachment.

original: 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù means that it is the object of harm from this and other things.

original: 'go ba'i nad nyid ces bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa'i gnod pas glags thob pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad nyid ces bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa'i gnod pas glags thob pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúDisease‚Äù means that one is vulnerable to harm from rƒÅk·π£asas and so on.

original: 'tsho ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúLife‚Äù means that one is vulnerable to harm from disturbances of the great elements, lightning, hail, and so on.

original: 'gog pa'i dmigs par yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dmigs par yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also tenable as the object of cessation.

original: yid la byed pa de rnams nyid kyis ma rig pa 'gog pa la bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed pa gsum ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de rnams nyid kyis ma rig pa 'gog pa la bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed pa gsum ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: With regard to the three aspects of the truth of cessation, the three mental contemplations of selflessness, peace, and isolation are the aspects of the truth of cessation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi ni gnag gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi ni gnag gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The four aspects of definite emergence are the four mental contemplations of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning, which are done by way of non-apprehending.

original: ji ltar nges par 'byung pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / gang nges par 'byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar nges par 'byung pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / gang nges par 'byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin pas so //
translated: And what is it that emerges? The unconditioned.

original: de rnams nyid kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the path are described in the passage beginning ‚ÄúThey cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,‚Äù

original: de rnams ni mya ngan ldas 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de rnams ni mya ngan ldas 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: because these lead to the attainment of the city of nirvana.

original: de dag nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspects of reasoning are described in the passage beginning ‚ÄúThey practice the transcendent perfections of generosity and so forth,‚Äù

original: ma lus par rtogs pa ni rigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ma lus par rtogs pa ni rigs pa yin pas so //
translated: because they are the means of attaining the result.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas bdag gi dang bral bar chos las so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas bdag gi dang bral bar chos las so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: Moreover, they practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, and they discern phenomena as being devoid of an intrinsic identity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'grogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dag dang mi 'grogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs pa nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'grogs pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dag dang mi 'grogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs pa nyid kyi ste /
translated: And the thought of the resolve for enlightenment does not accompany the thought of the dedication.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni phan tshun med @95a * //üîΩcing mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni phan tshun med @95a * // cing mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Because the thought of the resolve for enlightenment and the thought of the dedication are mutually absent and unapprehendable.

original: rtogs par byed pas na sgrub pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas na sgrub pa yin pas so //
translated: This is the aspect of accomplishment, because it is the accomplishment of the realization.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni sems ma yin pa nyid kyis dang / sems ma yin pa'ang sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid dang / 'di ltar sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni sems ma yin pa nyid kyis dang / sems ma yin pa'ang sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid dang / 'di ltar sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
translated: The thought of enlightenment and the thought of complete dedication are not thoughts, and it is not tenable that a non-thought is dedicated to a non-thought.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de 'ang sems ma yin te /üîΩde ltar so sor rtog pa mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de 'ang sems ma yin te / de ltar so sor rtog pa mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: In this way, whatever is not a thought is inconceivable, and whatever is inconceivable is not a thought.üîΩThus, the perfection of wisdom of non-apprehending discernment is just that.

original: mngon par zhen pa med par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byin pas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byin pas so //
translated: This is the aspect of definite release, because it is definite release that goes without apprehending.

original: nyan thos kyi lam gyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug gi rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam gyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug gi rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to /
translated: The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths as objects of the ≈õrƒÅvaka path have been explained.

original: // / de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag brjod par bya ba yin pa des na /
analyzed: // / de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag brjod par bya ba yin pa des na /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight, which are their prerequisites, are to be discussed.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
translated: The noble disciples on the path

original: gzugs sogs phung po stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po stong pa'i phyir //
translated: because the aggregates of form, etc. are empty,

original: stong pa nyid rnam dbyer med pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam dbyer med pas //
translated: because emptiness is undifferentiated,

original: dro ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dro ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: have been taught to be the heat.

original: drod ni koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: drod ni koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, form is empty of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And the emptiness of form and the emptiness of feeling, etc. are not dual and cannot be made dual.‚Äù

original: de dag mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pas /
translated: Because they do not apprehend those,

original: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: they are considered to be the summits.

original: ces bya ba ni koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should not abide in form by way of apprehending it.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
translated: Likewise, it is said that one should not abide in feeling, etc.üîΩThere, the acceptances are explained

original: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
translated: by the negation of abiding in the mode of permanence, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mir tag ces byar bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mir tag ces byar bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the view that form is permanent or impermanent, etc.

original: gzugs bde zhes bya ba nas smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du @95b gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsa bcu dag la brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya ba nas smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du @95b gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no // sa bcu dag la brtsams nas ni //
translated: One should not abide in the view that form is blissful, etc., up to the view that it is wishless, etc.üîΩThe supreme mundane right views are explained

original: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //üîΩchos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
analyzed: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis // chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
translated: by the extensive teaching of non-abiding, beginning with the ten stages.üîΩThe supreme mundane right views are explained by the extensive teaching of non-abiding, beginning with the ten stages.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The great bodhisattva should not abide in the first stage with the mode of apprehending it, up to

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that buddha-field of mine, even the sound of the word 'buddha' will not occur.

original: zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not abide in that way.

original: gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste / ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Up to: One should not abide in that way.üîΩWhat is the meaning of ‚Äúone should not abide in that way‚Äù?üîΩThe root text states:

original: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the Buddha, having known, did not see any phenomena.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, did not apprehend any phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what was stated.

original: nyan thos kyi lam bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam bshad zin to /
translated: The path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka has been explained.

original: // / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par bya ste /
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha should be stated.üîΩRegarding that, first:

original: de la re zhig / rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of self-realization,

original: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
translated: there is no need for teaching by another.

original: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of the rhinoceros-like

original: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
analyzed: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
translated: It is declared to be profound.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is the verse.üîΩThe verse is explained by the commentary.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The commentary explains the verse.

analyzed: de la gzhan gyis bstan ma dgos pa ni 'di yin te / ji skad du /

analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni skad kyi tshogs so //
translated: The verse is explained by the commentary.üîΩThe commentary explains the verse.

analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par @96a * // 'gyur ba'i dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase he spoke means that he spoke in this way.üîΩThe phrase he taught means that he taught in this way.üîΩThe phrase he fully taught means that he fully taught in this way.üîΩThe phrase he clarified means that he clarified in this way.üîΩThe phrase he indicated means that he indicated in this way.

translated: The phrase he pointed out means that he pointed out in this way.üîΩThe phrase he analyzed means that he analyzed in this way.üîΩThe phrase he commented means that he commented in this way.üîΩThe phrase he explained means that he explained in this way.üîΩThe phrase he revealed means that he revealed in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it clear means that he made it clear in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it evident means that he made it evident in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it manifest means that he made it manifest in this way.

original: de ni shes par rung gi //
analyzed: de ni shes par rung gi //
translated: The phrase he made it known means that he made it known in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it understood means that he made it understood in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it known means that he made it known in this way.üîΩThe phrase he made it understood means that he made it understood in this way.

analyzed: gnas brtan 'phags pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa dang / rab tu brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / nye bar ston pa zhes bya ba de la gsol ba btab nas ston pa ni 'chad pa'o //
