original: dris nas lan du smra ba ni rab tu brjod pa'o //üîΩgnyis po de nyid gdul bya rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: dris nas lan du smra ba ni rab tu brjod pa'o //üîΩgnyis po de nyid gdul bya rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase he made it understood means that he made it understood in this way.

original: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas ni nye bar 'ongs nas ston pa nyid kyis nye bar ston pa yin no //üîΩlha'i bu dag 'di ltar 'dir yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de zhes bya ba nas brtsams pas rab tu ston pa dang nyan pa bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas ni nye bar 'ongs nas ston pa nyid kyis nye bar ston pa yin no // lha'i bu dag 'di ltar 'dir yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de zhes bya ba nas brtsams pas rab tu ston pa dang nyan pa bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: But for the heedless, the Teacher himself teaches by coming near.üîΩThe passage beginning O sons of gods, it is thus: not a single letter has been uttered here refutes teaching and listening, because the perfection of wisdom and perfect enlightenment are without letters, as shown by the examples of a magical creation, a dream, an echo, and an illusion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dag ni sprul pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / sgyu ma'i dpe rnams kyis yi ge med pa yin pa'i phyir rab tu brjod pa dang nyan pa med pas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dag ni sprul pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / sgyu ma'i dpe rnams kyis yi ge med pa yin pa'i phyir rab tu brjod pa dang nyan pa med pas so zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said, Because there is no teaching and listening.

original: ji ltar na chos ston pa zhes bya ba yang yin la rab tu mi brjod pa'ang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos ston pa zhes bya ba yang yin la rab tu mi brjod pa'ang yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be that the teaching of the Dharma is not fully expressed?

original: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause for attaining the result of teaching the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi smon lam grub pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi smon lam grub pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: And also because of the fulfillment of the Buddha's vow.

original: chos ston pa ni brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par g-yeng ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la /üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba'ang rgyud mi zad par 'khrug par byed pa yin par dgongs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu brjod pa med par yang sems can gyi don
analyzed: chos ston pa ni brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par g-yeng ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la / rnam par g-yeng ba'ang rgyud mi zad par 'khrug par byed pa yin par dgongs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu brjod pa med par yang sems can gyi don
translated: Teaching the Dharma is by nature verbal expression, so it would be a great distraction.üîΩThinking that distraction would disturb the continuum of mind, theüîΩBuddha Bhagavat, when he was a bodhisattva, made the following aspiration: ‚ÄúWhen I attain buddhahood, may I be able to benefit sentient

original: byed nus par gyur cig ces de ltar smon lam btab pa yin no ;
analyzed: byed nus par gyur cig ces de ltar smon lam btab pa yin no ;
translated: beings without verbal expression, like a wish-fulfilling jewel.‚Äù

original: / tshig tu smra ba med par don ston pa'ang rung ba yin no //
analyzed: / tshig tu smra ba med par don ston pa'ang rung ba yin no //
translated: It is also possible to teach the meaning without speaking.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:üîΩWhatever meaning,

original: gang gang don ni gang gang la //
analyzed: gang gang don ni gang gang la //
translated: in whatever way,

original: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa //üîΩde de la don de dang de //üîΩsgra med kyang de de ltar snang //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa // de de la don de dang de // sgra med kyang de de ltar snang //
translated: is desired to be heard,üîΩthat meaning will appear to them in that way,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: even without words.

original: de la ye shes zab mo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ye shes zab mo ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the profound knowledge:

original: kye ma gnas @96b brtan rab 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: kye ma gnas @96b brtan rab 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The Lord said, Oh! The elder Subhuti is a clear expounder.

original: zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston pa phra babs kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston pa phra babs kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He teaches the profound, and what is beyond the profound, and he penetrates the subtle and what is beyond the subtle.

original: de la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nye bar bstan pa'i don mi rig pa ni shes ba zab pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nye bar bstan pa'i don mi rig pa ni shes ba zab pa yin la /
translated: Here, the elder Subhuti's non-understanding of the meaning of the teaching is the profundity of knowledge.

original: yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod pa ni brjod pa zab pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod pa ni brjod pa zab pa yin no //
translated: His not uttering a single syllable is the profundity of expression.

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyid rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rkyen nyid 'di la zab mo rjes su rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyid rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rkyen nyid 'di la zab mo rjes su rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so ;
translated: In another sutra, it is said, By oneself fully realizing and accomplishing these very paths of the ten virtuous actions, and by realizing the profound conditionality, one accomplishes the Pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: / bdag nyid gcig pu'i don te /
analyzed: / bdag nyid gcig pu'i don te /
translated: It is for one's own sake alone.

original: rgyu mtshan du gyur par byas nas rang nyid sangs rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan du gyur par byas nas rang nyid sangs rgyas pas rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Because one awakens by oneself, having taken that as the reason, one is a Pratyekabuddha.

original: nyan thos la'ang thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la'ang thal ba ma yin te /
translated: It does not follow for the Sravakas.

original: de ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on the teaching of another.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thal ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thal ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it follow that it is the perfect Buddha,

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems can thams cad kyi don ched du mdzad pas de rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems can thams cad kyi don ched du mdzad pas de rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to them by the performance of the aim of all beings through the mind of knowledge of all modes.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rtogs pa tsam gang yin pa dang / ji tsam pha yin pa dag gis rang gis kyang rdzogs par byang chub pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rtogs pa tsam gang yin pa dang / ji tsam pha yin pa dag gis rang gis kyang rdzogs par byang chub pa yin no //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas are fully enlightened by themselves through the mere realization and the extent of the realization.

original: de rnams kyi rtogs pa tsam yang gang zhig dang ji tsam zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtogs pa tsam yang gang zhig dang ji tsam zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mere realization of them and what is the extent of the realization?

original: gzung don rtog pa spang phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //üîΩrten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: gzung don rtog pa spang phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni // rten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: In order to abandon the concept of the object of apprehension, and in order not to abandon the subject of apprehension,

original: yang dag bsdus pa shes par bya ;
analyzed: yang dag bsdus pa shes par bya ;
translated: the path of the rhinoceros-like is to be understood as being well summarized.

original: / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse is to be understood.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa nas rgya cher rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin zab pa dang phra ba nyid 'gog pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa nas rgya cher rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin zab pa dang phra ba nyid 'gog pa /
translated: Because, in terms of their abandonment of the discriminations of apprehendeds, the profound and subtle natures of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, and so on, up to and including the knowledge of all modes, are refuted.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs par ston pa /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs par ston pa /
translated: It is taught that the Solitary Realizers have abandoned one part of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyan thos rnams las de rnams kyi rtogs pa khyad par du byed pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams las de rnams kyi rtogs pa khyad par du byed pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since their realizations are distinguished from those of the Hearers, it is said.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas pa la'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas pa la'o //
translated: In this Dharma teaching means in terms of the Solitary Realizers.

original: gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam zhes @97a * //
analyzed: gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam zhes @97a * //
translated: Are the imputational forms non-existent?

original: bya ba nas byang chub tu btags pa'am med dam zhes bya ba'i bar ni de dag gi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba nas byang chub tu btags pa'am med dam zhes bya ba'i bar ni de dag gi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Up to: Are the imputational enlightenments non-existent? Because of their abandonment of the discriminations of apprehendeds.

original: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med dam zhes bya ba ni rang nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med dam zhes bya ba ni rang nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or are the letters also not designated? means that one is oneself fully awakened.

original: gang dag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod pa nas rang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'dod pas bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lam shes pa nyid lam thams cad kyi yul can du brjod pa
analyzed: gang dag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod pa nas rang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'dod pas bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lam shes pa nyid lam thams cad kyi yul can du brjod pa
translated: From Those who wish to attain the fruit of stream-entry up to those who wish to attain pratyekabuddhahood should not fail to rely on this acceptance expresses path knowledge as the subject of all paths.

original: yin no // de rnams kyi 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yin no // de rnams kyi 'dzin pa po'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the absence of the conception of those who grasp them, it is said:

original: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste chos nyan pa de dag sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'dzin pa po dngos po med par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs su sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di'am 'di dang yang de mi 'gal bar ston pa
analyzed: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste chos nyan pa de dag sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'dzin pa po dngos po med par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs su sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di'am 'di dang yang de mi 'gal bar ston pa
translated: Since pratyekabuddhas do not realize that the apprehender is a nonexistent thing, it is said that they should train in the state of omniscience as an illusory person.

original: las brtsams te /
analyzed: las brtsams te /
translated: This is not contradictory to what was said above.

original: phung po la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'ang rmi lam lta bu dang sgu ma lta bur brjod pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'ang rmi lam lta bu dang sgu ma lta bur brjod pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is said that from the aggregates up to nirvana are like dreams and illusions, and why is that?

original: sgyu ma dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because illusions and nirvana and so on are not dual and cannot be made dual.

original: rtogs pa'i rten rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa len par byed par bstan pa rang sangs rgyas bstan pa'i don can dang / de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i stong pa nyid gnyis phan tshun du rtogs pa bkag pa nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rten rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa len par byed par bstan pa rang sangs rgyas bstan pa'i don can dang / de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i stong pa nyid gnyis phan tshun du rtogs pa bkag pa nas /
translated: The mutual realization of their form and so on and its emptiness is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gang yang ma brjod ma bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩji ltar chos 'ga' ma brjod ma bstan pa de ltar 'dir te rang sangs rgyas kyi skabs su len par byed pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rten gyi sbyor ba'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don med cing mi
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gang yang ma brjod ma bstan pa'i phyir te / ji ltar chos 'ga' ma brjod ma bstan pa de ltar 'dir te rang sangs rgyas kyi skabs su len par byed pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rten gyi sbyor ba'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don med cing mi
translated: Because no phenomenon is expressed or taught.üîΩJust as no phenomenon is expressed or taught, in the same way, in this context of the pratyekabuddhas, there is no one who takes it up.

original: dmigs so zhes ji skad du brjod pa de gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: dmigs so zhes ji skad du brjod pa de gsal bar byed do //
translated: This passage clarifies the statement in the section on the application of the support that the meaning of the word bodhisattva is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi @97b pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi @97b pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: In this perfection of wisdom, the three vehicles are extensively taught, namely

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgya cher bstan zhing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgya cher bstan zhing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Vehicle of the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: mi 'dod par thal bar rnam pa mang po byas pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mi 'dod par thal bar rnam pa mang po byas pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning, many undesirable consequences have been stated, and it is said, Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, it is just so. From the beginning,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar dag kyang bstan te de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang dag par grub pas dngos
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar dag kyang bstan te de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang dag par grub pas dngos
translated: up to the great bodhisattvas who are endowed with eloquence that is exalted and distinguished above all worlds, and that is also taught by the method of non-apprehension, the desired meaning is perfectly accomplished by the actualüîΩ.

original: por gyur pa'i rten med par rtogs pa'i chos thob par ston par byed pa dang / sprul pa'i me tog gi rnam pa nye bar 'god pa dang / me tog de dag kyang nges par ma skyes pa me tog ma yin pa nyid dang / gzugs nas brtsams pa'i chos thams cad nas /
analyzed: por gyur pa'i rten med par rtogs pa'i chos thob par ston par byed pa dang / sprul pa'i me tog gi rnam pa nye bar 'god pa dang / me tog de dag kyang nges par ma skyes pa me tog ma yin pa nyid dang / gzugs nas brtsams pa'i chos thams cad nas /
translated: and the teaching of the attainment of the Dharma that is realized without a basis that is transformed, and the arrangement of the forms of emanated flowers, and those flowers are definitely not produced, not flowers, and all phenomena from form on up toüîΩthe perfect Buddha are definitely not produced, not the perfect Buddha, and from that point on, the connection is made up to ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du nges par ma skyes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i bar dang de nas brtsams te zhes bya ba'i bar skabs kyi 'brel par byas pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi rtogs pa'i rten
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du nges par ma skyes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i bar dang de nas brtsams te zhes bya ba'i bar skabs kyi 'brel par byas pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi rtogs pa'i rten
translated: The basis for the realization of the Pratyekabuddha path is

original: yin no // de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: yin no // de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du byed do //
translated: the realization of the Pratyekabuddha path is distinguished from that of the ≈örƒÅvakas by the abandonment of the conception of the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa khyad par du byed do //
translated: The realization of the Buddhas is distinguished from that of the Solitary Sages by the absence of the conceptualization of grasping.

original: rigs kyis ni rtogs pa'i rgyu khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyis ni rtogs pa'i rgyu khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: The family is distinguished by the cause of realization.

original: da ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩbtags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
analyzed: da ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni / btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
translated: Now, with reference to the path of the Solitary Sages, he says:

original: ston pa'i rnam ba dro gyur pa //
analyzed: ston pa'i rnam ba dro gyur pa //
translated: The Elder Subhuti does not contradict the nature of the imputedüîΩand he teaches the profound reality.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what he says:üîΩ‚ÄúOh, the Elder Subhuti does not contradict the imputed and he teaches the profound reality with profound wisdom.‚Äù

original: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid zab mo ston pa ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba dang / koo shi gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid zab mo ston pa ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba dang / koo shi gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúKausika, form is merely an imputation.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba la @98a * //
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba la @98a * //
translated: What is merely an imputation is reality. Therefore, the Elder Subhuti teaches without contradiction.‚Äù

original: sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: The peak is the form, etc.

original: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye // zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: It is distinguished by the absence of decrease, etc.üîΩOne does not train in the increase or decrease of form, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that one does not train in the apprehension or non-apprehension of form, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: bzod pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa ni /
translated: The forbearing is

original: nang stong nyid la sogs pa yis //üîΩgzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa //
analyzed: nang stong nyid la sogs pa yis // gzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa //
translated: By the inner emptiness, etc.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The forbearing is because of the non-apprehension of form, etc.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid nas /üîΩdngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yongs su gzung ba med pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid nas / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yongs su gzung ba med pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that one does not train in the apprehension or non-apprehension of form, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes.üîΩThe supreme mundane qualities are

original: gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //
translated: The aspects of the non-production, etc. of form, etc.

original: rnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: The supreme mundane qualities are the aspects of the non-production, etc. of form, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong /
translated: One does not see the arising of form,

original: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel pa mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel pa mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one does not see the cessation, taking up, putting down, defilement, purification, etc., decrease, diminution, or increase of form.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bshad zin to //
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha has been explained.

original: mthong ba'i lam phan yon dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩbden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam pa bzhi yis //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam phan yon dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni / bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam pa bzhi yis //
translated: The path of seeing is explained from the point of view of its benefits.

original: lam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: lam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing is explained

original: phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do ;
analyzed: phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do ;
translated: together with its benefitsüîΩthrough four moments of acceptance and

original: / zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: knowledge of the truths.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag phan tshun gyi ngo bo yin pa dgag pa'i don du rnam grangs gzhan khas mi len pas gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag phan tshun gyi ngo bo yin pa dgag pa'i don du rnam grangs gzhan khas mi len pas gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The perseverance for knowing dharmas with regard to suffering is that which is stated for the purpose of refuting the identity of suchness and the Tathagata, since it does not accept other synonyms:

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Kausika, the Tathagata is not apprehended in the suchness of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The suchness of form is not apprehended in the Tathagata.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering is stated:

original: koo shi ka gzugs chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams @98b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chen po nyid de /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams @98b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chen po nyid de /
translated: Kausika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas is great because form is great.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: Kausika, the prior limit of form is not apprehended.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: The later limit is not apprehended.

original: dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The middle is not apprehended.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent cessation of suffering is as follows:

original: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Kau≈õika, this perfection is immeasurable because form is immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi tshad ma ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi tshad ma ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Kau≈õika, it is because the measure of form is not apprehended.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni gang gis rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni gang gis rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs 'jal ba'o //
translated: A measure is that by which one measures form that has the characteristic of change.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the subsequent cessation of suffering is as follows:

original: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: Kau≈õika, this perfection is immeasurable because form is immeasurable.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Kau≈õika, it is like this:

original: nam mkha'i tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The measure of space is not apprehended.

original: tshad ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug pa la rten pa'i dbyibs la brjod de /
analyzed: tshad ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug pa la rten pa'i dbyibs la brjod de /
translated: Dimension is said to be the shape based on the ultimate atom.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni tshad kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni tshad kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But those that are not material do not have the characteristic of dimension.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The forbearance of the knowledge of the teaching of origination is taught in the passage beginning:

original: koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas so //
translated: Kausika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is infinite because form is infinite.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Kausika, it is because the end and the middle of form are not apprehended.

original: 'dis ni rgyu bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu bkag pa yin no //
translated: This passage refutes the cause.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The perfection is infinite because the object of knowledge, i.e. omniscience, is infinite. This passage refutes origination.

original: chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni rab tu skye ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni rab tu skye ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The infinite perfections are taught in order to refute the arising of the dharmadhatu, because the dharmadhatu is infinite.

original: de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni rkyen bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni rkyen bkag pa yin no //
translated: The infinite perfections are taught in order to refute conditions, because suchness is infinite.üîΩThe infinite perfections are taught in order to demonstrate the patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the origination of suffering, for the sake of the realm of sentient beings, because sentient beings are infinite.üîΩThe patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the origination of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the origination of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sems can gyi khams kyi ched nyid du ston par byed pa yin no //üîΩkun @99a * //üîΩ'byung la chos shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sems can gyi khams kyi ched nyid du ston par byed pa yin no // kun @99a * // 'byung la chos shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to the origination of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the subsequent patience with regard to the origination of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe subsequent patience with regard to the origination of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the subsequent knowledge with regard to the origination of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe subsequent knowledge with regard to the origination of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the cessation of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the cessation of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the cessation of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe knowledge of dharmas with regard to the cessation of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the subsequent patience with regard to the cessation of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe subsequent patience with regard to the cessation of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the subsequent knowledge with regard to the cessation of suffering, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe subsequent knowledge with regard to the cessation of suffering is taught in order to demonstrate the patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the path, because the perfections are infinite.üîΩThe patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the path is taught in order to demonstrate the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the path, because the perfections are infinite.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to the path is taught in order to demonstrate the subsequent patience with regard to the path, because the perfections are infinite.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The subsequent patience with regard

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings, from not taking up and not putting down up to the knowledge of all aspects, is amazing.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / bar chad byed pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur bar yongs su gzung pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / bar chad byed pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur bar yongs su gzung pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is amazing that it is taken up in accordance with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / gzhan la rgya cher 'chad pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang mi 'bral ba de dag ni bdud sdig can la sogs pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang / gzhan la rgya cher 'chad pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang mi 'bral ba de dag ni bdud sdig can la sogs pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan pa dang /
translated: Those who hold, read, master, meditate on, explain extensively to others, and properly pay attention to this perfection of wisdom, and who are not separated from the thought of the knowledge of all aspects, cannot be taken advantage of by all the evil MƒÅras and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause they have well taken their stand on the emptiness of form.

original: de dag gis gzugs stong pa nyid la legs par gnas par gyur pas zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis gzugs stong pa nyid la legs par gnas par gyur pas zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid la glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid la glags mi rnyed de /
translated: Because emptiness does not find an opportunity in emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for the signless and the wishless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang gis gang la'ang glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang gis gang la'ang glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the intrinsic natures of those who would find an opportunity in something are non-existent.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir de rnams la mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir de rnams la mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang ste /
translated: Moreover, because they cultivate love, compassion, joy and impartiality with regard to all sentient beings, they are not harmed by humans, non-humans and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la tshad med pa rnams dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la tshad med pa rnams dgos pa yin te /
translated: In the eighth moment of the path of seeing, the immeasurables are necessary for bodhisattvas.

original: de lta yin na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas @99b 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de lta yin na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas @99b 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: If that is so, they would fall into cessation in the ninth moment, since they would not be concerned with the realm of sentient beings.

original: yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams la yang dag par bsten zhing bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams la yang dag par bsten zhing bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because they perfectly rely on and serve sentient beings through the perfection of generosity,

original: de rnams yang ba spangs pas dus byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams yang ba spangs pas dus byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they do not die from abandoning the vital winds.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: is the forbearance of the knowledge of dharmas with regard to cessation.

original: gzhan yang stong pa nyid thams cad shin tu bsgoms pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'jigs pa dang rengs par gyur pa la sogs pa med par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang stong pa nyid thams cad shin tu bsgoms pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'jigs pa dang rengs par gyur pa la sogs pa med par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said that they have no fear, paralysis, and so on, because they have thoroughly cultivated all emptinesses.

original: de la mi 'dod pa thog tu bab kyis dogs pa ni 'jigs pa'o ;
analyzed: de la mi 'dod pa thog tu bab kyis dogs pa ni 'jigs pa'o ;
translated: Fear is the apprehension that something undesirable will occur.

original: / de bsal ba'i thabs mi sgrub pa ni rengs pa'o //
analyzed: / de bsal ba'i thabs mi sgrub pa ni rengs pa'o //
translated: Paralysis is the failure to accomplish the means to dispel that.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to cessationüîΩis the forbearance of the knowledge of dharmas with regard to cessation.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Bhagavan said, ‚ÄúSubhuti, it is wonderful how the great bodhisattvas, upholding the perfection of wisdom, and so on,

original: theg pa gsum la sems can 'dul ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la sems can 'dul ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: train sentient beings in the three vehicles. This is most amazing.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is because the result of upholding the perfection of wisdom and so on is buddhahood.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚ÄùüîΩup to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚ÄùüîΩup to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung bas na zhes bya ba na brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung bas na zhes bya ba na brtsams te /
translated: up to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚ÄùüîΩup to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚Äù

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad bsdus pa nyid la sogs par gsungs pa yin no //

original: / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚ÄùüîΩup to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúBhagavan, in that way, by taking up this perfection of wisdom,‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: up to ‚Äúit is amazing how the knowledge of all aspects is taken up.‚ÄùüîΩThe acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessationüîΩis taught in the passage beginning, ‚Äú

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyes pa nas mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin pa'i bar du nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyes pa nas mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin pa'i bar du nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It pacifies faults such as attachment, aversion, and delusion, up to and including the apprehension of nirvana.

original: @100a * // rnam par 'phel par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @100a * // rnam par 'phel par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It does not cause them to increase.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni /üîΩphyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhas byas pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / nang gi bar chad kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhas byas pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / nang gi bar chad kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The Dharma knowledge of the path

original: bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar mdzad pa dang ldan pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar mdzad pa dang ldan pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: is endowed with the protection, guarding, and concealment of the buddhas of the world systems of the ten directions, which are made of divine substances, elements, and internal obstacles.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it increases virtuous dharmas such as the perfection of generosity up to and including omniscience in a manner free from apprehending them.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i brjod pa ni /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of subsequent knowledge with regard to the path is

original: bdag kyang srog gcod pa spong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag kyang srog gcod pa spong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: from ‚ÄúI will myself abstain from taking life‚Äù up to

original: bdag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: bdag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúI will myself abide in the knowledge of all modes,

original: gzhan gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing rjes su dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing rjes su dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and I will praise those others who abide in the knowledge of all modes and will rejoice in them.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni //
translated: Subsequent knowledge with regard to the path is

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe //
translated: when one practices the six perfections,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa sems can thams cad thun mong du byas shing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa sems can thams cad thun mong du byas shing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one will share one‚Äôs generosity and so forth with all sentient beings, and by way of nonapprehending dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This is what is being said.

original: mdo'i tshig lhug pa 'di tshigs bcad du byas pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig lhug pa 'di tshigs bcad du byas pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The following verses are a metrical version of the above prose:

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun brten pa rten med phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun brten pa rten med phyir //
translated: Suchness and the buddhas mutually support each other, but they do not support each other in a mutual relationship.üîΩThe buddhas are not accepted as being in a category, they are not accepted as being immeasurable, they are not accepted as being measureless, and they are not accepted as being limitless.

original: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad ma med bcas dang // tshad med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad ma med bcas dang // tshad med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: They are accepted as being in the form and so on of those who abide in that, as being certain to attain buddhahood, as being without acceptance and without rejection, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang ba yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang ba yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
translated: They are accepted as being love and so on, as being emptiness, as being the attainment of buddhahood, as being the complete inclusion of complete purification, and as being the removal of all distress and all disease.

original: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhing nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis srung la sogs //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhing nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis srung la sogs //
translated: They are accepted as being the field of the apprehension of nirvana, as being the protection of the buddhas and so on, and as being the protection of the bodhisattvas.

original: srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa //
translated: They are accepted as being the non-cutting off of the life force and so on, and as being the non-cutting off of the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: They are accepted as being the non-abandonment of the bodhisattva conduct, as being the non-abandonment of the bodhisattva levels, and as being the non-abandonment of the perfections.

original: @100b bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: @100b bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
translated: 1. Abiding in the self, establishing sentient beings in generosity and so forth,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //
translated: and dedicating to perfect enlightenment

original: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: are the moments of knowing the path.

original: mthong ba'i lam bshad zin to /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bshad zin to /
translated: The path of seeing has been explained.

original: // / da ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad par bya ba yin pas re zhig 'di'i byed pa brjod la /
analyzed: // / da ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad par bya ba yin pas re zhig 'di'i byed pa brjod la /
translated: Now the path of meditation is to be explained. So first its function is stated,

original: de nas 'di brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas 'di brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: and then it is to be explained.

original: 'di'i byed pa de'ang rnam pa drug tu rin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa de'ang rnam pa drug tu rin par bya'o //
translated: And that function is to be understood as sixfold.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩkun nas dul dang thams cad nas //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / kun nas dul dang thams cad nas //
translated: How so?üîΩ2. Complete self-control, victory over demons and afflictions,üîΩunshakability by harm,

original: bdud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang // gnod pas brjid ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang // gnod pas brjid ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //
translated: enlightenment, and worship of the supports.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du dul bar byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du dul bar byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Because it is stated from the perspective of complete self-control in all aspects,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang / nga rgyal ma chis par 'gyur ba'i don du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang / nga rgyal ma chis par 'gyur ba'i don du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the exclamation, How amazing!

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'dud pa'i byed pa ni rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad la'ang ngar rlom pa bkag pa'i phyir thams cad la 'dud pa'i don gyis na yongs su 'dud pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'dud pa'i byed pa ni rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad la'ang ngar rlom pa bkag pa'i phyir thams cad la 'dud pa'i don gyis na yongs su 'dud pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin
translated: The meaning of bowing in all ways is that, since pride is stopped in all aspects of thought, it is said, because of the meaning of bowing in all ways, it is present as a complete bow.

original: no // nyon mongs pa las nges par rgyal bar byed pa ni g-yul gyi nang du zhugs pa'i mi'i dpes 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa las rgyal zhing brjid ba med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar las nges par rgyal bas bsgom pa'i
analyzed: no // nyon mongs pa las nges par rgyal bar byed pa ni g-yul gyi nang du zhugs pa'i mi'i dpes 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa las rgyal zhing brjid ba med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar las nges par rgyal bas bsgom pa'i
translated: The meaning of victory over the afflictions is that, since one is victorious over all the hosts of desire and so on, one is victorious over all afflictions up to the middle of the path of meditation.

original: lam la slar bya ba med pa nyid du shes par byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lam la slar bya ba med pa nyid du shes par byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the very fact that one does not engage in activity on the path that is taught.

original: gnod pas brdzi ba med pa'i byed pa ni k'a khor ta dang // me dang / mtshon dang / chu la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi brdzi ba nyid la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pas brdzi ba med pa'i byed pa ni k'a khor ta dang // me dang / mtshon dang / chu la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi brdzi ba nyid la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The activity of not being overwhelmed by harm is taught by the fact that one is not overwhelmed by the harm of weapons, fire, water, etc.

original: k'a khor ta ni byang shar phyogs kyi mi ma yin pa'i rigs so //üîΩyang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byed pa ni /
analyzed: k'a khor ta ni byang shar phyogs kyi mi ma yin pa'i rigs so // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byed pa ni /
translated: KƒÅkhorda is a type of nonhuman being in the northeast.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par blta bar 'gyur ro zhes @101a * //üîΩbya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par blta bar 'gyur ro zhes @101a * // bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The activity of perfect complete enlightenment is taught by the fact that one does not apprehend any phenomena, and that one attains unsurpassed complete enlightenment and sees the minds of all sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten gyi yul mchod par bya ba nyid kyi byed pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten gyi yul mchod par bya ba nyid kyi byed pa ni /
translated: The activity of being an object of worship that is the basis of the perfection of wisdom is taught by the fact that one is an object of worship for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: yang snying po byang chub kyi sems shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rten gyi yul bar chad med pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: yang snying po byang chub kyi sems shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rten gyi yul bar chad med pa nyid yin no ;
translated: The essence of enlightenment mind is the object of the yoga of the perfection of wisdom, which is uninterrupted.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i ris thams cad kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i ris thams cad kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is what is said to be protected, guarded, and so forth by all the classes of gods.

original: byed pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: byed pa bshad zin to /
translated: The function has been explained.

original: // / bsgom pa'i lam la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / bsgom pa'i lam la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of cultivation also has two aspects:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the one with outflows is called the mental contemplation of aspiration, dedication, and rejoicing.

original: zag pa med pa'ang mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'ang mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one without outflows is the characteristic of accomplishment and the characteristic of complete purification.

original: gang gi phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa ni /
translated: The one that is the mental contemplation of aspiration is taught in the following lines:

original: mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: Aspirations are for one‚Äôs own benefitüîΩand for the benefit of others.

original: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya /
analyzed: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya /
translated: One‚Äôs own aim, the aim of others, and the aim of both oneself and others are to be understood as the three kinds of aim.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own aim, the aim of others, and the aim of both, should be understood as threefold.

original: rang gi don 'gog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi don 'gog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own aim is not rejected,

original: gzhan gyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid kyis de rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid kyis de rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: because it is fulfilled by not contradicting the aim of others.

original: de yang ni /
analyzed: de yang ni /
translated: And that is

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
translated: small, middling, and great,

original: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: each divided into three.

original: rang gi don gyi mos pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste gsum mo //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi mos pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste gsum mo //
translated: One‚Äôs own aim is threefold: small, middling, and great.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du gzhan dag la'ang brjod par bya'o //üîΩde la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ni gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du gzhan dag la'ang brjod par bya'o // de la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ni gang yin /
translated: The same should be said of the others, each in its own place.üîΩWhat is the small, middling, and great aspiration for one‚Äôs own aim?

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i bar yang gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i bar yang gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: And what is the small, middling, and great aspiration for the aims of others?üîΩIt is threefold,

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: divided into small of the small, and so on.

original: de yang rnam gsum /üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Each of the three aspirations for one‚Äôs own aim is threefold, divided into small of the small, middling of the small, and great of the small, and so on.

original: so sor zhes dkyus ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: so sor zhes dkyus ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúeach‚Äù refers to the three aspirations for one‚Äôs own aim.

original: rang gi don la sogs pa la chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi don la sogs pa la chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should understand that the object of one's own aim, etc. are of three types: small, medium, and great.

original: de ltar nang gi don la sogs pa 'di ni rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi don la sogs pa 'di ni rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, these nine types of internal object, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows:

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / @101b chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / @101b chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: small of the small, small of the medium, small of the great, medium of the small, medium of the medium, medium of the great, great of the small, great of the medium, and great of the great.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi don du mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don du mos pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba la'ang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi don du mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don du mos pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba la'ang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should also mention the types of aspiration for the object of one's own aim and the object of others' aims.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: thus,

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
translated: it is asserted that there are twenty-seven types.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: mos pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: mos pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma nyid yin no //
translated: Aspiration is the basic type.

original: de la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The small of the small interest in one's own aim is

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te bcangs la mchod pa bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod par byas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te bcangs la mchod pa bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod par byas na /
translated: when one writes out this profound perfection of wisdom, makes a book of it, bears it in mind, worships it, and when one puts the relics of a totally extinguished Buddha into a stupa made of the seven precious things and worships it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de rten du gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi sku mchod pa brnyes pa'i phyir dang po ches bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de rten du gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi sku mchod pa brnyes pa'i phyir dang po ches bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The first is said to be the cause of a much greater increase in merit, because the perfection of wisdom is the cause of the knowledge of all modes, and because by taking it as a basis one obtains worship of the Buddha's body.

analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring ni /
translated: The sixth type of lesser interest is to write out the scriptures and to keep them, and to make offerings,üîΩand to uphold them, and to read them, and to memorize them, and to understand them, and to explain them to others, but not to do so extensively.üîΩThe seventh type of lesser interest is to write out the scriptures and to keep them, and to make offerings,üîΩand to uphold them, and to read them, and to memorize them, and to understand them, and to explain them to others, but not to do so with a complete transmission.üîΩThe eighth type of lesser interest is to write out the scriptures and to keep them, and to make offerings,üîΩand to uphold them, and to read them, and to memorize them, and to understand them, and to explain them to others, and to do so with a complete transmission, but not to do so with a pure transmission.üîΩThe ninth type of lesser interest is to write out the scriptures and to keep them, and to make offerings,üîΩand to uphold them, and to read them, and to memorize them

original: yang koo shi ka khyod kyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ba byas te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba dang ldan pa 'di ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa'i dogs pa med pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa gsum pa gsal bar byed
translated: here, the one who is endowed with the application, is without doubt the stage of the Sravaka and so on, up to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This is the three-fold faith in the benefit for others, which is made clear by the word 'alone'.

analyzed: pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring ni /

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston par mdzad pa dang / chos smra ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ni 'di las byung ba yin pa'i phyir de gnyis kyang mi 'dra ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //

original: 'bring gi chen po ni /
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po ni /
translated: The great of the medium isüîΩthe passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of the five perfections.‚Äù

original: 'di la rab tu sbyor ba ni rgyal po la brten pa'i skyes bu'i dpes gang gis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa brnyes pa la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //

original: chen po'i chung ngu ni /

translated: The small of the great is

analyzed: chen po'i 'bring ni /

original: chen po'i chen po ni /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni /
translated: The great of the great isüîΩthe statement that the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Tathagatas and the teacher of the world.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

original: shing rnams lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng sna tshogs kyi grib ma'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa dgu pa yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i don gyisüîΩgang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shing rnams lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng sna tshogs kyi grib ma'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa dgu pa yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the sense of clarifying the ninth aspect of interest in the benefit for others.

analyzed: de la rang gi don la mos pa ni gzhan gyi don du @104a * //
translated: Interest in one's own goal is interest in the Dharma of the listeners and solitary realizers.üîΩüîΩ
