original: gsum pa ni sems can gcig gcig rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jog par byed pa ni 'dzam bu gling gi sems can de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas bsod nams mang du 'phel te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sems can gcig gcig rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jog par byed pa ni 'dzam bu gling gi sems can de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas bsod nams mang du 'phel te /
translated: The third is that the merit of establishing one sentient being in the result of stream entry is greater than the merit of establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because they are liberated and liberated from obscurations.

original: bzhi pa ni sems can gcig gcig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sems can gcig gcig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is that the merit of establishing one sentient being in the result of once return is greater than the merit of establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: lnga pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fifth is that the merit of establishing one sentient being in the result of nonreturn is greater than the merit of establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: drug pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod na zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod na zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is that the merit of establishing one sentient being in the state of an arhat is greater than the merit of establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: bdun pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig rang byang chub la bzhag na zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig gcig rang byang chub la bzhag na zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The seventh is that the merit of establishing one sentient being in pratyekabuddha enlightenment is greater than the merit of establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: brgyad pa ni 'dzam bu gling @104b gi sems can rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni 'dzam bu gling @104b gi sems can rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The eighth is that if one were to establish a single sentient being in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, that would be an increase in merit even greater than establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the result of stream enterer.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa yin no ;
translated: That is because it is for the sake of the continuity of the way of the Buddhas.

original: / de la sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: / de la sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: In this, the way of the Buddhas is the family of the Buddhas.

original: bstod pa cha dgu ni de bzhin du 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bstod pa cha dgu ni de bzhin du 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The nine parts of praise are just as it is said, ‚ÄúIf one were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the result of once-returner‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'di ni re zhig bstod pa'i cha dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bstod pa'i cha dgu pa yin no //
translated: This is the ninth part of the praise.

original: bkur ba yang cha dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bkur ba yang cha dgur shes par bya'o //
translated: Honor should be understood in nine parts.

original: de la bkur ba dang po ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bkur ba dang po ni 'di yin te /
translated: The first part of honor is this:

original: de bzhin du 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is said that the merit of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the fruit of non-returning is not even a hundredth of the merit of establishing a single sentient being in the fruit of a once-returner.

original: gnyis pa ni de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The second is said to be the merit of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the fruit of an arhat.

original: gsum pa ni de bzhin du rang byang chub la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de bzhin du rang byang chub la bzhag pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The third is said to be the merit of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the state of a pratyekabuddha.üîΩThe fourth is said to be the merit of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: bzhi pa ni gzhan yang 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur pa'i bsod nams pas glegs bam la bris nas gzhan la byin pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gzhan yang 'dzam bu gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur pa'i bsod nams pas glegs bam la bris nas gzhan la byin pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The merit of writing it out in a book and giving it to others and the merit of properly keeping it in mind is said to be much greater.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is what it means to keep it in mind properly.

original: byang chub la gnyis su spyod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub la gnyis su spyod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not to practice enlightenment in a dualistic way.

original: mi gnyis par spyod pa yang ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩlnga pa ni yang gnyis su med pa'i don gyis na don de ston pas bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnyis par spyod pa yang ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // lnga pa ni yang gnyis su med pa'i don gyis na don de ston pas bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fifth is the statement that this perfection of wisdom is to be taken up, to be expounded, and so on, by a mind which does not take it as dual, and which does not take it as non-dual.üîΩThe sixth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe seventh is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe eighth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.

original: drug pa ni yang don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan pa las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa bsod nams ches 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni yang don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan pa las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa bsod nams ches 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The ninth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe tenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe eleventh is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe twelfth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe thirteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe fourteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe fifteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe sixteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.

original: bdun pa ni yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams la nam 'tsho'i bar du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa bas /üîΩ'di @105a * //üîΩnyid don dang / yi ge ma nor bar 'chad cing ston par byed pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel te /
analyzed: bdun pa ni yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams la nam 'tsho'i bar du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa bas / 'di @105a * // nyid don dang / yi ge ma nor bar 'chad cing ston par byed pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel te /
translated: The seventeenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe eighteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe nineteenth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe twentieth is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe twenty-first is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The twenty-second is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as to the letters, one causes a great increase of merit.üîΩThe twenty-third is the statement that by teaching that meaning without error as

original: sangs rgyas de rnams ni 'di las nges par 'khrungs pa nyid kyis so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩbrgyad pa ni yang bskal pa grangs med gzhal du med par sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bas ltar bcos pa las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul du phyin ci ma log par ston
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams ni 'di las nges par 'khrungs pa nyid kyis so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // brgyad pa ni yang bskal pa grangs med gzhal du med par sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bas ltar bcos pa las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul du phyin ci ma log par ston
translated: Because those buddhas are definitely born from this.

original: par byed pa bsod nams ches mang du bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par byed pa bsod nams ches mang du bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The eighth is that a bodhisattva who practices generosity and so on for countless, immeasurable eons generates far more merit by teaching the perfection of wisdom unmistakenly in a way that does not objectify anything, in a way that is the opposite of the counterfeit.

original: bkur ba'i cha dgu pa ni yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bkur ba'i cha dgu pa ni yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can nas brtsams te /
translated: The ninth aspect of respect is that compared to establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the result of stream enterer,

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
translated: it is far more meritorious to establish the sentient beings of each of the ten directions‚Äô world systems, as many as the sands of the Ganges, in the result of stream enterer.

original: sems can gcig gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dzin du bcug cing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzhag pa ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gcig gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dzin du bcug cing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzhag pa ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the merit increases much more when one causes each and every sentient being to take up unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and establishes them in the irreversible stage.

original: bkur ba'i cha rnam pa dgu po bshad zin to /
analyzed: bkur ba'i cha rnam pa dgu po bshad zin to /
translated: The nine aspects of praise have been explained.

original: // / da ni bsngags pa'i cha rnam pa dgu po brjod par bya'o de la bsngags pa'i cha dang po ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: // / da ni bsngags pa'i cha rnam pa dgu po brjod par bya'o de la bsngags pa'i cha dang po ni 'di yin te /
translated: Now the nine aspects of praise should be stated. The first aspect of praise is this:

original: de bzhin du sems can de snyid cig kho na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can de snyid cig kho na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is like that, when one establishes just that many sentient beings in the result of once-returner.

original: gnyis pa ni de bzhin du sems can de snyed cig kho na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de bzhin du sems can de snyed cig kho na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The second is this: It is said that it is like that, when one establishes just that many sentient beings in the result of non-returner.

original: gsum pa ni sems can de snyed cig kho na dgra bcom pa nyid du zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sems can de snyed cig kho na dgra bcom pa nyid du zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The third is this: It is said that it is like that, when one establishes just that many sentient beings in the state of an arhat.

original: bzhi pa ni de bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na rang byang chub la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩlnga pa ni yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par bkod pa bas /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni de bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na rang byang chub la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // lnga pa ni yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par bkod pa bas /
translated: The fourth is the statement that it is the same for establishing that many sentient beings in solitary buddhahood.üîΩThe fifth is the statement that it is the same for establishing one sentient being in the irreversible stage,

original: sems can gcig gcig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gcig gcig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: compared to establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in unsurpassable, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: @105b drug pa ni de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i sems can de nyid la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @105b drug pa ni de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i sems can de nyid la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is the statement that it is the same for establishing the sentient beings of the four continents.

original: bdun pa ni de bzhin du stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de nyid la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni de bzhin du stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de nyid la bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The seventh is the statement that it is the same for establishing the sentient beings of a billion-world universe.

original: brgyad pa ni de bzhin du stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams de nyid la yang dag par bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni de bzhin du stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams de nyid la yang dag par bkod pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The eighth is just like that, but with the sentient beings of the second and third chiliocosms and the worlds of the ten directions.

original: bsngags pa'i cha dgu pa ni /
analyzed: bsngags pa'i cha dgu pa ni /
translated: The ninth part of the praise is:

original: yang 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
translated: Again, beginning with the Rose Apple Land,

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the sentient beings of each of the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges River, are all established in the irreversible stage.

original: phyir mi ldog pa de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang yang rung ba mngon par shes pa myur ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang yang rung ba mngon par shes pa myur ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba
translated: From among those irreversible ones, any bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who has swift higher knowledge and teaches the perfection of wisdom without error will have even more merit.

original: la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spro ba bskyad pa rnams la legs so legs so bsngags pa'i don yongs su gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spro ba bskyad pa rnams la legs so legs so bsngags pa'i don yongs su gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and the bodhisattvas who are encouraged are praised with the word ‚Äúexcellent.‚Äù

original: de ltar na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, these praises, etc. are characterized by the portion of understanding reality just as it is;

original: rig byed shes pa rnams kyis don brjod pa ni bstod pa yin no zhes smras pa ltar don brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed shes pa rnams kyis don brjod pa ni bstod pa yin no zhes smras pa ltar don brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not characterized by the expression of meaning, as some maintain that the Vedas are characterized by the expression of meaning.

original: yang kha cig na re chad phyed dang bzhi pa'i aom ni bkur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re chad phyed dang bzhi pa'i aom ni bkur ba yin no //
translated: Some say: The syllable Om is the first quarter of a half-verse.

original: zhes brjod pa de dag gi ltar na ni sgra'i tshangs pa ni dam pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu bkur ba yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de dag gi ltar na ni sgra'i tshangs pa ni dam pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu bkur ba yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then the Vedas would be characterized by the expression of the syllable Om, but that is not the case.

original: 'dir ni ji skad du brjod pa'i rtogs pa'i cha mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ji skad du brjod pa'i rtogs pa'i cha mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the Vedas are characterized by the portion of understanding just as it is, as described above.

original: bsngags pa'i dbang du byas nas snyan tshig gi rig byed pa yin par nga smra ste /
analyzed: bsngags pa'i dbang du byas nas snyan tshig gi rig byed pa yin par nga smra ste /
translated: I maintain that the Vedas are poetry composed by praising the Vedas.

original: mar lta bu'i tshig rjes su brjod pa gang yin pa de dag gi bsngags pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de dag gi ltar na yang sgrar gtogs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mar lta bu'i tshig rjes su brjod pa gang yin pa de dag gi bsngags pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de dag gi ltar na yang sgrar gtogs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: Those who say that the words such as ‚Äúmother‚Äù are praise are also saying that they are only sounds.

original: 'dir ni cha dgu pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni cha dgu pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid bsngags pa yin no //
translated: But here, praise is defined as a part of the realization of the nine stages.

original: cha ni yan lag ste cha shas zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ltar byas na mdo gzhan @106a * //
analyzed: cha ni yan lag ste cha shas zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar byas na mdo gzhan @106a * //
translated: A part is a member, that is, a portion.

original: gyi gleng gzhi de dang de dag las /
analyzed: gyi gleng gzhi de dang de dag las /
translated: Thus, in the various nidanas of other sutras,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa thams cad dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes gang gsungs pa de 'thad par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa thams cad dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes gang gsungs pa de 'thad par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: it is said that the Blessed One dwelt together with the bodhisattva mahasattva, the one praised, extolled, and lauded by all the buddhas.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa dang / bstod pa dang bkur ba dang / bsngags pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa dang / bstod pa dang bkur ba dang / bsngags pa bshad zin to /
translated: This is the explanation of the mental attentions of aspiration, praise, exaltation, and lamentation.

original: // / da ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: // / da ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Now, the mental attention of dedication is to be explained.

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: The special dedication

original: de yi byed pa'i mchog yin no //üîΩde ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: de yi byed pa'i mchog yin no // de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: is the best of its activities.üîΩIt has the aspect of being without reference

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //üîΩdben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do // dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
translated: and has the characteristic of being unmistaken.üîΩIt is the object of mindfulness of the natureüîΩof solitude, the accumulation of merit of the buddhas,

original: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: and the accumulation of wisdom of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the method, signlessness,üîΩrejoicing in the buddhas,üîΩnot belonging to the three realms,

original: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
analyzed: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
translated: and being small, middling, or great.

original: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The other dedications are of three kinds.

original: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
translated: They are of the nature of producing great merit.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de la bsngo ba'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bsngo ba'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The special dedication is as follows.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngos pa 'di nyid rabüîΩces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngos pa 'di nyid rab ces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The merit-making activities of generosity, etc. of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are surpassed by the dedication to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, which is done without apprehending anything.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is called the best, the highest, the foremost, and so on.

original: de la rab ces bya ba ni rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rab ces bya ba ni rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the best is twofold:

original: bstun pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi dam par gyur pa nyid dang / gnyis pa med pa nyid kyis na gnyis pa dang bral ba gtso bor gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstun pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi dam par gyur pa nyid dang / gnyis pa med pa nyid kyis na gnyis pa dang bral ba gtso bor gyur pa nyid do //
translated: It is the best due to being the highest, having the highest, and it is the foremost due to being free from a second, without a second.

original: de la dam par gyur par rab nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dam par gyur par rab nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the best due to being the highest is twofold:

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mchog nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis rab mchog yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mchog nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis rab mchog yin no //
translated: It is the best due to being the highest skillful means and due to being the perfection of wisdom.

original: gtso bo nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The principal itself is also twofold:

original: mnyam pa med pa nyid kyis phul du phyin pa dang / lhag pa med pas gong na med pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa nyid kyis phul du phyin pa dang / lhag pa med pas gong na med pa ste /
translated: it is preeminent, since it is unequaled, and it is unsurpassed, since it is without superior.

original: tshig bdun gyis de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: tshig bdun gyis de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pas so //
translated: This is indicated by the seven words, which show its special characteristics.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa ni yang sems can rnams @106b la theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston par byed pas rgyur gyur pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa ni yang sems can rnams @106b la theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston par byed pas rgyur gyur pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The function of the dedication is to be a cause for the teaching of the path of liberation through the three vehicles to sentient beings, and so it is said to be unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the cause for attaining the equality of the unequalled, that is, the equality of the Buddhas, and so it is said to be equal to the unequalled.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i rang dang gzhan gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i rang dang gzhan gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said to be equal to the unequalled because it is equal to the Buddhas.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication that has the aspect of nonapprehension is as follows:

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te /üîΩdam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / de yongs su bsdus pa dang / theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas pa dang / rnam par grol bar byas pa'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /üîΩrjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngos nas dngos po gang zhig yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te / dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / de yongs su bsdus pa dang / theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas pa dang / rnam par grol bar byas pa'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus te / rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngos nas dngos po gang zhig yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the first generation of the mind of enlightenment of all the buddhas of the ten directions,

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yongs su bsngos pa legs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam par yongs su bsngos pa legs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The dedication that is excellent because it is non-apprehending, following on the non-substantiality of all things, is indicated by the words well-directed, etc.

original: de la dngos po ni rigs so //
analyzed: de la dngos po ni rigs so //
translated: Therein, substance is the class.

original: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The object is all things.

original: byang chub kyi ched du bya ba'i sems ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi ched du bya ba'i sems ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought that is directed toward enlightenment is the discriminating thought that grasps.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are non-attachment, etc.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni sems pa'o //üîΩzad pa ni bsags pa rnam par 'jig pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni sems pa'o // zad pa ni bsags pa rnam par 'jig pas so //
translated: The meritorious work is the thought.üîΩThe exhaustion is the destruction of the accumulation.

original: 'gags pa ni rgyun gyis 'jig pas so //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni rgyun gyis 'jig pas so //
translated: The cessation is the destruction of the continuity.

original: bral ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pas so ;
analyzed: bral ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pas so ;
translated: The separation is the destruction by nature.

original: / rnam par gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'jig pas so //
analyzed: / rnam par gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'jig pas so //
translated: The transformation is the destruction by transformation.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication that has the characteristic of non-error is indicated by the wordsüîΩthe dedication that is well-directed, etc.

original: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin no //
analyzed: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin no //
translated: The reality of the mind by which one dedicates is also that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar chos thams cad @107a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad @107a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause all dharmas are empty of essence.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes gang gsungs bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes gang gsungs bzhin no //
translated: This is as stated.

original: dben ba'i gnas su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: dben ba'i gnas su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication in a secluded place is as follows:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de phung po la sogs pas dben par shes te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de phung po la sogs pas dben par shes te /
translated: If the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva knows that the activity of merit to be dedicated is empty of the aggregates, etc.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: Starting from here,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bos dben par shes te zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bos dben par shes te zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to knowing that all the qualities of the Buddha are empty of their own nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i rang bzhin dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i rang bzhin dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication of the recollection of the nature included in the family of the roots of virtue of the qualities of the Buddha is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rigs gang dag yin pa dang / rang bzhin gang yin pa de bzhin du bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de yongs su bsngo bar byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rigs gang dag yin pa dang / rang bzhin gang yin pa de bzhin du bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de yongs su bsngo bar byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue of the Buddhas are of such and such a kind, and of such and such a nature.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication of skill in means is

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chen pos thabs la mkhas pa de dag la bslab par bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chen pos thabs la mkhas pa de dag la bslab par bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúHere, the great bodhisattva should train in those skills in means, etc.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /üîΩkha zas dug dang bcas pa'i dpes mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyis yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni / kha zas dug dang bcas pa'i dpes mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyis yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication free of signs is

original: dug can zug rdu can te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dug can zug rdu can te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe dedication of those who have the perception of signs is like poisoned food, like a dagger in the heart, etc.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication approved by the Buddhas isüîΩas stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe Buddhas, the Lords, approve of the dedication of the bodhisattvas, the great beings.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bla na med pas mkhyen pa de bzhin du yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bla na med pas mkhyen pa de bzhin du yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as those Bhagavat Buddhas know with their unsurpassed Buddha-cognition, so do I dedicate.

original: khams gsum du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication that is not included in the three realms is as follows:

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those roots of virtue should be dedicated in this way:

original: ji ltar gzugs khams gsum gyi khongs su chud pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs khams gsum gyi khongs su chud pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as form is not included in the three realms, and so on.

original: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i bsngo ba yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i bsngo ba yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The dedication that produces great merit is also threefold, distinguished as lesser, middling, and great.

original: de la chung ngu ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la chung ngu ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas brtsams te /
translated: Among them, the lesser is from the beginning of the ten virtuous actions,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa la gnas pa /
translated: up to the five higher perceptions, and abiding in mundane realization.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten @107b gyi khams kyi sems can gyi dpes yongs su bsngo ba 'di bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa'o //üîΩ'bring ni yang de snyad cig kho na rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten @107b gyi khams kyi sems can gyi dpes yongs su bsngo ba 'di bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa'o // 'bring ni yang de snyad cig kho na rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
translated: The merit of the dedication that uses the example of the sentient beings of the trichiliocosm increases much more than that.üîΩThe middling is the merit of the dedication that uses the example of the merit of the service, worship, and so on, of as many stream-enterers as there are sentient beings in the trichiliocosm,

original: dgra bcom par gyur pa la bkur sti dang / mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes /üîΩbsod nams 'di snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom par gyur pa la bkur sti dang / mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes / bsod nams 'di snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the merit of the service, worship, and so on, of as many arhats as there are sentient beings in the trichiliocosm.üîΩThe great is the merit of the dedication that uses the example of the merit of the worship of each sentient being in the world systems of the ten directions by each sentient being in the trichiliocosm,

original: chen po ni sems can de snyed kho na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams re res mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams
analyzed: chen po ni sems can de snyed kho na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams re res mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams
translated: the merit of the dedication that does not observe the sentient beings of the trichiliocosm as the sentient beings of the trichiliocosm,

original: snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te /
translated: and so on, as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: All of these are due to the very non-apprehension of them.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bshad zin to /
translated: The mental attention of dedication has been explained.

original: // / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the mental attention of sympathetic joy,üîΩit is said:üîΩSympathetic joy in the roots of virtue

original: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //üîΩrjes su yi rang yid byed pa //üîΩsgom pa yin pa 'dir brjod do //
analyzed: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis // dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba // rjes su yi rang yid byed pa // sgom pa yin pa 'dir brjod do //
translated: through means and non-apprehensionüîΩis said to be the cultivation

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: of mental attention of sympathetic joy here.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rjes su yi rang ba rab tu 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rjes su yi rang ba rab tu 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúHow is there the highest sympathetic joy?‚Äù and so on, up to:

original: thabs la mkhas pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThrough skill in means, one should dedicate those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a manner of non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: de la mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: By the attention of faith, one accumulates merit like a lump of gold from a mine.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas ni gser mgar gyi rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas ni gser mgar gyi rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
translated: By the attention of dedication, one makes it into an ornament like a goldsmith.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams bya ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams bya ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob bo //
translated: By the attention of rejoicing, one obtains the equality of one's own and others' merits.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bshad zin to /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bshad zin to /
translated: The contaminated path of cultivation has been explained.

original: // / zag pa med pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / zag pa med pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The uncontaminated path should be mentioned.

original: de las kyang mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de las kyang mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: And from that, with regard to the characteristic of accomplishment,üîΩthe application is stated:

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: Its nature is the highest

original: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //üîΩ@108a * // chos rnams dmigs pa med par ni //
analyzed: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed // @108a * // chos rnams dmigs pa med par ni //
translated: and it is not manifest in all.üîΩThe great meaning isüîΩthe nonapprehension of phenomena.

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
translated: Its nature is the highest

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and it is not manifest in all.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The great meaning isüîΩthe nonapprehension of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pas na snang bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pas na snang bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is very pure, and so it illuminates.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ston par byed pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ston par byed pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: up to ‚Äúit is good that you have revealed the nature of all phenomena,‚Äù

original: sbyor ba de ni ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin par gsal bar byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin par gsal bar byed pa yin pas so //
translated: because that application is clarifying the nature of wisdom.

original: mchog nyid ni dmus long mang po'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par lam shes pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por 'gro ba'i nus pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni dmus long mang po'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par lam shes pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por 'gro ba'i nus pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The supremacy is stated by the example of many blind people, that without the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections are unable to enter into the knowledge of paths and to go to the great city of omniscience.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni /
translated: The non-conditioning of all phenomena

original: gzugs mngon par sgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzugs mngon par sgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: is stated beginning from ‚Äúbecause form is not accomplished,‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because all dharmas are non-arisen,‚Äù and so on up to, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because all dharmas are non-compounded.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad dmigs pa med pas mngon par rtogs pa gtod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs pa med pas mngon par rtogs pa gtod par byed pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of all dharmas is the establishment of realization.üîΩThis is the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is the establishment of realization because all dharmas are non-apprehended,‚Äù and so on up to, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is the establishment of realization because all dharmas are non-arisen.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar rnams gang yang gtod par mi byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'i bar dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar rnams gang yang gtod par mi byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'i bar dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam par nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis ming ji lta ba dang mtshan ma ji ltar gtod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam par nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis ming ji lta ba dang mtshan ma ji ltar gtod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the non-apprehension of all dharmas that is the establishment of the name and the establishment of the sign.

original: de la ming ni ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni ming du btags pa'o //
translated: Therein, name is the designation.

original: mtshan ma ni de 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni de 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Sign is the cause that engages it.

original: gtod pa ni gtod pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis kyi 'du shes de las ring du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pas des so sor thob bar byed pa nyid kyis so //üîΩdon chen po nyid ni /
analyzed: gtod pa ni gtod pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis kyi 'du shes de las ring du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pas des so sor thob bar byed pa nyid kyis so // don chen po nyid ni /
translated: The dedication is the dedication itself, which is the thorough dedication of the transcendences to perfect enlightenment, and the dedication of the transcendences to the attainment of the transcendence of wisdom by all beings.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du che ba dang chung bar byed pa bkag pa nas brtsams te /

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis dbyer med gcad du med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bdag dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis dbyer med gcad du med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bdag dang /
translated: The purity of desire, hatred, and ignorance, and the purity of form, etc., are not two, nor are they divided.

original: sems can dang / srog la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the purity of self, sentient beings, living beings, and so on, and the purity of form, etc., are not two, nor are they divided.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig rnam par dag pa ni /

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o //

analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

original: ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //

translated: The purity of the paths of the three vehicles of the bodhisattvas is taughtüîΩbeginning from the passage that states,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, moreover, the perfection of morality is pure because the perfection of generosity is pure, and so on up to the purity of the qualities of the Buddha and the purity of omniscience are nondual and so on.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin te /

original: de la mtha' ni cha'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' ni cha'o //
translated: The end of that is the limit.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is twofold:

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dus kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dus kyi mtha'o //

original: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po'i mtha' @110a * //
analyzed: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po'i mtha' @110a * //

analyzed: las 'das pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu chos kyi sku brnyes pas dus kyi mtha' las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: And it is beyond the limit of time because it always obtains the dharmakƒÅya.

original: mtha' las brgal ba dang mtha' las shin tu song ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: mtha' las brgal ba dang mtha' las shin tu song ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: It is called ‚Äúbeyond the limit‚Äù and ‚Äúgone to the other side of the limit.‚Äù

original: mtha' las 'das pa ni chos kyi dbyings la brjod la /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa ni chos kyi dbyings la brjod la /
translated: The limit is said to be the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de la yod pas na shin tu ba'o //
analyzed: de la yod pas na shin tu ba'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúgone to the other side‚Äù because it exists there.

original: de'ang 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'i sa dgu po rnams la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgu'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam chung du'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgur phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'ang 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'i sa dgu po rnams la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgu'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam chung du'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgur phye ba yin no //
